story:
Click Here for English!

Un simulador con contenido histórico

Cuando lees un buen libro (cuento o novela), te quedas con la sensación de haber vivido las experiencias de sus personajes.  Cuando ves una buena película, te quedas con las impresiones audiovisuales seleccionadas por el director.  ¿Que tal si pudieras hacer ambas cosas a la vez, pero creando tu propia historia?:

  • HardCore Games, ha diseñado el último simulador de vida y muerte medieval.
  • Sin embargo, llevar ese diseño a la realidad cuesta una cantidad importante de dinero.
  • La mayor parte del dinero se invertirá en pagar a los profesionales que crearán los modelos 3D, música, animaciones y programación de funciones.

Con tu apoyo podremos sacar adelante un proyecto que no sólo te entretendrá.  También te enseñará historia y te permitirá hacer dinero, jugando.

Nuestra meta

Tras desmenuzar el proyecto en sus partes más pequeñas, se ha logrado estimar que serán necesarias más de 1500 tareas, entre programación de basede datos; lógica de juego; Inteligencia Artificial; Modelos 3D; Animaciones; Música y arte de todo tipo.

Esas 1500+ tareas implican alrededor de 8500 horas de esfuerzo.  Dependiendo la compliejidad de la tares y las horas de esfuerzo se ha calculado un costo por tarea y para todo el proyecto.  A este monto debe sumarse la adquisición de las licencias para el software y la subscripción al servicio de Cloud Networking que ha de resolver la etapa temprana del entorno multiplayer.

Si no puedes colaborar con dinero, por favor apoya la causa con la creación gratuita de tu usuario en el sitio HardCore Games  Con lo cual, aun si no llegásemos a la meta económica, tendríamos la inversión inicial del desarrollo y nos sería más fácil conseguir el fondo complementario, sobre la base de una colectividad de usuarios que está esperando este videojuego.

Hagamos la diferencia

Es cierto que los videojuegos están relacionados con la violencia.  Pero no siempre tiene que ser así.

Religare Iberia es la apuesta a un simulador que ciertamente te ofrece la oportunidad de celebrar batallas, espada en mano! Sin embargo, también te enseña que el camino del progreso está en la tolerancia.

  • Arma tus partidas de guerreros con reclutas de diferentes religiones.
  • Apoya a ciudadanos de otras religiones por recompensas más valiosas.
  • Decide sabiamente y disfruta del crecimiento de tu personaje.


Características únicas del simulador

  • En lugar de escoger entre facciones exóticas, podrás seleccionar entre ser un Cristiano, un Musulmán o un Judío en la España medieval.
  • El reto de recrear la geografía de la península Ibérica, nos ha llevado a diseñar un sistema de rutas y desvíos, con los cuales podremos simular el extenso territorio con el uso de unos cuantos GigaBytes de memoria en disco.  De hecho, el plan es lanzar, a futuro un Religare Full, en el cual podremos viajar desde España hasta Tierra Santa; desde Marruecos hasta Moscú.
  • Planifica con cuidado cada movimiento, porque cada acción consume tus recursos. El jugador deberá atender las necesidades básicas de su personaje y las de sus seguidores: Hambre, sed, cansancio, excresiones, etc.  Cualquier parecido a un Tamagochi es mera coincidencia.
  • Todas las necesidades de los persojanes pueden satisfacerse, bien sea en la naturaleza o a través de negocios que brinden diversos servicios.  Tu puedes regentar uno o varios de esos negocios.  Con lo cual, podrías hacer dinero vendiendo cerveza, por ejemplo!
  • Una vez hayas alcanzado cierto renombre, podrás crear tu propio escudo heráldico que podrás luego incorporar a tus vestiduras, las vestiduras de tus seguidores o los caballos que los acompañan.
  • El sistema de combate requerirá de gran pericia en el manejo real de las armas.  Pero tranquilo, existirá también un modo de creación de combos, con el que podrás programar los movimientos de tu personaje. Luego podrás invocar esos combos con sólo un botón.
  • El romance viene incluido. A través de la interacción con los NPC de cada pueblo, tu personaje irá cultivando amistades que paulatinamente, podrán evolucionar hasta el máximo nivel. Sí, lo que entendiste.
  • Un sistema de generación dinámica de misiones hace practicamente inagotable la fuente de aventuras.
  • Si no quieres arriesgar el pellejo en la carretera, pero deseas practicar tus habilidades guerreras, podrás inscribirte en torneos o justas al mejor estilo medieval.  Aquí también se puede hacer dinero.
  • Si tienes un caballo veloz, inscríbelo en los circuitos moros de carreras.
  • Como si todo lo anterior fuera poca cosa, también tendremos competencias al estilo Amazing Race, en las que tendrás que ir uniendo pistas, de pueblo en pueblo, hasta dar con el sitio donde reposa el premio final. Los premios finales pueden ser bolsas de dinero, bulas papales o reliquias religiosas que confieren gran poder a sus portadores.
  • Y mucho más por venir ...

    • ¿Que sigue?

    Con tu aporte nó solo recibirás una bolsa con monedas de oro virtuales que podrás invertir en tus personajes del mundo medieval, pero de todos los demás simuladores que HardCore Games aun tiene planeado publicar.

    También recibirás artículos promocionales que te recuerden que estamos trabajando en tu proyecto.

    Cada semana, durante y tras concluír la campaña estaremos publicando los avances del desarrollo del simulador.  Podrás ser parte activa de su creación, aportando ideas o cuestionando nuestras decisiones.

    Hagamos este proyecto juntos!

    Recuerda que el final de esta campaña es sólo el comienzo de un proyecto épico, del que sólo aquellos que creyeron en él desde el principio podrán formar parte.

    English

    An historic content simulator

    When you read a good book (Tale or novel), you keep the exciting of those experiences lived by its characters. When you watch a good movie, you keep for yourself those impressions created by the director's view and the editor's cut.  What if you can do both things at the same time while living your own story?:

    • HardCore Games, has designed  the ultimate medieval life and death simulator.
    • However, bringing this world to life demands an important sum.
    • Main part of the money goes to the freelancers who are going to accomplish most of the requiered tasks, such as 3D modeling, animation, music, programming and so on.

    With your support we'll be launching a simulator that will do a lot more than just entertain. We'll teach history while allowing all players to make some money out of their playing activity.


    Our Goal

    With the use of the PMI methodology, we've been able to breakdown the whole project into its more basic tasks.
    More than 1500 task consuming more than 8500 effort hours to include Artificial Intelligence; 3D modeling; Animations, Music & Sound Integration among others.

    Depending on the task complexity and its duration, all of them have beeing estimated into a whole budget.  The partial result, needs to be complemented with licensing costs, networking service subscription, marketing and laws handling.

    However, if you can't help with money, its ok.  You can still support this great idea by just creating your free HardCore Games user at our web portal.  With the amount of interested players, we can chase the rest of the funds needed to complete the project.

    Let's make the difference

    It's true that videogames have long beeing related to violence.  But it doesn't have to be like this for ever.

    With Religare Iberia we bet on a simulator that can teach the way of tolerance in a world ruled by the sword!

    • Build your best mixed warband with recruits from all religions.
    • Help citizens from another religions for an increased amount of piety.
    • Choose wisely and enjoy the growth of your character.


    Unique simulator features

  • Instead of exotic factions, you can choose from being a Christian, a Muslim or a Jew in the medieval Spain.
  • The challenge to re-create the huge Iberian Peninsula landmass drove us to design a system based on routes and detours which will simulate the real extension of a country.  In fact, this same system will be used to create the whole ancient world in the game expansions. In there, we'll be able to travel from Spain to Holy Land; from Morocco to Moscow and beyond.
  • Plan carefully your movements for all actions consume valuable resources.  Each player will have to attend the needs of his/her character and its followers: Hungry, thirst, tiredness, depositions, among others.
  • All those needs can be satisfied on the wilderness or through town business. You can run any one of those business.  Imagine yourself making money by selling beer!, for instance.
  • Once your character has grown a big name, you'll be able to customize your own coat of arms and wear it on your character, your followers and even their horses.
  • The combat system will require a great skill on real weapons handling.  But, dont worry. We've designed a make your own combo system to program a set of moves.  Later, you'll call those sequences by the hit of just one button.
  • Love is in the air: Through the daily interaction of your character with the worlds NPCs, he/she will develope a friendship that eventually will reach the final level, if you know what I mean.
  • A dynamic quest giver system will ensure that adventure never ends.
  • If you dont wan't to risk your neck on the road, but are willing to prove your worth in a battle, get yourself into a torunament in a very medieval style.  It could get you some money too.
  • If you have a fast horse, register it into an arabic horse race.  Prizes here, are good as well.
  • If all of the above doesn't hooke you, we'll have Amazing Race style competitions where you'll have to fight every step of the way, from town to town, linking clues towards the place where you'll find your fat reward. Final prizes may come in the form of a money bags, a Papal bull or a relic which embodies great power to its owner.
  • And there is a lot more coming ...

    • What's next?

    With your support, you'll get a bag with virtual gold coins, spendable on any of the HardCore Games worlds.  You can also get promotional goods to remember you that we're working in your project.

    During this campaign and throughout the rest of the project, you'll receive access to our forum with news and advances of the game.  Your ideas and constructive critics will be more than welcome.

    Lets build together, this game!

    Remember.  The end of this campaign is only the begining of the epic project on which only those who believed in it from the start, will be an organic part.

story:
The BavelTravel project:

  • A new kind of online game
  • A strategic, high fidelity simulation of traveling
  • Optimal combination of fun and learning
  • Want to visit Paris, Rio de Janeiro and even Vanuatu without leaving your home?
  • There is a plenty of various travel tasks for you to perform (monthly changed)
  • Try to create them yourself too!
  • All you need is any device connected to the Internet with web browse
  • You can play on computer, tablet, smartphone, console and even Smart TV
  • Nothing to install – everything is online
  • Simple navigation, simple rules
  • You compete or cooperate with others, the choice is yours
  • You can create "electronic postcards" from visited places
  • You can buy souvenirs with "strength" ☺
  • You can share your results in the social media
  • The game is constantly evolving. Even during writing of this text, concepts such as hitchhiking and SOLVER have been developed.
  • You can play for FREE and win PRIZES

Interested? Time to start your virtual journey...

 

May 1, 2020, Bamako, Mali

In the morning a mop guy woke me up. He started to poke me and speak something in his own way. What language does he speak? I understood only "aller, aller", what in French means go or faster. Fortunately, his gestures cleared my doubts. I jumped out of the uncomfortable plastic bench and fell nearly on the wet floor tangled in the straps of my own backpack.

It turned out that I was at the airport in Bamako, in Mali and I do not really remember how I got here. As I left outside, I was struck by the heat. Macabre! I am in Africa only a few days and my body has not yet adjusted to the heat. I'm wet all the time, the sun is so sharp, even the dark sunglasses does not help much, and on my skin, I feel as if someone is stabbing a million thin pins in it. Well, I have to survive, somehow. I have some memory loss, maybe it's the case of a solar stroke?

 

It's a fragment of a traveler's diary that describes one day of his hero's journey. It would be nice to be able to write such a relationship of your own experiences...

Traveling is one of our most common dreams, we like to talk about travel and share experiences.But...

What do you think about traveling?

When we think of an influx of extra cash (e.g., banished on a lottery, higher than the usual bonus, the completion of a long work), travels are almost always being on our list of planned expenses. When we are overworked, we would mostly like to go somewhere. We often want to visit "warm countries", we also dream of traveling around the world. Or maybe a short break in Rome, to see how people lived in the times of the emperors and a quick look at the Vatican.

 

It usually ends with a trip to the hotel e.g. in Greece and laze on the beach for a week or two. More active travel remains in the sphere of dreams because:

  1. They cost too much and just exceed your financial capacity...
  2. If we have money, we have no time...
  3. It would be nice to fly somewhere far away, but we are afraid to fly...
  4. We do not have anyone to go with...
  5. We do not speak foreign languages...
  6. We do not know the customs of the people in the countries we want to visit... We do not want to be ridiculous in the eyes of the natives...
  7. We fear diseases, thefts, robberies, terrorists...
  8. We do not like touts, beggars... We do not like to be hounded and forced to get rid of money...
  9. We do not really know what and where we can see and generally how to spend time...
  10. We are afraid that we will be able to handle this...

Only obstacles...

Let me show up at this place (a middle-aged guy, who has seen something in his life and knows a bit, from not so rich (in terms of available funds) European country), with the concept of an unusual online game "BavelTravel" that allows you to virtually travel around the world without these obstacles. 

This is not a real journey but its high fidelity simulation. but:

  1. Forget about costs – you play completely free. You can buy some facilities to increase your chances for better result (up to $4.99 per month).
  2. No doubt you will find some time. You can break the game any time and then continue from the break point.
  3. You fly virtually, so fear disappears. The effect of clogged ears and time shift too.
  4. To play the game you only need an Internet connection and web browser. You are competing with other players of the game. You can even meet them virtually and travel together.
  5. You only need basic knowledge of English. You can use internet translator. During the game you will see pages from Wikipedia that describes visited places – you can change the language there.
  6. You do not need knowledge of customs. You will find interesting trivia about a given country or place.
  7. I warn you. You can fall into the habit of traveling! It's a very serious illness! ☺
  8. Costs only in virtual money.
  9. The game has big educational value. By playing, you will learn a lot about the most interesting places to visit all over the world, what you can use in real journeys.
  10. Surely you can manage! You can only win, even a real prize (mostly cash).

 

What is it all about?

You can travel to more than 2500 airports in all countries and territories around the world. You can choose air connections from more than half a milion flights! You can also use public transport, taxis, buses, ferries, you can rent a car or even hitchhike. You can visit more than 8,000 places (cities, islands, nature reserves, etc.) and see over 20,000 sights (historical monuments, natural wonders, amusement parks, etc.) – in several dozens of categories or take advantage of the available activities (several dozens of types), e.g. diving, downhill typing, swimming with dolphins, climbing, etc.

The goal is to get as many points as possible in the varying monthly tasks. "+" points are: visited countries, airports, places, sights and their categories, activities and their types, online meetings with other users of the application, creating electronic "postcards", completing tasks, distance traveled. The number of points decreases the amount of money spent and the duration of the task (not the real time – you can play as long as you want, but the "game time" associated with the real time spent on given place in the real world).

The whole game is based on the most real information! All the elements of the game are real – you are traveling through really existing countries, airports, places and visit real tourist attractions. You need a real amount of time and money.

What gives you points?

Each element of the game gives you different amounts of points.

The point value of the visited country is related to the ease of arriving in a given country. You will get more points for visiting Kiribati or Chad, than for visiting France or USA.

Similarly, with airports – big Fumicino Airport near Rome will give you fewer points than any local airport, e.g. in Colombia.

In the case of places, sights and activities, the opposite principle applies –more familiar places gives you more points

Places and sights were chosen from publicly available information. The most important sources include:

  • UNESCO World Heritage List,
  • Hilmans list – 1000 of the most worth a visit places in the world,
  • Recommended places from tourist portals such as Trip Advisor, Lonely Planet and more.

Activities also have their scoring algorithm – for example, more points you will get for diving on a known Caribbean coral reef than at a swimming pool in a big city. In general, the amount of activity points depends on the popularity of the place.

For the categories of sights and types of activities, you get a fixed amount of points of each and in addition "stamps" to the status resembling scout skills.

You will also get a fixed amount of points for "meeting" with another player. This is the only "unreal" element of the game, it reminds to read in mind and travel in time ☺. You can look at where a different player is at a given moment, but on his "game clock" it will probably be a different date and time. To meet, you have to "wait" for the player in our game time until he arrives at that time or asks him to wait for you.

 

It's like a multidimensional world, in which every player "lives" in another dimension/time! Futuristic!. Believe me, in the game it is simpler than my explanation.☺ Meetings with players can be the beginning of a shared journey. You can reduce costs (you can share rooms in hotels, share costs of car renting and taxi), and gain more points (you can use more experience of other players).

Generally, in the game, points for a given element of the trip can only be obtained once. This means that revisiting a given site does not give you additional points.

Everything costs... virtual money

Traveling costs money and time. In the game I introduced virtual money – Goldies (abbreviated GLD). All prices are in GLD. 1 GLD is about ¼ USD. Why such a value? It allows practically not to use fractional parts. All prices are rounded to 1 GLD.

Admission prices to sights (as well as their opening hours) are based on data from the Internet. Airline tickets prices are based partly on real prices (including "low cost" connections) as well as the results of statistical surveys (price per passenger per kilometer for an airline). However, I do not take into account the fact of the possibility of buying cheaper tickets in advance – in the game we pay for the ticket just before departure! Prices for accommodation, meals, car rental, taxis, public transportation, buses, etc. are based on the country or city statistical data.

In most tasks you have unlimited money – but you count how much you spent. However, there are tasks with a limited amount of funds. This kind of task ends when you spend the last GLD.

The journey time is also based on reality. This applies to air connections and to travel times by other means of communication. Also, the time of the sightseeing is also real – the minimum amount of time you have to spend on the sight is counted. Sometimes it goes wrong with reality – for example, to "beach" in the game, you have to spend 1 hour on it, but in reality, if the beach is beautiful, the weather is great, the company is cool, we will be happy to spend a few hours there. Time is important because it reduces the number of points earned. Some of the tasks are "sprinters tasks", where time has a big impact on the final result.

Types of tasks

Tasks can be constructed in many ways. In general, there is a form of movement in each task. Each has a clearly defined purpose. All the ways to earn points are also available.

But the score in each task may be counted differently. All game elements gives points. Usually, most of the game elements have a standard score. This can be defined as the multiplier x 1. In sprint-like tasks, the overall score of the game is more affected by time – it has an exemplary x 5 multiplier with respect to the standard. For tasks that involve visiting a mandatory list of sights, the multiplier x 5 is used for visiting exactly those sights. Other sights are also counted towards the result but with a multiplier of x 1 or even lower. In tasks with limited funds multiplier x 5 is used for the amount of money spent. In tasks where you have to return to the starting point, for the completion of the task, usually the final result is multiplied by 2...

Changing the ways of counting points and "mandatory" places to visit can create virtually unlimited number of different tasks.

Descriptions of tasks introduces the user to a situation, start a story, that the user will continue performing the task. A simple example. The task is to visit Buenos Aires. The description of the task may look like this:<

I like to watch music movies since I remember. I admire the artistry of singers and dancers in them. I would also like to move on the stage, to take on various characters... I went dancing classes, but I thought classical dances was not for me. In modern films, most popular are hip-hop, modern dance, popping, etc. Waltz, foxtrot are out-of-date ... But lately, I changed my mind. I saw the movie "Moulin Rouge" and fell in love with the Argentine tango. Those emotions, until my cries passed my back as I saw the dance to "Roxanne"... This dancer, as he made his partner... just "world championship" ;). I decided – I want to dance the Argentine tango. I immediately started to search for courses, but in my city, they teach only classical tango... Small research – the "capital" of Argentine tango is, as expected, Buenos Aires. There are two-week courses taught in English. I'm going! I will be there a lot of time, classes take 2-3 hours a day, so by the way I'm going to explore a bit. Or maybe we'll meet there and go out together? And lessons will be more fun... I'm leaving next week...

An additional element in this task is a need to come to one of the dance schools in Buenos Aires at a specific time each day... Each "lesson learned" will give you extra points.

Sponsored and user tasks

Tasks can be constructed by a team of people serving the game (today it is a single man team ☺), these can be user tasks (the blog is the place where I invite you to build tasks) or sponsored tasks. The scoring rules are always tailored to the nature of the task. There are also extra points of unusual things to do

SPONSORS WELCOMEJ.

Let's assume that the task sponsor is a company that owns hotels in many places around the world. The task may consist in visiting hotels from the sponsor's network. For example, to complete the task player must visit the official websites of the hotels and make a "postcard" from pictures on this page or read materials from a sponsor prepared especially for the game and pass a simple quiz. Virtual accommodation in such a hotel can be virtually free and will give players extra points.

Another idea of a sponsored task may be, for example, doing virtual shopping in a sponsor's store chain. Suppose it is a clothing company and you want to complete some clothing (for example for a young woman), and the difficulty will be that shoes can only be bought in one group of stores with different locations, another group of shops will offer underwear and yet another coat, etc.

It is possible to construct various tasks. The only condition is that the task action MUST be located in real places in the world! The locations of the sponsors' shops, in the example above, must correspond to their actual locations, but the assortment to buy does not have to be exactly the same.

Each user can present his concept of the task. The most interesting tasks will be published in tasks list with the annotation of originator. I invite you to cooperation!

 

And Now for Something Completely Different!

Why is the game called BavelTravel?

The simplest answer – the baveltravel.com domain was available ☺

But that's not true – I was looking for a name for the game that would be associated with travel. At first, it was "Incredible Journeys", but it turned out that there are already web pages with addresses containing this name and I did not know how it should be correctly pronounced in English ☺. I wanted the name of the game to be associated with travel and then "accidentally" saw a video of Katy Perry – "Chained To The Rhythm" (see YouTube). Katy pronounces the words "bubble" and "trouble" in the very interesting way (and an amusement park, especially roller coaster makes an impression ☺).

It inspired me to come up with a similarly named "Babel Travel" – the associations are OK – travels and tower of Babel – that is the confusion of languages. But babel is a service/language learning software, occupied website... I started rummaging through the net... and I found ☺ – bavel means babel in ancient Hebrew language!

And so was the name of the game and the initial logo version, a little like a pin – it can be a marker on the map.

Why I need crowdfunding?

The concept of this type of game, with cool playability and educational values, was born 15 years ago when I worked on inventing games, mainly tabletop games. Even one of that games is suitable for publication, but I ran out of funds... L. I recently released it for free, in the form of a PDF file with game supplies for printing and scissors cuttings. I will mention here my new idea – a platform for publishing various types of our "creativity" in the form of free PDFs – the working name "pdfidea". Maybe details will be presented in future on Indiegogo ☺ This project is in the preliminary stage now.

I have been working on BavelTravel for a year and a half! Most of the time takes the creation of various databases related to traveling.

The creation of database of more than half a million flights took several months... But it's finished. It is based on real connections from mid-2016. I analyzed the traffic of over 21,000 commercial aircraft from over 700 airlines!. Of course, real airline connections are changing very often, schedules are associated with the seasonality, but for the purposes of the game, such a database is completely sufficient.

The most laborious database of tourist attractions and activities is almost finished. I estimate that ¾ work has already been done. I need about 2 months to finish it.

There is also a database of multi-day tours – another attraction of the game. It is waiting for integration with the tourist attractions and will be added to the next version of the game.

Similarly, finished cruise lines and ferry connections databases will be added in the future. I'm still working on one-day-trips database.

There is a question about software and graphics. These elements need your support! I need funds to hire a client-server application programmer with knowledge of Python, Django, SQL, JavaScript, Ajax, JQuery, responsive web pages and a few other tools. Theoretically, I can write the software myself (I have 30 years of experience in this field) but it will take a long time.

The graphic designer is the second indispensable person to cooperate with. As you continue reading, you will see preliminary page designs. As mockups such graphics are sufficient, but to the final version is still far away. I have a few ideas about dynamic, attractive user interface but I need someone to do it.

Speaking of "music" today's state of work on the graphics can be described as composition almost ready, but I still have to write down instruments, add a few solos and other decorations ☺. As instruments, I understand computers, tablets, smartphones, etc. And as decorators – the choice of colors, fonts, animations, navigation techniques. Here is work for graphic designer.

Assuming gathering $10,000 I plan to finish the project until June/July break of 2018, the beta version should be available at baveltravel.com in early spring. More money will accelerate the development of the app and increase its visual quality. There will also be additional bonuses for the users I'm referring to later.

An unsuccessful attempt to raise funds will not end the application. However, it will significantly increase the time it takes to build it. I will not be able to hire co-workers... so the graphics page will suffer... Working on this application gives me a lot of satisfaction, I consult my ideas with friends and strangers from different backgrounds. The "moral" support, what I get from it, confirms my belief in the "value" of this project.

 

I hope you enjoyed my presentation. Thank you for your attention, I apologize for the language mistakes (I'm not from an English-speaking country) and please remember to support the project ☺

I will be happy to answer any questions you may have to help your decision to support.

I invite you to a virtual tour of the world! Soon...

 

If you want to know how to play BavelTravel read below.

 

How to play BavelTravel?

Log in

Once you have entered www.baveltravel.com for the first time, you need to create an account with your email address. the username and the password. You can also log in via Facebook.

You will be asked to read and accept the Terms of Service and agree to share some of your data with other application users (username, country of residence, status in the game, profile photo, postcards). No data will be shared outside the game users community!

If you answer a few questions: a country where you live, birth year, sex, or these data will be available on your Facebook account you will be given a "starter pack" with all game play facilities (except one banner ad at the top of the window) for 7 days. You can also optionally change/load a profile photo and a photo used to create "electronic postcards."

The next entry requires only standard logging.

Blog

Once logged in, you may see a blog page with basic information for players with recent changes in the game. This can include information such as the appearance of new tasks, the results of tasks from last month, the introduction of new opportunities in the game.

You can access the blog any time during the game – you will find various tips, answers to questions and you can also express your own opinion about the game and the articles there.

Tasks list

Then you go to the page with current tasks. Tasks are generally changed every month on the 1st day of each month. Other periods of activity may also be available (e.g. for tasks related to current events in the real world).

Sample tasks list

On the screen you will see current tasks to choose from, with basic information: task name, difficulty level, predicted rewards, number of players. You will also find information on whether this is a sponsored task or a user task.

The difficulty of the task is determined by the opinion of the players.

The new task has an "unknown" difficulty at the beginning. Each player after completing the task is asked to determine his difficulty scale:

 easy

 rather easy

 average

 rather difficult

 difficult

 hard

The current difficulty of the task is determined by these subjective opinions. The opinions of advanced players (higher status) is more important than the beginners opinions.

You will find out about the award system later...

Selecting a task

Selecting a task from the tasks list will take you go to the current task window. You will find here all information about the terms of the task, the rules of his scoring, or the secondary maps and your task history.

Sample task conditions:

Task: 8 new wonders of the world

Goal: Visit 8 new wonders of the world in the shortest possible time and return to the starting airport

Start: Any airport in the world, any day and time.

List of mandatory sights to visit:

  • Great Wall of China, Beijing +, China
  • Petra, Wadi Musa +, Jordan
  • Statue of Christ, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
  • Machu Picchu, Cusco +, Peru
  • Chichen Itza, Merida +, Mexico
  • Colosseum, Rome, Italy
  • Taj Mahal, Agra, India
  • Great Pyramids of Giza, Cairo +, Egypt

Note: A "+" sign means that the sight is located near the place.

Sample scoring rules:

Countries: standard

Airports: standard

Places: standard

Mandatory sights: x5

Other sights: standard

Sights categories: standard

Activities: standard

Activity types: standard

Meetings: standard

Postcards: standard

Money spent: standard

Time: x5

Task completing: standard

 

After reviewing the task, you can start, continue or restart it. During the task, you can check your current detailed results and your place in the task classification. You can also see the current classification of a given task, a map showing the places visited and to visit, the location of other players online.

Sample appearance of the current task page

Warning! User can perform each task any number of times, but only the best result will be saved in the task history. The best result will also affect the total number of visited countries, airports, places, sights, activities, categories of sights and types of activities – that is, the values accumulated from all user completed tasks affecting its status in the game.

User panel

At any time by clicking on the username, you can access the user panel, where you can see your status, achievements (tasks history, rankings, best results). You can also log out and change the user. Here you can also change some parameters of your account – for example, change your profile picture.

The countries visited by the user in all the tasks in which he participated and his status.

In the user panel, you can also see what you have purchased, the expiration date and purchase new facilities... Generally, payments can be made through PayPal. Financial prizes are transferred to the user through PayPal as well.

From the user panel, you can manage postcards made during game play – edit them, change their status from public to private and vice versa. You can also send postcards in the form of posts on Facebook or finished JPG images via e-mails, instant messengers, other social networking sites.

Some of the information contained in this panel is available to other users via chat (achievements in the game, a map of visited countries, public postcards, profile picture, a country you represent).

In the user panel, you will also find your unique link to send to friends as a game invitation. Inviting friends to play affects the prize pool (see Prizes section). In addition, for successful invitations to every 10 people (successful invitation = new user visit www.baveltravel.com with your unique link sent to him, sign up and start doing any task) you will get a free " starter pack" – the same as when registering to the game. You can use this package yourself or transfer it to another player.

Statuses

There are no classic levels in this game. The status of the user is determined by a number of visited countries for all tasks in which the user participated. The remaining parameters (number of completed tasks, visited airports, places, etc.) are included in the overall rating of the users with the same number of visited countries. Statuses are updated with the appearance of new tasks on the first day of the month.

Depending on the number of countries visited, users receive statuses according to the scheme:

Visited countries

Status

Status symbol

 

1-25

Rookie

yellow scarf

26-50

Traveler

red scarf

51-100

Guide

green scarf

101-150

Globetrotter

blue scarf

151-200

Conqueror

brown scarf

201+

Master

black scarf

I plan the possibility to buy (for the lowest levels)/receive free (for higher levels – from the globetrotter up) scarfs in status color with logo and game name. However, this requires additional organizational activities – such as ordering appropriate scarfs and organizing cheap shipping. However, I need information of the needs, which will come out only after the game release. If my campaign collects 200% of the required founds then scarfs will be for sure and will be given to the donors first.

Let's return to the tasks.

Performing tasks

You can start the task, continue the interrupted task or restart it. When you perform a task for the first time (or restart it), the task always starts at an airport. This is the starting point, where, in many tasks, you must return to complete the task.

When you play in the free version – airport and the start time is drawn – this is the only random element in the game! You may not accept the draw result and draw a different starting point, but each repetition of the draw will cost you a couple of points.

Once you have purchased "Starting Point" feature you will be able to choose your starting point and start time, and you can also draw airport without loss of points. This makes it easier for you to get a better result of task because you can choose a popular airport (e.g. Amsterdam (AMS)) with a lot of connections and choose an optimal departure time. When unhappily you draw the airport at the "end of the world" with the nearest plane in 3 days, you may lose a lot of time... but also gain on visited sights, airports or countries! Starting point does not count for rankings – only the places to which you reach count. The starting point airport will count only when you return to this place...

The game starts at the departure time or any other move from the airport to another place (while you are waiting for the plane, you can explore the area).

Navigation in the game

The screen in the game is divided into panels:

  • Menu – general game options,
  • Position – your geographical location or in-game location,
  • The main panel – shows maps, basic information, checklists (e.g. schedule); you will also find buttons to continue playing here,
  • Go back – a button that allows you to return to the previously displayed page/option,
  • Auxiliary panel – shows additional information: descriptions of selected items in the main panel, description of markings on maps, selection options,
  • Score – your current score,
  • Navigation – Main panel content selection buttons,
  • Game time – current time in the game – local time in the place, time zone and day of the week; below is an "artificial horizon" visualization of time of day.

Examples of "artificial horizons" with the default background colors of the application.

User interface consists of cards in responsive design. The location of the cards varies depending on the screen size of the device on which you play. This is a mockup only!. The final appearance of the application will be determined later, as a result of planned cooperation with the graphic designer.

When do you earn points?

In the case of airports – when you get there. In the case of countries – when you leave the airport (when you are just going to another plane, the airports are treated extraterritorially – they have no assigned country or place). Points for places – when you get there. Points for sights and activities – when you finish visiting/participating.

The diagram below shows the basic possibilities of moving in the game.

In all places, you can just wait – only move the game clock. This may be needed when you are waiting for a plane, you are waiting for a meeting, you are waiting to open a sight, etc. Clock shifts cost you only a correction of the task time.

Virtual backpack

You can also use the virtual backpack and check its contents. You have souvenirs (see below) and diary there. In the diary you have information on whether you have rented a car, when and where to return it, whether you have a valid daily public transport ticket in the place where you are and notes like your planned aircraft departure time, bus departure time – in due course diary will remind you that you need to go to the airport/bus stop. In the backpack, you can also find SOLVER – a useful travel planning tool (see section Paid Facilities).

When you are at the airport:

Sample airport connection map

You can wait and change to another plane. You have an up-to-date schedule, with all available flights, their prices, duration and time of arrival at other airports, including time zones. But if you plane departures after midnight or waiting for the plane is longer than 8h then you have to go to the city center, near the airport, to the hotel for the accommodation or you can visit some sights.

Sample timetable

In the user panel, you can buy the "Flying miles" facility, which gives you a 50% discount on the next connection. More precisely, if at the airport you only change plane – that is, you arrived and before 8 hours fly away somewhere else, you get a discount – 50% of the standard price of cheaper of these two connections. This does not apply to the "cheap lines" – there are no discounts! But in the meantime, you can go to the city center and get some points visiting available sights ☺ You only have to return within 8 hours...

You can rent a car. Prices depend on country and city. In each country there is also a different fuel price.

In some cities, you can buy a 24-hour public transport ticket.

You can go to the city center by public transport, special airport-center connection (e.g. in Shanghai by magnetic rail), taxi or rented car. All travel options have their price and duration.

You can go to another city or airport by rented car, taxi, bus or hitch.

You can "save" to the diary, in your virtual backpack, departure time of selected connection, you want to use after spending time in the area. Diary reminds you when you must return to the airport.

When you are in the city center

Sample map of sights

Just like at the airport you can rent a car and/or buy a 24-hour public transport ticket.

You can use the hotel (actually, the application will tell you that the night is approaching, all the facilities for sightseeing are closed and will direct you to the hotel automatically, where you have to spend at least 8 hours). You will be charged daily for meals and accommodation depending on your actual location. In the user panel, you can purchase a "Hotel facility" – 25% hotel discount. The hotels are located in the city center and if you are anywhere in the city center you need 10 minutes walk to the hotel. You can also come directly to the hotel from the airport.

Sample list of sights available from the city center

You can explore the city center on foot. There is a standard time of 10 minutes to go among sights. How to visit the sight? About that later...

You can go to visit a sight outside the center. Various options are available – a pedestrian crossing, public transportation, taxi hire, rented car.

You can go to visit a sight outside the city by rented car, taxi, bus or hitch.

You can buy activity. Activities are not related to a particular place on the map. Treat it as an organized trip, someone will come up for you, take you to the right place, and then take you back. Activities take a certain amount of time, you have to pay for them and take place in a "logical" time interval (e.g. dive trips must start after dawn, a certain amount of time is required, but must end e.g. one hour after dusk; you choose the departure time yourself).

You can return to the airport (same options as the airport transfer to the center). But remember one rule – ALWAYS you must be at the airport at least 40 minutes before departure!

Once you reach the sight outside the city center

You can return to the center/hotel – transport options such as the road from the center to the sight. You can do it after visiting the attractions or without visiting it – because you have a plane soon or upon arrival, it turned out that the object is already closed and you did not notice it ☺

In some cities apart from the center are separated "zones" – these are areas with several sights located close to each other, but outside the center. In such cases, you can go within the standard 10 minutes to another sight.

Traveling directly between sights placed not in the city center or not in the same "zone" is not permitted. In this case, you must first return to the center and then move on to another sight.

Summary of transport options

Plane – departs according to the timetable, moves very quickly, the price is partly related to the distance traveled. Planes always lands at the airport, from which you have to go by other means of communication to the nearest city or other selected place. You need to be at the airport at least 40 minutes before the departure.

On foot – only for short distances, slowly but for free and you are not waiting. There is a standard time of 10 minutes to travel among the sights in the city center and in the "zones".

Airport-to-airport communication – sometimes there are dedicated connections on the airport-center-airport route, such as fast train – such connections may have a special price, they can also be accounted as other connections in the public transport system.

Public transport – the primary way of moving around cities. In many cities, you can also use the 24-hour ticket. With such a ticket, you can go for the duration of 24 hours after first use of the communication free of charge, otherwise, single-pass charges are charged when you get on the city bus, subway, tram. The overall average fast but cheap. For simplicity, you leave after 5 minutes of waiting.

Taxi – you can go anywhere, relatively fast, but expensive. You pay for the distance traveled. A taxi can carry between 1 and 4 passengers. You can share the cost with other passengers. Time from order to taxi arrival – 5 minutes

Bus – is used to travel between cities, airports, or between a city and a sight. A scheduling algorithm was created, simulating the rules of operation of real bus operators. I assume that the buses leave the city center and finish the route in the center of another city, at the airport or at a distant sight. There are courses in reverse directions, too. Cheap, slower than a rented car, you have to adjust to the schedule.

Rented car – you pay for a 24-hour rental in advance. You can extend your rent for another 24 hours. Usually, you have the option of standard renting with the return in the same point or more expensive options with the ability to return anywhere in the same country or even abroad. You pay the fuel costs for each km you drive – the fuel cost is charged at the return of the car. You can ride "bus routes", but you are not limited by schedules. You must take breaks during your trip. The rented car can take from 1 to 4 people. The fastest means of land transport, guaranteeing temporary independence. Rented car can also travel in cities at the same speed as taxis, but access to the center "costs" you 15 minutes to find a car park ☺

Hitchhikers also go on "bus routes", but on other terms. I think hitchhiking is everywhere popular (but I plan to research how it looks in reality in different countries – for now, it's a fresh idea and needs to be refined ☺). You can catch cars from dawn to dusk. Each time you catch a hitch for 30 minutes and then it carries you for max 1 hour.

Same as fast as a rented car. If you do not reach the destination within an hour, you will lose 30 minutes to catch another hitch and you will be traveling another hour. You can ride alone or with one extra person. You can hitch efficiently using souvenirs whose way of buying is described further. You can "pay" the driver who will chase you with a souvenir. Each souvenir has its own strength, which you can express in the distance you are carried by the hitch. When you catch a hitch in the afternoon and pay by a valuable souvenir, you can drive even through the night and save money on the hotel – you just fall asleep during the hitch!

I also plan to introduce rail connections and some water communication: ferries, boats to hire, cruisers. Ferries are partially implemented but in undisclosed form – travel time takes into account ferry time but does not generate extra travel expenses.

Railway connections require additional research – each country needs to be treated very individually. It would be interesting to introduce the possibility of moving TGV or another high-speed rail system, but developing a simulation of the right quality can be very time-consuming to prepare.

I am tempted by the option of renting airplanes – but it is more about my fascination with aviation than with the needs of the game ☺. But on the other hand, it would be possible to use small airports that are not used for day-to-day communication and facilitate getting into interesting sights located far from large airports... For now, the flight of the small plane is available as one of the type of activities.

How to visit the sight?

An example Wikipedia page describing the tourist attraction and sightseeing options

Once you reach the sight, a page from Wikipedia will appear on the screen describing this sight. To earn points for visiting sight, you must have at least one interaction with this site – scroll through the page to the end, click on any photo or change the language of the page. This is done ESPECIALLY – the goal of the game is to learn something! I hope that your general knowledge will increase ☺

When you select the tour option, you will see a short animation of the elapsed time. Every 5 minutes of game time equals 1 second of animation. Visiting an example object will, in fact, last 12 to 18 seconds! Similar animations will appear during virtual travel by any means of transport.

Postcards

Once you have visited the sight, before deciding where you are going, you can generate your own "postcard". You can use any of the Wikipedia commons pictures (copyright issues) and simply insert into picture your profile photo or other picture previously uploaded via user panel, your username and some text (from ready-made templates or at your own choice). You can change the size, location, and color of these items. The application will add a BavelTravel logo and signature to the post containing the location of the object, original signature, and picture author data (license requirements). For making a "postcard" you will get points and you will be able to put it in your postcard album and send it to whom you want (see User panel).

Sample "postcard"

Souvenirs

When you visit sights or participate in activities in some places you can buy souvenirs. These are, of course, virtual souvenirs, they are not named, but they "remember" the place of their purchase. As part of the "education" of the game, I will try to determine what are the real souvenirs characteristic of the country and place ☺.

Every souvenir has a reasonable price – about 20 GLD. But souvenirs are not so easy to buy... You have to look for them. You can buy them on average every fifth tourist attraction. When you do not have a place in your virtual backpack, before you buy a new souvenir, you have to use an older one.

Each souvenir has variable strength, which depends on the distance between the place where you are located and the place of purchase of the souvenir (air distance by the orthodox – it is such information for curious ☺). What is the use of souvenirs? To "pay" for hitchhiking, to "pay" for accommodation while hitchhiking and to "bribe" staff to let you visit sights outside opening hours/days.☺

You can hitch a distance of 1/10 of its current strength, i.e. the distance from the place of purchase in kilometers. Suppose you bought a souvenir in Brazil. You are now somewhere in Europe. From the place of purchase is e.g. 8000 km, that is, you will ride hitchhiking 800 km, and if you choose the right moment of its use you will not pay the cost of accommodation – you will just sleep in the car.

If you want to pay for the hotel souvenir strength is converted to GLD. Souvenir value in GLD is 1/10 of its current strength. For example, if a hotel costs 200 GLD then look for a souvenir in the backpack purchased at least 2000 km from your actual location Note: souvenir cannot be paid in part, nor does it get "rest". So if you have to pay 200 GLD and you have a souvenir of 1500 km "strength" you cannot use it. When you have a souvenir of 3500 km "strength" using it you "overpay".

Little bribe. Example: You want to visit the museum on Monday and it turns out to be closed. You can try to "bribe" the staff to let you in. Of course, cash does not come into play! But if the strength of your souvenir converted into GLD (as for paying for a hotel) will exceed the price of an admission +20 GLD you will be admitted to. ☺ The same applies to visiting the sight after the official closing time or before opening.

You do not have to remember all these conversions. The game itself will tell you if you can use a souvenir.

Perhaps during the development of the game or in some specific tasks, the souvenirs will be used in some other way. Remember! There is a strength in souvenirs ☺

Meetings, chat, and blog

These functionalities have already been described in previous chapters...

 

Here is the end of my description of the game. In case of doubt please ask questions. A lot of this and I could skip something...

There are still 2 topics:

Paid facilities

Purchased facilities, terms of their validity, prices

Discounts on hotels and air connections have already been described. Just like choosing a starting point.

Another facility is obvious nowadays – no ads. By displaying ads, app users can play for free. But many are upset. Hence, this possibility.

And the latest facility – useful for more advanced players in the planning of travel. I called them NEXT HOP. It allows you to view, without moving from the airport, flight schedules of another airport connected with current airport. This allows you to check, for example, what time you have to fly from the "actual" airport, to catch another plane at another airport.

If you purchase the NEXT HOP, you will find in your backpack an additional, very useful route planning tool – SOLVER. This tool can answer you where is the best place to get to the place you are looking for. You can also set the day and time when you want to get there. You can use SOLVER at any time and ask for access to any location – you can search for a country, airport, city, sight. SOLVER also allows you to search for the nearest places where selected type of activity or sight category is available. Finally, it shows the location of various "useful" places to perform a specific task.

You can buy one facility or a bundle of all facilities for one month. Of course, I recommend buying the bundle ☺

Facilities can be paid from any PayPal account (such as parents, adult friends)

Facilities may change during game development. But you will always be able to buy a bundle of all the facilities for a fixed price of $4.99 per month. I only reserve the possibility of changing the price in the case of major currency market changes or changes in the PayPal commissions.

Prizes

Those who achieve the best results in the given task will be rewarded. Prizes may vary in each task.

Generally, for the best result in a given task or some best results (2nd and 3rd place, the top ten) financial awards are provided (or material prizes from the sponsors). The prize pool is given for each task in the tasks list. More detailed information can be found in the task description.

The "+" of the prize amount means that the prize will increase as the number of players performing the given task increases (both free and paid). Therefore, it is beneficial of the players ito invite friends to play, for example through social networking sites.

Important note! Prizes are given as gross amounts, which does not include any applicable taxes in your country and money transfer costs. Depending on the user's residence, taxes can be settled automatically or the user will receive a tax-deductible email. In most countries, there are certain amounts of tax-free winnings. Usually, such amounts are around $500, so there should not be a problem with settling typical winnings. Financial awards can only be received by adults who have an active PayPal account registered for the same email address as given when registering for the game!

In addition, the best players get "status rewards" – public information about the user in the form of icons and descriptions, for results in a given task:

  • 1, 2, 3 places
  • Placement in the top 10
  • Placement in the top 100
  • Placement in the first 10% of players

In addition, depending on the number of players in a given task, you can get a free "starter pack" – the same as a new player signing up. This package can be used by itself or given to any user of the game.

At the end of each month, the user status is updated. As I have written before, I plan to introduce the scarfs/bandanas as status symbols. Obtaining a globetrotter or higher status will be associated with a gift in the form of a corresponding scarf surface-mailed to a previously set e-mail physical address. Minors are also involved.

There are also status icons for reaching each sight category and type of activity. It's a bit like picking scout skills. J

And finally... see rest of the story
story_txt:
The BavelTravel project:

A new kind of online game
A strategic, high fidelity simulation of traveling
Optimal combination of fun and learning

Want to visit Paris, Rio de Janeiro and even Vanuatu without leaving your home?
There is a plenty of various travel tasks for you to perform (monthly changed)
Try to create them yourself too!
All you need is any device connected to the Internet with web browse
You can play on computer, tablet, smartphone, console and even Smart TV
Nothing to install – everything is online
Simple navigation, simple rules
You compete or cooperate with others, the choice is yours
You can create "electronic postcards" from visited places
You can buy souvenirs with "strength" ☺
You can share your results in the social media
The game is constantly evolving. Even during writing of this text, concepts such as hitchhiking and SOLVER have been developed.
You can play for FREE and win PRIZES


Interested? Time to start your virtual journey...
 

May 1, 2020, Bamako, Mali
In the morning a mop guy woke me up. He started to poke me and speak something in his own way. What language does he speak? I understood only "aller, aller", what in French means go or faster. Fortunately, his gestures cleared my doubts. I jumped out of the uncomfortable plastic bench and fell nearly on the wet floor tangled in the straps of my own backpack.
It turned out that I was at the airport in Bamako, in Mali and I do not really remember how I got here. As I left outside, I was struck by the heat. Macabre! I am in Africa only a few days and my body has not yet adjusted to the heat. I'm wet all the time, the sun is so sharp, even the dark sunglasses does not help much, and on my skin, I feel as if someone is stabbing a million thin pins in it. Well, I have to survive, somehow. I have some memory loss, maybe it's the case of a solar stroke?

 
It's a fragment of a traveler's diary that describes one day of his hero's journey. It would be nice to be able to write such a relationship of your own experiences...
Traveling is one of our most common dreams, we like to talk about travel and share experiences.But...
What do you think about traveling?
 When we think of an influx of extra cash (e.g., banished on a lottery, higher than the usual bonus, the completion of a long work), travels are almost always being on our list of planned expenses. When we are overworked, we would mostly like to go somewhere. We often want to visit "warm countries", we also dream of traveling around the world. Or maybe a short break in Rome, to see how people lived in the times of the emperors and a quick look at the Vatican.
 

It usually ends with a trip to the hotel e.g. in Greece and laze on the beach for a week or two. More active travel remains in the sphere of dreams because:


They cost too much and just exceed your financial capacity...
If we have money, we have no time...
It would be nice to fly somewhere far away, but we are afraid to fly...
We do not have anyone to go with...
We do not speak foreign languages...
We do not know the customs of the people in the countries we want to visit... We do not want to be ridiculous in the eyes of the natives...
We fear diseases, thefts, robberies, terrorists...
We do not like touts, beggars... We do not like to be hounded and forced to get rid of money...
We do not really know what and where we can see and generally how to spend time...
We are afraid that we will be able to handle this...

Only obstacles...
Let me show up at this place (a middle-aged guy, who has seen something in his life and knows a bit, from not so rich (in terms of available funds) European country), with the concept of an unusual online game "BavelTravel" that allows you to virtually travel around the world without these obstacles. 
This is not a real journey but its high fidelity simulation. but:


 Forget about costs – you play completely free. You can buy some facilities to increase your chances for better result (up to $4.99 per month).
No doubt you will find some time. You can break the game any time and then continue from the break point.
You fly virtually, so fear disappears. The effect of clogged ears and time shift too.
To play the game you only need an Internet connection and web browser. You are competing with other players of the game. You can even meet them virtually and travel together.
You only need basic knowledge of English. You can use internet translator. During the game you will see pages from Wikipedia that describes visited places – you can change the language there.
You do not need knowledge of customs. You will find interesting trivia about a given country or place.
I warn you. You can fall into the habit of traveling! It's a very serious illness! ☺
Costs only in virtual money.
The game has big educational value. By playing, you will learn a lot about the most interesting places to visit all over the world, what you can use in real journeys.
Surely you can manage! You can only win, even a real prize (mostly cash).

 
What is it all about?
 You can travel to more than 2500 airports in all countries and territories around the world. You can choose air connections from more than half a milion flights! You can also use public transport, taxis, buses, ferries, you can rent a car or even hitchhike. You can visit more than 8,000 places (cities, islands, nature reserves, etc.) and see over 20,000 sights (historical monuments, natural wonders, amusement parks, etc.) – in several dozens of categories or take advantage of the available activities (several dozens of types), e.g. diving, downhill typing, swimming with dolphins, climbing, etc.
The goal is to get as many points as possible in the varying monthly tasks. "+" points are: visited countries, airports, places, sights and their categories, activities and their types, online meetings with other users of the application, creating electronic "postcards", completing tasks, distance traveled. The number of points decreases the amount of money spent and the duration of the task (not the real time – you can play as long as you want, but the "game time" associated with the real time spent on given place in the real world).
The whole game is based on the most real information! All the elements of the game are real – you are traveling through really existing countries, airports, places and visit real tourist attractions. You need a real amount of time and money.
What gives you points?
Each element of the game gives you different amounts of points.
The point value of the visited country is related to the ease of arriving in a given country. You will get more points for visiting Kiribati or Chad, than for visiting France or USA.
Similarly, with airports – big Fumicino Airport near Rome will give you fewer points than any local airport, e.g. in Colombia.
 In the case of places, sights and activities, the opposite principle applies –more familiar places gives you more points
Places and sights were chosen from publicly available information. The most important sources include:

UNESCO World Heritage List,
Hilmans list – 1000 of the most worth a visit places in the world,
Recommended places from tourist portals such as Trip Advisor, Lonely Planet and more.

 Activities also have their scoring algorithm – for example, more points you will get for diving on a known Caribbean coral reef than at a swimming pool in a big city. In general, the amount of activity points depends on the popularity of the place.
For the categories of sights and types of activities, you get a fixed amount of points of each and in addition "stamps" to the status resembling scout skills.
You will also get a fixed amount of points for "meeting" with another player. This is the only "unreal" element of the game, it reminds to read in mind and travel in time ☺. You can look at where a different player is at a given moment, but on his "game clock" it will probably be a different date and time. To meet, you have to "wait" for the player in our game time until he arrives at that time or asks him to wait for you.
 
It's like a multidimensional world, in which every player "lives" in another dimension/time! Futuristic!. Believe me, in the game it is simpler than my explanation.☺ Meetings with players can be the beginning of a shared journey. You can reduce costs (you can share rooms in hotels, share costs of car renting and taxi), and gain more points (you can use more experience of other players).
Generally, in the game, points for a given element of the trip can only be obtained once. This means that revisiting a given site does not give you additional points.
Everything costs... virtual money
 Traveling costs money and time. In the game I introduced virtual money – Goldies (abbreviated GLD). All prices are in GLD. 1 GLD is about ¼ USD. Why such a value? It allows practically not to use fractional parts. All prices are rounded to 1 GLD.
Admission prices to sights (as well as their opening hours) are based on data from the Internet. Airline tickets prices are based partly on real prices (including "low cost" connections) as well as the results of statistical surveys (price per passenger per kilometer for an airline). However, I do not take into account the fact of the possibility of buying cheaper tickets in advance – in the game we pay for the ticket just before departure! Prices for accommodation, meals, car rental, taxis, public transportation, buses, etc. are based on the country or city statistical data.
In most tasks you have unlimited money – but you count how much you spent. However, there are tasks with a limited amount of funds. This kind of task ends when you spend the last GLD.
 The journey time is also based on reality. This applies to air connections and to travel times by other means of communication. Also, the time of the sightseeing is also real – the minimum amount of time you have to spend on the sight is counted. Sometimes it goes wrong with reality – for example, to "beach" in the game, you have to spend 1 hour on it, but in reality, if the beach is beautiful, the weather is great, the company is cool, we will be happy to spend a few hours there. Time is important because it reduces the number of points earned. Some of the tasks are "sprinters tasks", where time has a big impact on the final result.
Types of tasks
Tasks can be constructed in many ways. In general, there is a form of movement in each task. Each has a clearly defined purpose. All the ways to earn points are also available.
But the score in each task may be counted differently. All game elements gives points. Usually, most of the game elements have a standard score. This can be defined as the multiplier x 1. In sprint-like tasks, the overall score of the game is more affected by time – it has an exemplary x 5 multiplier with respect to the standard. For tasks that involve visiting a mandatory list of sights, the multiplier x 5 is used for visiting exactly those sights. Other sights are also counted towards the result but with a multiplier of x 1 or even lower. In tasks with limited funds multiplier x 5 is used for the amount of money spent. In tasks where you have to return to the starting point, for the completion of the task, usually the final result is multiplied by 2...
Changing the ways of counting points and "mandatory" places to visit can create virtually unlimited number of different tasks.
Descriptions of tasks introduces the user to a situation, start a story, that the user will continue performing the task. A simple example. The task is to visit Buenos Aires. The description of the task may look like this:<
I like to watch music movies since I remember. I admire the artistry of singers and dancers in them. I would also like to move on the stage, to take on various characters... I went dancing classes, but I thought classical dances was not for me. In modern films, most popular are hip-hop, modern dance, popping, etc. Waltz, foxtrot are out-of-date ... But lately, I changed my mind. I saw the movie "Moulin Rouge" and fell in love with the Argentine tango. Those emotions, until my cries passed my back as I saw the dance to "Roxanne"... This dancer, as he made his partner... just "world championship" ;). I decided – I want to dance the Argentine tango. I immediately started to search for courses, but in my city, they teach only classical tango... Small research – the "capital" of Argentine tango is, as expected, Buenos Aires. There are two-week courses taught in English. I'm going! I will be there a lot of time, classes take 2-3 hours a day, so by the way I'm going to explore a bit. Or maybe we'll meet there and go out together? And lessons will be more fun... I'm leaving next week...
An additional element in this task is a need to come to one of the dance schools in Buenos Aires at a specific time each day... Each "lesson learned" will give you extra points.
Sponsored and user tasks
Tasks can be constructed by a team of people serving the game (today it is a single man team ☺), these can be user tasks (the blog is the place where I invite you to build tasks) or sponsored tasks. The scoring rules are always tailored to the nature of the task. There are also extra points of unusual things to do
SPONSORS WELCOMEJ.
Let's assume that the task sponsor is a company that owns hotels in many places around the world. The task may consist in visiting hotels from the sponsor's network. For example, to complete the task player must visit the official websites of the hotels and make a "postcard" from pictures on this page or read materials from a sponsor prepared especially for the game and pass a simple quiz. Virtual accommodation in such a hotel can be virtually free and will give players extra points.
 Another idea of a sponsored task may be, for example, doing virtual shopping in a sponsor's store chain. Suppose it is a clothing company and you want to complete some clothing (for example for a young woman), and the difficulty will be that shoes can only be bought in one group of stores with different locations, another group of shops will offer underwear and yet another coat, etc.
It is possible to construct various tasks. The only condition is that the task action MUST be located in real places in the world! The locations of the sponsors' shops, in the example above, must correspond to their actual locations, but the assortment to buy does not have to be exactly the same.
Each user can present his concept of the task. The most interesting tasks will be published in tasks list with the annotation of originator. I invite you to cooperation!
 
And Now for Something Completely Different!
Why is the game called BavelTravel?
The simplest answer – the baveltravel.com domain was available ☺
But that's not true – I was looking for a name for the game that would be associated with travel. At first, it was "Incredible Journeys", but it turned out that there are already web pages with addresses containing this name and I did not know how it should be correctly pronounced in English ☺. I wanted the name of the game to be associated with travel and then "accidentally" saw a video of Katy Perry – "Chained To The Rhythm" (see YouTube). Katy pronounces the words "bubble" and "trouble" in the very interesting way (and an amusement park, especially roller coaster makes an impression ☺).

It inspired me to come up with a similarly named "Babel Travel" – the associations are OK – travels and tower of Babel – that is the confusion of languages. But babel is a service/language learning software, occupied website... I started rummaging through the net... and I found ☺ – bavel means babel in ancient Hebrew language!
 And so was the name of the game and the initial logo version, a little like a pin – it can be a marker on the map.
Why I need crowdfunding?
The concept of this type of game, with cool playability and educational values, was born 15 years ago when I worked on inventing games, mainly tabletop games. Even one of that games is suitable for publication, but I ran out of funds... L. I recently released it for free, in the form of a PDF file with game supplies for printing and scissors cuttings. I will mention here my new idea – a platform for publishing various types of our "creativity" in the form of free PDFs – the working name "pdfidea". Maybe details will be presented in future on Indiegogo ☺ This project is in the preliminary stage now.
I have been working on BavelTravel for a year and a half! Most of the time takes the creation of various databases related to traveling.
The creation of database of more than half a million flights took several months... But it's finished. It is based on real connections from mid-2016. I analyzed the traffic of over 21,000 commercial aircraft from over 700 airlines!. Of course, real airline connections are changing very often, schedules are associated with the seasonality, but for the purposes of the game, such a database is completely sufficient.
The most laborious database of tourist attractions and activities is almost finished. I estimate that ¾ work has already been done. I need about 2 months to finish it.
There is also a database of multi-day tours – another attraction of the game. It is waiting for integration with the tourist attractions and will be added to the next version of the game.
Similarly, finished cruise lines and ferry connections databases will be added in the future. I'm still working on one-day-trips database.
There is a question about software and graphics. These elements need your support! I need funds to hire a client-server application programmer with knowledge of Python, Django, SQL, JavaScript, Ajax, JQuery, responsive web pages and a few other tools. Theoretically, I can write the software myself (I have 30 years of experience in this field) but it will take a long time.
The graphic designer is the second indispensable person to cooperate with. As you continue reading, you will see preliminary page designs. As mockups such graphics are sufficient, but to the final version is still far away. I have a few ideas about dynamic, attractive user interface but I need someone to do it.
Speaking of "music" today's state of work on the graphics can be described as composition almost ready, but I still have to write down instruments, add a few solos and other decorations ☺. As instruments, I understand computers, tablets, smartphones, etc. And as decorators – the choice of colors, fonts, animations, navigation techniques. Here is work for graphic designer.
Assuming gathering $10,000 I plan to finish the project until June/July break of 2018, the beta version should be available at baveltravel.com in early spring. More money will accelerate the development of the app and increase its visual quality. There will also be additional bonuses for the users I'm referring to later.
An unsuccessful attempt to raise funds will not end the application. However, it will significantly increase the time it takes to build it. I will not be able to hire co-workers... so the graphics page will suffer... Working on this application gives me a lot of satisfaction, I consult my ideas with friends and strangers from different backgrounds. The "moral" support, what I get from it, confirms my belief in the "value" of this project.
 
I hope you enjoyed my presentation. Thank you for your attention, I apologize for the language mistakes (I'm not from an English-speaking country) and please remember to support the project ☺
I will be happy to answer any questions you may have to help your decision to support.
I invite you to a virtual tour of the world! Soon...
 
If you want to know how to play BavelTravel read below.
 
How to play BavelTravel?
Log in
Once you have entered www.baveltravel.com for the first time, you need to create an account with your email address. the username and the password. You can also log in via Facebook.
You will be asked to read and accept the Terms of Service and agree to share some of your data with other application users (username, country of residence, status in the game, profile photo, postcards). No data will be shared outside the game users community!
If you answer a few questions: a country where you live, birth year, sex, or these data will be available on your Facebook account you will be given a "starter pack" with all game play facilities (except one banner ad at the top of the window) for 7 days. You can also optionally change/load a profile photo and a photo used to create "electronic postcards."
The next entry requires only standard logging.
Blog
Once logged in, you may see a blog page with basic information for players with recent changes in the game. This can include information such as the appearance of new tasks, the results of tasks from last month, the introduction of new opportunities in the game.
You can access the blog any time during the game – you will find various tips, answers to questions and you can also express your own opinion about the game and the articles there.
Tasks list
