story:
Who am I?

My name is Laszlo and I'm 26 years old. I work for an international company as a first level IT support agent. I've learned C/C++ programming back in high-school and developed a passion for it, later learning additional programming languages with the purpose of creating smaller apps for local small businesses, mostly for accounting purposes. Another one of my passions is drawing comics and recently figured out a way to put these two hobbies together in the shape of 2D game development using Unity.

In my city, there are no other companies in this business so I proposed to open the first one, however the financial strain is proving to be greater than anticipated and here we are.

As much as I would like to be able to do all the aspects of a game myself, there are some domains in which there is either a great amount or simply beyond my skills such as music, sound effect, voice recording or marketing and this is where you come in.

What is Shady Woods all about?
The story follows the adventure of a young girl named Daisy in a mysterious forest filled with dangerous monsters as she tries to find out how she got there and how she can get out. She is followed by her trusty companion, Mildred, who is a demonic squirrel with bat wings, believing that Daisy is the Destroyer Queen whom he has pledged to serve, despite Daisy denying this from the beginning. They meet several "shady" individuals on their path, often times being something other than what they claim to be. Daisy soon finds out that she is not in just any kind of forest and getting out will be harder than she imagined.

Game mechanics are your average platformer with an ever changing environment, eastereggs for the story and hidden chambers in the walls with extra loot. You have 3 spells (a ranged attack, a melee attack, and a shield) each costing mana to cast. Daisy has a talent tree and a spell tree that she can improve using 3 kind of in-game currencies: acorns, shards and herbs thus rising to the challenge of each level. At the end of every level there will be an additional line of comics-strips unlocking for the player to follow the story and at the end of every second level there will be a Boss, who at times can prove as quite a challenge for players. The proposed number of levels is 24 at this time.

What you can do:
- SPREAD THE WORD! Arguably the most important part here is to build an audience for the game that will inevitably be created at some point in the near future.
- If you are a musician or voice actor and you want to help, please contact me!
- Donate.

What your donations will be spent on:
- Paying outsourced artists (currently working in collaboration with 1 artist with an hourly wage of approximately 4 euro).
- Digital Art equipment (I own a wacom intous 5 tablet which is about 4-5 years old and not the best option for a wannabe professional game dev)
- Paying the monthly fee of Unity Plus license
- Paying for advertisement

Why help?
By aiding this project, you will help build a company in an ever growing industry, which will provide a workplace for local digital artists, programmers, voice actors and offering courses in these domains for local youngsters, that are passionate about it.
I'm not sure what the limitations for this platform are, but I will try to send a promo-codes to everyone who donates at least 5  euros, so that when the game launches, they can play it for free. Additionally, anyone who helps out in the en-devour will have a special place in an easter-egg of the game as well as the due credits.

At the end of the campaign, the person who donated the largest amount will have a character designed after them.
story_txt: Who am I?My name is Laszlo and I'm 26 years old. I work for an international company as a first level IT support agent. I've learned C/C++ programming back in high-school and developed a passion for it, later learning additional programming languages with the purpose of creating smaller apps for local small businesses, mostly for accounting purposes. Another one of my passions is drawing comics and recently figured out a way to put these two hobbies together in the shape of 2D game development using Unity.In my city, there are no other companies in this business so I proposed to open the first one, however the financial strain is proving to be greater than anticipated and here we are.As much as I would like to be able to do all the aspects of a game myself, there are some domains in which there is either a great amount or simply beyond my skills such as music, sound effect, voice recording or marketing and this is where you come in.What is Shady Woods all about?The story follows the adventure of a young girl named Daisy in a mysterious forest filled with dangerous monsters as she tries to find out how she got there and how she can get out. She is followed by her trusty companion, Mildred, who is a demonic squirrel with bat wings, believing that Daisy is the Destroyer Queen whom he has pledged to serve, despite Daisy denying this from the beginning. They meet several "shady" individuals on their path, often times being something other than what they claim to be. Daisy soon finds out that she is not in just any kind of forest and getting out will be harder than she imagined.Game mechanics are your average platformer with an ever changing environment, eastereggs for the story and hidden chambers in the walls with extra loot. You have 3 spells (a ranged attack, a melee attack, and a shield) each costing mana to cast. Daisy has a talent tree and a spell tree that she can improve using 3 kind of in-game currencies: acorns, shards and herbs thus rising to the challenge of each level. At the end of every level there will be an additional line of comics-strips unlocking for the player to follow the story and at the end of every second level there will be a Boss, who at times can prove as quite a challenge for players. The proposed number of levels is 24 at this time.What you can do:- SPREAD THE WORD! Arguably the most important part here is to build an audience for the game that will inevitably be created at some point in the near future.- If you are a musician or voice actor and you want to help, please contact me!- Donate.What your donations will be spent on:- Paying outsourced artists (currently working in collaboration with 1 artist with an hourly wage of approximately 4 euro).- Digital Art equipment (I own a wacom intous 5 tablet which is about 4-5 years old and not the best option for a wannabe professional game dev)- Paying the monthly fee of Unity Plus license- Paying for advertisementWhy help?By aiding this project, you will help build a company in an ever growing industry, which will provide a workplace for local digital artists, programmers, voice actors and offering courses in these domains for local youngsters, that are passionate about it.I'm not sure what the limitations for this platform are, but I will try to send a promo-codes to everyone who donates at least 5  euros, so that when the game launches, they can play it for free. Additionally, anyone who helps out in the en-devour will have a special place in an easter-egg of the game as well as the due credits.At the end of the campaign, the person who donated the largest amount will have a character designed after them.

story:
Hi everyone, we are Trinity Games team from Kyiv. Our team is full of strength and enthusiasm to launch our own new project, which will hopefully delight millions of people around the world. We are pleased to present to you our mobile puzzle “PathFinder”.

        And we need your help. The end result and the hope for new projects depends largely on your activity. We would like to develop and create interesting projects. We hope you find it attractive and usefull.

Thank you very much for your help!

        The idea of ​​this game came to us while we were passing the logic test on programming at the beginning of our studying. The test seemed quite interesting and beneficial to us. Later, we decided to transfer this mechanic in a playful way in the form of a mobile application. This is how the creation of “ PathFinder” began.

        So the key goal of the project is to create an educational and entertaining game for users of different ages. Yes, everyone can be addicted to this game for a long time!

        The key mechanic of the game is building a path for the main character (Slime), with the condition to collect all the stars. Importantly, you don’t have to move Slime in real time. You have to compose an algorithm for its path along the platforms, start the movement and look at the result. Various tools are available to you to build a path: starting with banal turns and forward movements, repainting platforms and including more complex mechanics, such as repeating certain tasks (functions).

        So the user, using the toolbar, fills the input panel and starts the movement of the slime. After collecting all stars, the level will be completed. For a more comfortable game and stifle the level view, we have made 3 map view modes.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Levels

        In the game, we initially plan to make about 100 unique levels. In order to increase complexity, we want to guide users to the most difficult tasks that require maximum concentration.

Training

        We understand all the possible complexity of the mechanics and the threshold for entering the game, therefore we do full-fledged high-quality training of two types: manual - description and instructions in text form, for example, for quick hints or repetition, and a full-fledged tutorial with training levels, descriptions and video materials.

 

        We will also leave the users the opportunity to use hints while passing the levels, but their number is limited to one day.

        We make the game free for everyone, but we value the contributions of the people who support us. First, you will get access to the closed beta test of the game (and it will be very soon). We want to give you the opportunity to make real changes to the game. We are open to any kind of suggestions for improving the game. Most importantly, we want to give you the ability to design levels. Yes, if you think your level is unique and difficult enough, you can contact us to introduce it into the game. Just don't forget to throw off the walkthrough: xD

Where will the money go?

        The game is already 95% complete, but still plans include adding music sounds and improving the interface. Another important aspect is the payment for placement on the Google Play Store and App Store. The amount is small, but at this stage you will help us a lot.

500  - we are releasing the game for Andriod and IOS mobile platforms.

1500 - porting the game to Windows and Mac. This point already implies a significant improvement in the quality of visual effects, graphics and interface rework.

2500  - creation of a full-fledged workshop where users can create their own cards and add them to the game. It implies the development of its own server and card verification system.

4000+  - creating a game studio and launching an equally interesting and new project (and we already have ideas).

Thank You!

        Thank you so much for considering to support The PathFinder. We can't wait to get to present and make this the best game it can be!

- Trinity Games Team

story:
Short Summary

8 Bit Shinobi will be the newest arcade bar in Ottawa Ontario. We will be the first arcade bar to promote and feature Indie comic creators books. 

  • My name is Sean and I have been a fan of comics, games, and movies my whole life. 
  • This is important to me because I want to make gaming affordable by making a low cost entry fee. I want to offer the best selection of our in house craft beer and mead.  I want to give indie comic creators a chance to expand by having their comics available to read and buy them.   
  • Supporting this crowdfunding you will help local creators out, and you will help me create one of the best arcade bars in Ottawa. 
  • The money will go towards paying my amazing art team to finish off our comic book. The rest will go towards getting new games and equipment. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

 

Paranormal Academy 

 

Welcome to a world of magic and wonders. Paranormal Academy is a tale of a group of young heroes who are training to become protectors. A powerful necromancer has reunited the fallen order of the Necromancer King. An elven prince named Blue who must join the academy or risk being exiled by his father. Kitsune fell in love with the prince when he saved her life from goblins. Orin is a white mage goblin  who found a cripple child injured. The kid took a golem rock suit , and now has the power to control the earth. Nero is a necromancer who is afraid of his power because his power is so strong that he can hurt those he cares about. Alison is a mage in training who is trying to measure up to her mother’s legacy. This is an amazing book with 48 pages. All ten chapters are written variant covers comes with preview of book two. 

Our talented Artist 

Krystal Heart, @intheafterall, and Tessa Marie

 

 

 

Variant covers: By Krystal Heart

 

 

 

 

 

 

How to Make Nerdy Cocktails

Learn how to make cocktails from your favorite comic book, video game, anime, and more. Make your own extracts, and become a master mixologist. Create the perfect blend of slushy and ice cream. Become mutated with the secrets of the ooze cocktail.  Use your Jagan eye to summon from hell the dragon of the darkness flame. 

 

 

Mel's Marvels

This beautiful tile art can be used as a coaster, wall decoration , or redo your kitchen floors. The possibilities are endless.  These title arts are created by Mel who is just an awesome local artist. 

 

 

 

Pixel Art

 

This is created by the youngest shinobi, my brother David.  They are hand crafted from your favorite videogame, comic, and pop culture. It comes in 3 sizes, mini, medium, and Large.  We also have key chains.

 

 

 

 

 

Custom Arcade

 

 

This arcade can be custom to your liking. Get the side panel and marque of your choice.  This comes with over 20 000 games from your favorite arcade and retro console. 

 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aSipzXKySng&amp...

 

Stretch goals 

 

Goal 1: 200

With this reward level unlocked. You will be able to choice between a glass and beer mug stein. With the purchase of a glass or a mug , we will throw in our course on how to make your own beer and wine. 

 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6BdvpX8U6po&amp...

 

 

Stretch goal 2: 500.   With this reward level unlocked our 3d print figures will become available. We will also be giving away x-wings with our orders. 

 

 

 

Stretch goal  3: 700. With this level unlocked you will get your pick of our 3d printed keychains. 

 

 

 

Stretch goal 4 900. This reward level will get you an entry into our give away.  A variant cover of the death of wolverine signed by Steve Blum.  This is a hard item to part with. I actually chatted with Steve Blum with my comic idea and he loved it.  Every 10 dollars your spend gives you a bonus entry. Draws will take place once the crowdfunding is funded

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3P86OvNTpM8&amp...

 

 

Stretch goal 5: 1000. Once this reward is unlocked you will get your own customized helmet. Get a the helmet from 300, X-Men magneto, and more.  Take your cosplay to the next level. 

 

                

Stretch goal 6: 2000.  At this level we have an amazing one of a kind give away.  Get a singed copy of X-Men from Stan the Man Lee. This is the hardest give away. I am a huge fan of Stan Lee and when I got to meet him we got cut off and he met with us after the show and signed that very comic book. Every 10 dollars gives you a bonus entry. The draw will begin once we hit out goal.

 

 

Goal 7: 5000. Unlock the next level of give away.  Get the bleach zanpakuto created by fire and steal.    Every 10 dollars gives you a bonus entry. The draw will begin once we hit out goal.

 

 

 

Stretch goal 8: 10 000. Once we have unlocked this reward we will give away.  We are giving away an custom arcade cabinet with over 20 000 games from consoles to arcade we can get it.  These cabinets are hand crafted, and the arts designed to your specifications. 

 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aSipzXKySng&amp...

 

 

 

 

 

  • We will need 10 000 to make this project come to life. With those funds I will use it to buy gaming equipment, brew equipment, and  paying our talented staff who have worked so hard. We will also start on our comic project. 
  • We have come up with some amazing prizes for those who contribute to the campaign.  We have worked with local small business to bring you the best items.  By supporting us you will help support local communities. We have the ultimate guide to making nerdy cocktails, the secret of the ooze, the dragon of the darkness flame, Stay puff Marshmallow man, and the Hadoken. We have glasses , beer mugs, and cocktail makers to make your amazing cocktails. We have a custom made magneto helmet for mutants to bend metal. Once we hit our stretch goals, we are going to offer some more amazing rewards. 
  • If we are not able to reach our goal that means we will have to look at taking on loans. We  will have less money for our team and equipment. 

The Impact

By helping us fund this project, you will help other creators on our team get their dreams off the ground. We will be able to expand our project and create our own content that is original and fresh. 

  • Our team wants to create a place where any one can play retro games that are hard to find, new games, vr, without paying a fortune.  
  • We have gone to comic conventions , and we have been very successful. 
  • This will help out other small business and bring jobs to our community. 

Risks & Challenges

This is a large undertaking with a lot of moving parts to it. Its going to take a lot of money to get this of the ground. This project may not get enough funding , and we may have to take on a lot of debt. 

  • I have worked hard to gain momentum in the community, and have gained support with influences.  
  • We plan to get over these hurdles by getting expert advice and learning from our mistakes.  I will also not give up. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you are not able to support us you can share this , follow us on social media.  Twitter @8shinobi, youtube 8 bitshinobi. You can also contact me if you have any video game equipment at grownuptrunks@gmail.com

story:
About The Game

 

 

Game Features

 

 

Game Modes

 

 

A Quick Peak

 

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

There are challenges & risks that come with every ambitious project and we understand that there may be unforeseen delays that may come along the way. As a small yet enthusiastic & experienced team, we do outsource certain aspects of our work which automatically comes with its own risk. Additionally, problems risen out shipping & delivery of physical items, geographical or terroristic mishaps are some of the other challenges that we, like everybody else, have to face when working on such a project.

In spite of such risks & challenges, we are confident that with our experience, passion and dedication - we will be able to overcome any shortcomings from our partners or internal teams & make up for any loss to ensure our supporters do not suffer. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everybody who will view our pitch will be in a position to contribute even if they believe in our project. But if you've enjoyed what you've seen so far, we earnestly request you to help in any other way you can. Social sharing, email sharing or simply by word of mouth, you can help us reach a bigger audience. Help us bring DEFCOM to life and to every user that enjoys an authentic first-person shooter game!

story:
Play the demo! It's FREE!

 

 

Who is the fastest? The more accurate? The more skilled shooter? Immerse yourself in the game, point your gun and shoot! You will experience the tension of a 1 x 1 duel, unlike anything else!

The feeling of being inside a game is astonishing, enabled by Virtual Reality and the wonderful HTC Vive headset. For years, we were waiting for this kind of technology and the future is finally here! VR is a very direct medium for a shooter game and the pleasure of holding a gun in a virtual world is pure bliss.

Without further ado, VRSUS is a Virtual Reality duel shooter game for the HTC Vive.

Play the demo now! It's FREE!

 

 

The game will feature many types of guns, ranging from old western guns to modern assault rifles. For instance:

  • M1911 Pistol (try on demo)
  • AKM Russian Assault Rifle (try on demo)
  • UZI Submachine Gun
  • MP5 Submachine Gun
  • M4A1 Assault Rifle
  • Mauser German Pistol
  • eventually some futuristic weapons too! (lasers anyone? plasma grenades? missiles?)

M1911 (image credit 3D store from Unity Asset Store https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/conten...)

AKM (image credit ChermandirKun from Unity Asset Store https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/conten...)

As you can see, these assets are very detailed and I highly recommend them.

 

AKM in action at Western Arena

We want to make a lot of arenas, with a very wide range of settings and atmospheres, such as:

  • Western Arena: a barren place, where a train casually pass by (try on demo)
  • Bridge Ruins: an abandoned bridge in an apocalyptic setting
  • Rooftops: feel vertigo while dueling atop very high buildings
  • Coliseum: go back to a Rome-like arena, with the crowd cheering for their favorite duelists
  • Desert: the desolation, sand and Sun, lots of Sun. Bring your sunglasses!
  • Low Poly World: a non existent place, possible only in VR! Have you ever imagined yourself inside a low poly world?
  • Office: computers, a cup of coffee, little cubicles. Shoot and piles of paper and laptops will fly!

 

And of course, we want the game to have a lot of enemies! Like:

  • bodyguards: mildly armed
  • policemen: armed, and they know how to handle a gun
  • army men: heavily armed
  • hitmen: prepare to die
  • normal people: well, some may be gun addicts, you never know
  • zombies (maybe? depends if players find them interesting enough, tell us what you think!)
  • aliens (maybe? same as zombies)

All enemies will be fully animated with a variety of unpredictable movement sets and with a deadly AI.

The game is a FPS so expect to see some gore. Blood spilling and sound effects of flesh being hit will be carefully chosen and tailored to provide an immersive experience. Some blood is already in the demo, try it!

 

The bodyguard spares no one! Do not spill blood in vain, donate it instead #brotip

We want to develop at least two Game Modes:

  • Survivor Mode: duel a series of enemies until you are defeated (or not?)
  • Shooting Range (and/or minigames): to test guns and rack high scores

One may ask why don't we stick only to a western type of game, more suitable for duels? As fans of FPS games, we feel that we would be very limited if we stuck only to old guns and western-type locations. As players, we want variety, we want freedom to choose the guns we like most and above all, we want YOU TO HAVE FUN!

Ultimately, we want to publish the game on Steam, or at an indie game website, like itch.io (the demo is already there!).

 

 

Why do we need to raise funds?

To put it shortly: the more beautiful and detailed assets are paid. So part of the funding will be devoted to buy the best assets to deliver a high level of detail and fine tune the experience.

Some gun models, which are extremely well done, cost a few dollars (USD 5-10) to some dozens of dollars (USD 50+). The same for props which are used in the environments. Blood and sound effects which are professionally recorded cost some more as well. Unfortunately, there's a limit to what can be achieved with free assets, so we feel that fundraising is needed. We expect to buy at least 500-1000 dollars of assets depending on how much we can raise.

Extremely detailed weapons, such this Desert Eagle are paid (image credit Black Light Studio from Unity Asset Store https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/conten...)

Another part of the funding will be used to pay myself for my work. I guarantee that I will work at least part time on this game - about 20h per week for a few months. And pay a cut to my 2 partners who helped me get the Vive for development. Without them, this demo would not even exist!

Help us make all of this happen! Let's build the VR shooter we all wanted together! Early backers can get the full game at a discount price! #brotip

 

 

Roughly, we divided the features by difficulty of development and how much value they will add to the game. This is what we have planned depending on how much we can raise:

  • 1000 ~ 2500 USD raised
    • Better voices: new enemy voices, new player voices
    • Better enemy animations: a more diverse set of movements
    • Different bodyguard enemies: 3 or 4 in total
    • Arena: Rooftops
    • Arena: Coliseum
    • 2 pistols (made with free assets)
    • 4 machine guns (made with free assets)
  • 2500 ~ 5000 USD raised
    • Improve enemy AI: more fine tuned according to level of difficulty
    • Arena: Office
    • Arena: Bridge Ruins
    • Better blood effects: persistent blood, better blood splatters
    • Better sound effects: more varied gun sounds, ricochets etc
  • 5000 ~ 7500 USD raised
    • Fire bullet prefabs: for better visual effects when shooting
    • Paid weapons: extremely detailed and gorgeous weapons will be added
    • Arena: Desert
    • Arena: Low Poly World
  • 7500 ~ 10000 USD raised
    • Weapon animations: gun cocking, more fine details on gun behavior
    • Shooting Range: game mode
    • Army Enemy: a very lethal one, with heavy guns
    • Publish on Steam

That's not a "set in stone" list of features, but a ballpark estimate. We may change the timings if we feel that some feature will be more interesting for the game than others and end up developing them first. But rest assured that we will only change the estimates for the better! We can add more features to the list as well.

Do we intend to put online features? That would be awesome indeed, but we will work on such features only if we can raise the campaign value, as stretch goals. We understand that players like PvP, Coop and Online Leaderboards so it will not be ignored if the campaign fares well.

 

 

This demo was developed as a final project for Udacity's VR Nanodegree. So at this point, it's a one man work only. It took me about 120 hours of scavenging free assets on Unity Asset Store and programming to be able to materialize a small portion of what I had in mind. And I coded everything myself: the shooting algorithms, the enemy AI and the design of the Western Arena.

In every step of its making, I had in mind that we wanted the game to be expanded and released commercially. I say we, because of the two partners that helped me buy the Vive to complete the course and be able to develop and deliver VR experiences.

I worked full time as a software developer (mostly with Java and JS) for more than 10 years, so I'm confident that I can and I will deliver everything enumerated in the feature list (subject to fundraising values). Depending on the funding level, I can get one more person with a similar background to mine and we can speed up the development process. In this case, said person will be one of my two partners.

In case we can't reach the initial 10,000 USD intended, we will take what was raised and develop everything that was listed up to the value raised.

 

 

A Udacity project reviewer said:

"One word to describe your project - Excellent! It can be seen that you have kept a lot of time and effort in crafting this project. Very much appreciated. The user testing you did really helped in keeping high detail into the game (bullet shells and non-infinite bullets). I also liked the lighting in your game, the enemy AI and the audio. (...) Your game clearly gives a different experience! I loved it."

This gave us more confidence that the game is heading in the right direction and it will be a diverse and fun experience for the players!

 

 

Please share this project on Facebook, Twitter, e-mail (use the share tools on this campaign, they are neat!), spread word about it! We will be very grateful!

Follow our updates and our evolution on the campaign as well!

 

Disclaimer

*The demo may not reflect the final game. We intend to make it BETTER!

*We do not condone gun violence! It's a game and as such, have fun with it just as a game only! (suggested for a more mature audience, 16, 18 or 21 years old, depending on your country)

*HTC Vive headset not included. We are not affiliated with HTC in any way.
story_txt:
Play the demo! It's FREE!  Who is the fastest? The more accurate? The more skilled shooter? Immerse yourself in the game, point your gun and shoot! You will experience the tension of a 1 x 1 duel, unlike anything else!The feeling of being inside a game is astonishing, enabled by Virtual Reality and the wonderful HTC Vive headset. For years, we were waiting for this kind of technology and the future is finally here! VR is a very direct medium for a shooter game and the pleasure of holding a gun in a virtual world is pure bliss.Without further ado, VRSUS is a Virtual Reality duel shooter game for the HTC Vive.Play the demo now! It's FREE!  The game will feature many types of guns, ranging from old western guns to modern assault rifles. For instance:

M1911 Pistol (try on demo)

AKM Russian Assault Rifle (try on demo)

UZI Submachine Gun

MP5 Submachine Gun

M4A1 Assault Rifle

Mauser German Pistol
eventually some futuristic weapons too! (lasers anyone? plasma grenades? missiles?)
M1911 (image credit 3D store from Unity Asset Store https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/conten...)AKM (image credit ChermandirKun from Unity Asset Store https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/conten...)As you can see, these assets are very detailed and I highly recommend them. AKM in action at Western ArenaWe want to make a lot of arenas, with a very wide range of settings and atmospheres, such as:

Bridge Ruins: an abandoned bridge in an apocalyptic setting

Rooftops: feel vertigo while dueling atop very high buildings

Coliseum: go back to a Rome-like arena, with the crowd cheering for their favorite duelists

Desert: the desolation, sand and Sun, lots of Sun. Bring your sunglasses!

Low Poly World: a non existent place, possible only in VR! Have you ever imagined yourself inside a low poly world?

Office: computers, a cup of coffee, little cubicles. Shoot and piles of paper and laptops will fly!
 And of course, we want the game to have a lot of enemies! Like:

bodyguards: mildly armed

policemen: armed, and they know how to handle a gun

army men: heavily armed

hitmen: prepare to die

normal people: well, some may be gun addicts, you never know
zombies (maybe? depends if players find them interesting enough, tell us what you think!)
aliens (maybe? same as zombies)

story:
What is Hero Potential?

Hero Potential is a multiplayer co-op superhero themed horde mode shooter.  But that's a mouthful, so what does that mean exactly?   Hero Potential is similar to games like Call of Duty: Zombies or Killing Floor, but set in a world of superpowers and heroics.  You choose one of the standard heroes and pick their powers from three separate classes, or pick a predefined superhero like Cyberfrog or Silkworm and then try to survive as long as possible as ever increasingly difficult waves of evil robot AI try to take you out.    

  • Choose from 19 offensive powers, 19 defensive powers and 16 damage/defense enhancing powers and mix and match them any way you want
  • in addition to superpowers, there are 13 real world weapons and 7 future tech weapons available to help you survive the extinction level event.   It's desperate so our heroes use any means to help them stay alive.   
  • While intended as a co-op multiplayer game it does have a single player mode if multiplayer isn't your thing.  

Who Is making Hero Potential?

My name is Dwayne Douglass, aka oddjob, aka Harrison Bergeron and I’m a old school Half-Life modder who has been making games for 20 years.  If you want to hear more about me, check out this video on my background in video games: https://youtu.be/ywyXQGXkqy8

Hero Potential started back in 2018 as simple project I used as a way to teach myself to code.  I would think of a superpower or weapon and then figure out how to make it work in my test game. It slowly morphed into an idea for a game alongside the script I was writing for a comic. And that idea became Hero Potential.  This is a passion project that has been my solo weekend project for nearly two years and my "full time job” for the last 5 months as I rewrote all my previous work into this single game. Your contribution will allow me to continue to focus my time and energy in bringing this game to market.

What do you get when you back Hero Potential and where does your money go?

At the core, for your contribution you get a copy of the game on Steam and any platform it is released on in the future (Xbox, PlayStation, Nintendo Switch, etc.) and access to Beta testing once it begins. And your contribution will go directly into the production of this game:

  • All backers get $5 off the price of the base game right off the bat from the price on platforms like Steam, Epic Game Store and the Xbox.
  • I’m asking for $10,000 which will allow me to purchase necessary software and new hardware to replace my aging laptop for production and hire a programmer to fill in the gaps of my knowledge, specifically the integration into the different platforms(Steam, Epic, Xbox, etc) and networking.
  • Any addition funding will be put towards production: hiring artists, level designers and animators to polish the game and add features. 
  • There’s no shipping fee and no need for me to collect your mailing address.  You’ll be emailed a Steam Key when it’s ready to release.
  • Depending on the rules of the platforms it will be released on (some are strict with crowdfunding), I'll give all backers a copy of the game on any platform it eventually releases on in addition to the initial Steam release at no additional cost.   So if it eventually releases on Xbox Series X or PlayStation 5 and I am able to give keys out on those platforms, you'll receive those as well as pat of of the original backing of this project.  

 

 

Why Paid DLC?

DLC is how I am able to offer the chance to play as your favorite comic characters, be it Cecil, the Jawbreakers or Cyberfrog. I’m very honored that creators like Ethan Van Sciver and Richard C Meyer have entrusted me with their characters.  The funds received from the DLC will go primarily to the license holders.  So it's basically a way to pay those creators for use of their characters.   I plan to release a total of four paid DLC to get your favorite  characters into the game. No other microtransactions. 

All other content added to the game will be free.  New characters, new maps, new powers, features or weapons, etc.  This includes plans to release free DLC character content to offer an even wider variety of indie comic characters from other creators as playable characters in the game.  (And if you are interested in your character making an appearance in the game, hit me up and we'll talk!)

Stretch Goals:

Here are our first three stretch goals with more to be announced as we reach these first two:

  • $30,000 First Person Mode. You’ll be able to switch between first and third person on command to play how you prefer to play.
  • $60,000 Split Screen Co-Op, aka Couch Co-Op.   Play with your friends in split screen mode!
  • $100,000 5v5 Team PVP mode added. Why 5v5?  So you can play as the whole Jawbreakers team vs whoever wants to try to stand toe to toe with them!

I don't have any others to announce yet but if this campaign ends up successful enough even things like a fully destructible environment using Unreal' Chaos engine (Shown here:  https://youtu.be/wZN2ZTzaDU4?t=17 ) or perhaps a Street Fighter fighting game mode as an upper 6 figures perks. 

On a side note, the addition of some stretch goal features may necessitate pushing back the release date or having that particular feature added after the stated release date for the start of Closed Beta Testing of Nov 2021.  

Risks & Challenges

The core game is already functional. The backbone of the game is there.  The rest of production will be adding features and polishing up what is in the game already and then porting to the various platforms for release.  Unlike many games that crowdfund, Hero Potential is fairly far along in development.  All of that said there’s still a ton of work to do and that’s the biggest risk.  But as you can see from the progress already made, I am up to that challenge. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you care about this project and want to see it succeed there’s one important thing you can do to help make that happen:  Spread the word!  Tell your friends!  Pass it along!

story:
• ​My name is Josemar Pedro, I am a Programmer, Game Design and founder of Antold Studio.  With your support, your money, we can make this game a virtual learning.
  • This project is most important for us because this game reminds us of all methods of prevention and higieny. The game will have other languages for all can enjoy and learn. 
  • Imagine the impact that this game can have on the lives of our children, students in schools and for generations to come. Keeping our hands clean, always!




1. A CHALLENGING STRATEGY GAME

               The main focus of the game is to be intuitive, without many special effects. Being a strategy game, we will give priority to making your gameplay challenging in terms of logical reasoning and critical thinking. The player will need to be observant and use logic to be able to win.
 

  • In this current game scenario, the character starts in his room, sitting on the bed. This means that he will have to change the bed sheets, but first he needs to disinfect his hands first so as not to infect the second sheet (the new one).
  • After disinfesting or washing his hands, the character will change his clothes, if he decides to go to bathe first, his body will be possibly infected again because he used the same clothes again. The same happens if you change clothes before disinfecting your hands first, the second clothes will also be possibly infected.
  • Notice that at the table with a glass, this means that the character drank something (and without disinfecting his hands). It is up to the player to have to wash the glass, but first put some type of disinfectant in the dishwasher (sink). But not only, the table will also need to be disinfected, as well as the refrigerator, because it was from there that the character got something to drink.
  • Remember that this game will be a real simulation, so any knowledge about viruses or prevention during a pandemic will be advantageous. Yes, even knowing about the virus on a metal surface or leaving the windows open makes all the difference.


 

2. WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET
 

  • We need this funding to be able to obtain physical materials such as computers with higher capacity and speed, digital materials such as modeling, animation and art, all in order to develop other scenarios in the game, use more realistic graphics and more unique sound effects. All this on both Mobile and PC systems, the same game on both platforms, and in the future, release for Console.
  • Imagine how good it will be for others while playing and also learn what they may have forgotten about avoiding viruses. We are also grateful to include the name of all funders in the credits of the game when it is complete. You will be part of it, and will have the game in all platforms!
     


 

3. THE IMPACT
 

  • This campaign is about helping to develop a game in its entirety.
  • Our game with the name "180 Seconds" is in early access. At the moment we only have 1 scenario, we need funds to be able to obtain physical as well as digital materials, in order to develop other scenarios in the game, use better graphics and more sound effects.
  • Here is the link to our game in Early Access, available for android on the Play Store. https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=c...


How will the money raised in this campaign be used?
 

  • Most of the money will go towards paying everyone working on the project and the features mentioned earlier..
  • Part of the money will be used to pay for any software licenses and hardware necessary for development of the game.


4. RISKS & CHALLENGES         

               For the development of the demo, most of the main game features were already implemented, and the few mechanics that do need to be added are not likely to pose a problem.

In terms of game development, I’ve already moved to counter my biggest risks:
 

  • I’ve produced a demo that represents a full vertical slice of gameplay, with all core systems in place. This means that of the work remaining, it’s almost entirely content, and I already have workflows and internal tools in place to rapidly build more.
  • I’ve scoped out the content of the game, determined how much development time each element needs, and based my campaign budget on that. I’ve also taken some content I wanted to have in the core game and positioned it as a stretch goal, leaving just the minimum scope needed to produce my envisioned end-product.
  • I’m not tackling tasks that are complete question marks, like porting to consoles. While for Switch sounds amazing. I’ll be focusing on what I can account for and developing for PC first, after that, revisit consoles.
     

               For the aspects of development I’m less familiar with – namely, technical behind-the-scenes work like memory management and hardware support – I’ve cultivated a network of fellow developers who regularly exchange advice and guidance (which I also contribute to!). For these types of new hurdles, I’ve found a bit of direction getting started is enough to let me run with it again. For this reason I formed a team.



               Our team is made up of talented developers, composers, artists, programmers and system analysts. We all share the same vision.

AND NOW WE ARE HERE:
Josemar Benvindo Pedro - Game Design and Developer
Ricardo Miranda - Programmer
Otiniel Kamu - Systems Analyst
Carlos Peres - Artist and Technical Animator
Sony Francisco - Composer
Eud Bernardo - Biologist
story_txt:
​My name is Josemar Pedro, I am a Programmer, Game Design and founder of Antold Studio.  With your support, your money, we can make this game a virtual learning.
This project is most important for us because this game reminds us of all methods of prevention and higieny. The game will have other languages for all can enjoy and learn. 
Imagine the impact that this game can have on the lives of our children, students in schools and for generations to come. Keeping our hands clean, always!
1. A CHALLENGING STRATEGY GAME               The main focus of the game is to be intuitive, without many special effects. Being a strategy game, we will give priority to making your gameplay challenging in terms of logical reasoning and critical thinking. The player will need to be observant and use logic to be able to win. 
In this current game scenario, the character starts in his room, sitting on the bed. This means that he will have to change the bed sheets, but first he needs to disinfect his hands first so as not to infect the second sheet (the new one).
After disinfesting or washing his hands, the character will change his clothes, if he decides to go to bathe first, his body will be possibly infected again because he used the same clothes again. The same happens if you change clothes before disinfecting your hands first, the second clothes will also be possibly infected.
Notice that at the table with a glass, this means that the character drank something (and without disinfecting his hands). It is up to the player to have to wash the glass, but first put some type of disinfectant in the dishwasher (sink). But not only, the table will also need to be disinfected, as well as the refrigerator, because it was from there that the character got something to drink.

Remember that this game will be a real simulation, so any knowledge about viruses or prevention during a pandemic will be advantageous. Yes, even knowing about the virus on a metal surface or leaving the windows open makes all the difference.
 2. WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET 
We need this funding to be able to obtain physical materials such as computers with higher capacity and speed, digital materials such as modeling, animation and art, all in order to develop other scenarios in the game, use more realistic graphics and more unique sound effects. All this on both Mobile and PC systems, the same game on both platforms, and in the future, release for Console.

Imagine how good it will be for others while playing and also learn what they may have forgotten about avoiding viruses. We are also grateful to include the name of all funders in the credits of the game when it is complete. You will be part of it, and will have the game in all platforms! 
 3. THE IMPACT 
This campaign is about helping to develop a game in its entirety.
Our game with the name "180 Seconds" is in early access. At the moment we only have 1 scenario, we need funds to be able to obtain physical as well as digital materials, in order to develop other scenarios in the game, use better graphics and more sound effects.
Here is the link to our game in Early Access, available for android on the Play Store. https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=c...
How will the money raised in this campaign be used? 
Most of the money will go towards paying everyone working on the project and the features mentioned earlier..
Part of the money will be used to pay for any software licenses and hardware necessary for development of the game.
4. RISKS & CHALLENGES                        For the development of the demo, most of the main game features were already implemented, and the few mechanics that do need to be added are not likely to pose a problem.In terms of game development, I’ve already moved to counter my biggest risks: 
I’ve produced a demo that represents a full vertical slice of gameplay, with all core systems in place. This means that of the work remaining, it’s almost entirely content, and I already have workflows and internal tools in place to rapidly build more.
I’ve scoped out the content of the game, determined how much development time each element needs, and based my campaign budget on that. I’ve also taken some content I wanted to have in the core game and positioned it as a stretch goal, leaving just the minimum scope needed to produce my envisioned end-product.
I’m not tackling tasks that are complete question marks, like porting to consoles. While for Switch sounds amazing. I’ll be focusing on what I can account for and developing for PC first, after that, revisit consoles. 
               For the aspects of development I’m less familiar with – namely, technical behind-the-scenes work like memory management and hardware support – I’ve cultivated a network of fellow developers who regularly exchange advice and guidance (which I also contribute to!). For these types of new hurdles, I’ve found a bit of direction getting started is enough to let me run with it again. For this reason I formed a team.               Our team is made up of talented developers, composers, artists, programmers and system analysts. We all share the same vision.AND NOW WE ARE HERE:Josemar Benvindo Pedro - Game Design and DeveloperRicardo Miranda - ProgrammerOtiniel Kamu - Systems AnalystCarlos Peres - Artist and Technical AnimatorSony Francisco - ComposerEud Bernardo - Biologist

story:
Gnome More War is an action shooter/castle defense hybrid for Android and iOS devices. It was mainly inspired by one of my childhood favorite NES games: Pooyan.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pooyan

It wasn't a very big hit even back then, but it stuck with me somehow. With the advent of castle defense games on mobile phones, I immediately got reminded of the game and I thought it will feel at home on mobile devices. Of course, I didn't want to just clone a game. Instead what I did is take the elements of Pooyan that I liked and added my own designs on top.

The output is a castle defense game in the sense that you as the player will have to fend off incoming gnomes who plan to steal your chickens, ducks, pigs, etc. from your barn. The way you will defend your farm is by shooting at them while they parachute down to the ground, hence the action shooter part. You will be equipped with an arsenal of power-ups to help you survive and at the same time shoot as much gnomes as possible. Furthermore, you will be able to mix and match upgrades from armor enhancements to recruiting your goblin friends as support fire.

The 3 maps that come with the game

The game currently has 3 maps, categorized as Easy, Normal, and Hard. Enemy gnomes will arrive in waves, with a map having up to 50 waves to complete. In the beginning the player will only have access to the first map. Finishing a map will award the player with at least one Map Badge. These badges can be used to unlock more maps.

I have already put an incredible amount of hours into the development of the game, to the point where I have a stable and playable version. If you want to experience it, you can already download it from the Google Playstore as it is currently in open beta: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.hobbigames.gnomemorewar

Gameplay video:

 

 

 

 

You may be wondering, "If the game is already playable, why start a funding campaign?". Actually, despite working on the game to the point of completion, there are still features that I would like to add, and for me to be able to add them as soon as possible, I will need help from you guys! It took me two years to get to this point and that's because I've been doing this on my very limited free time. With proper funding, I can finally focus on my passion project, improve it, polish it, and release a game that I know players will enjoy.

As it stands, the game already has 3 maps, fully populated with 19 gnomes across the board. While I think the number is balanced and diverse enough, what I really wanted to add are Boss fights. This would complete the map experience.

I think it would be cool to get to fight a boss from time to time throughout the level. These bosses will have to be diverse, so additional time for the artwork, sound, and programming will be much needed.

Some boss concepts

 

 

Where does the money go?

Funds I will gather from this campaign is mainly to support my development. I will be the artist, designer, programmer, and composer. I plan to use the money to support myself for the entire development process.

Some of the money will go to registration and development fees, which at the moment pertains to the App Store (I need to pay a membership fee in order to put up games on there). A few will go to marketing post-launch. I will also need to pay the Indiegogo fee, and since I live outside the U.S., bank transfers will incur some fees too.

 

What do you get if you contribute?

My eternal gratitude! Seriously, not just that. I have planned out a bunch of stuff should you decide to part with your cash for my project.

For $2 or more

Contributor

You will be given 80 gems. A gem is one of the in-game currencies used mainly to continue the fight after you're down, or unlock cosmetic skins. Normally, $1 will give you 20 gems, but if you use that money to fund my project you'll be getting twice as much!

 

For $5 or more

Donor

Contributor rewards apply. Your name will appear in the credits screen with the title Donor. You will also get the Shark-pedo cart skin for FREE!

The "Shark-pedo" skin will be yours

 

For $15 or more

Patron

Contributor, and Donor rewards apply. Your name will appear in the credits screen with the title Patron. I will also design a new exclusive cart skin which you will get for FREE! Finally, you'll get a FREE wallpaper for your phone or PC.

The Hall of Heroes is for our Indiegogo backers!

 

For $30 or more

Earl/Countess

Contributor, Donor, and Patron rewards apply. Your name will appear in the credits screen with the title Earl or Countess. You will get a special thanks animation that would appear in-game.

 

 

 

This is just a mock-up

A non-interactive character will fly by the skies during the level at certain intervals.

 

For $75 or more

Duke/Duchess

Contributor, Donor, Patron and Earl/Countess rewards apply. Your name will appear in the credits screen with the title Duke or Duchess. Your in-game special thanks animation will be piloted by no other than YOU! To make this possible, you will need to send me a picture of yourself, so I can make a pixelized version.

 

For $200 or more

King/Queen

Wow, you'd do this for me? OMG thanks! Contributor, Donor, Patron, Earl/Countess, and Duke/Duchess rewards apply. Your name will appear in the credits screen with the title King or Queen. For giving this much, you deserve more than game perks, but stickers as well! A set of Gnome More War stickers will be sent over to you. Not only that, but you get to co-design a cart skin, and it will be named after you! Of course you will get your designed cart for FREE. Other players can enjoy it but they will have to unlock it. And finally, you will be part of the actual gameplay as a gnome! Just send me a picture of yourself and I will create a gnome in your image. Now you and all the other players will see a bunch of yourself running around, stealing chickens.

This could be you!

 

 

What happens if I fail to reach my target funding?

The game will be released either way, but it will be on Android only, and there will be no boss battles :(

It goes without saying, but none of the stretch goals will see the light of day, unless I can find another way to fund the development.

 

 

 

I want to do more-- much, much more. If ever I exceed my Tier 1 target funding I will add a new map that will play more like a Zen Mode. In this mode, there will be no worry from dying or having your chickens stolen from you. All you will need to do is pop as many balloons as you can within the given time. You will have to reorganize your upgrades deck and equip a different set of power-ups to get the highest score possible and lead the global leaderboard!

Further funding will enable me to add more maps, more enemy types, and more bosses! Hell, I might even be able to port the game to the Nintendo Switch.

 

 

I am Lorie Jay Gutierrez, from the Philippines. I'm 35 years old as of this writing, and I am a professional software engineer for about 15 years. I'm proficient in C and C++, mainly for embedded systems. I'm also knowledgeable of Java (Android, Enterprise), HTML, C#, and so on. I am a gamer since the NES days, growing up on coin-op arcade boxes. My favorite genres are RTS and RPGs, and I want to be able to develop and release such games in the future, when they're feasible.

In college I used to make small mini games using C, C++, or Java. I started tinkering with game making engines in 2003, when I stumbled upon RPG Maker and RPG Toolkit.

An unreleased game I was making

Another game I made in the past

Nowadays I use Unity to develop my games, which you can check out through my website (http://hobbigames.com)

I am Hobbi Games. I do all art, design, programming, and music myself and would love to get to the point where I could hire other talented people to help me with some of the stuff. All games I've made in the past were done in my spare time. As you can imagine, having a full time programming job leaves me with little free time to do what I really want-- which is to make games.

I truly wish this is the start of the realization of my life long dream. I've got loads of ideas that I want to put out there in the world for everyone to enjoy.

Thank you for the time!

Cheers,

LJ

 

Risks & challenges

I'm no Iwata, Kojima, or Igarashi. My professional experience is from software engineering, and game development has been more of a hobby for me. This will be the first time that I'm gonna work on my passion project while under pressure (e.g. deadlines), but I'm confident It won't be a problem for me. I've been used to dealing and beating deadlines for 15 years, and those weren't even the type of work I'm remotely interested in.

As for designing games, I'm also relatively new at it, but with everyone's help I'm sure I will be able to develop and release a fun game many people will love.

 

On a final note...

I hope by this point I have convinced you to help fund my project, but in case you're still on the fence, just hear me out one last time.

If this project isn't really your cup of tea, have I at least impressed you in any way? If I did, then think of your contribution, no matter the amount, as a statement of how much you believe in my potential. I dream of making bigger and better games that's more in line with my own favorite genres and that would potentially resonate with a wider audience. Furthermore, this project might just be the break that I need to finally transition to a full-time game developer. Nothing beats having a job that you actually love, than the one that pays the rent, right? I have been working for 15 years now, and while my job is in no way bad (it's great, actually), it still doesn't give me the same creative high as making a game. This is me taking the risk by leaving the safer road to follow my own dream.

 

Other ways you can help

Are you ready to back my project? That's awesome! Can't fund my project? No problem! You can help me further by sharing my game and campaign to your friends who might be interested. Please help me spread the word.

 

 

THANK YOU!

story:
Mira el contenido de esta campaña en español aquí.

Rockin'Space

“... an official report from the Earth’s Army confirms the first contact of asteroids with our atmosphere [...]  the nations leader, Anita Job, informed this morning about the launching of Nora, the first SpaceBot, whose mission is to clean the space…”

These are the news the day the human race starts to fight their own extinction. Major world powers have joined their forces to create the SpaceBots program, a squadron of ships piloted by highly qualified robots, in order to save life on Earth.

In Rockin'Space, you take control over a SpaceBot to delve into the depths of space and fight against the deadly asteroids. Choose your SpaceBot, load your weapons and save the human race! Unlock even more SpaceBots and improvements as you earn points out in the space!

But be careful, as you may find some enemies on your way…


The Game

Rockin'Space is a casual game for iOS and Android devices, in which the main objective is to destroy waves of asteroids and enemy ships in fast paced and progressive difficulty levels.

By earning points, the player can unlock ships, weapons and other enhancements to return in combat, as well as compete with their friends and other players in global leaderboards.


The game will be distributed for free on the iTunes Store and Google Play. Players can acquire Space Stones (virtual currency) during the game, or buying them with real money, in order to achieve faster improvements.

Promotion will be done through social networks and virtual technology magazines, initially aiming to reach casual gamers in America and Europe, and eventually the rest of the world.

What’s the funding money for?

The money is intended to cover development (production, design, programming and music composition), distribution and promotion costs, as well as intellectual property and copyright registries.

Note that we will only be funded if and when we reach our goal, so all rewards are guaranteed. In case we didn't reach our funding goal, all of your money will be refunded.

The perks

You can get a digital copy of Rockin'Space Original Soundtrack from just $5! This is a special price for contributors, before we sell it in iTunes.
 
You can also get awesome physical rewards, like this exclusive Nora USB Memory Stick of 4GB for just $20, including the soundtrack!

We also have special Rockin'Space t-shirts (men, women and children; small, medium and large) and caps (one size) for you. Get both for as little as $35!


Check out all other great perks we have for you in the right side of this page!
Note: All pictures are for preview purposes only. Final products may be subject of change.

Other ways to support us

If you want to support our project but you don’t want to invest in one of our incredible rewards, you can do so by:

  • Sharing this campaign with your social networks.
  • Following and sharing our page at Facebook
  • Following and sharing our channel at YouTube
  • Following and sharing our company page at LinkedIn
  • Following and sharing us at Instagram

If you are a game developer, you can also buy one of the assets we have at the Unity Asset Store. These are small parts of our development we’re selling in order to support the project. To see all of our currently available assets, please visit our Unity Asset Store Page; and please make sure to rate and comment the assets you buy!

About ExaGames

We’re an indie game studio composed by talents from around the world with innovative ideas, knowledge and experience in game development. A combination of skilled people that prints all their passion and dedication into this first project together, with the goal of becoming a large company and create memorable games.

story:
We are creating a game app, for Android and Apple, that basically boosts all the features of the strategic styles of games like Clash of Clans, Dominations and Clash of Lords and we have taken out all the unnecessary elements that ruined the flow of those games.

A video game should always provide something fresh and unique to those who play it. We truly worked hard to come up with the most essential elements of the games that have become huge hits all over the world, but we are bringing in very unique and useful elements. For example, the players will be able to level up there troops by using them, not by paying huge amounts of resources and waiting for days to complete.





Think of a supercharged Age of Empires style game that has been upgraded for mobiles. To most people the name Clash of Clans will be more familiar and the addictive elements of this game has all been brought to Age of Stickmen.

We have worked very hard to get this entire game concept moving forward with character development, strategy tweaks and revamps that will turn it into an instant hit. We just need your support in order to be able to get the entire process done with as many resources as possible.



Our commitment to this project has been huge and we have invested a lot of time and money into bringing this concept to the level that allows for the development process to be the next logical step.

This game will have enhanced gameplay, replay value, fair level up systems and it will not make you feel like you have wasted your efforts if leveling them up. You will be given a chance to revive units that have reached a certain level and this will make it fair for anyone who invests plenty of time in upgrading.



You will also be able to control your units with the swipe of a finger, which is a very refreshing addition to this game. In pre-battle mode you can organize your troops into smaller groups to be able to control them easier throughout the battle.


Features of the Game:

Era: Roman Empire 

Story line: You have been sent by Caesar to establish a new Roman Settlement for the purpose of helping secure the newly conquered land. This is a wild and dangerous land. You need to make sure you prepare your Settlement to defend off attacks from unfriendly Settlements. You are given the authority to attack anyone you see fit for the glory of the Empire.

Buildings: Everything will be based off the Roman style. Market, Marble Quarries, Iron works, Castra (which can house 150 troops), Academy etc.

Builders: We want the user to start off with two builders. This allows the user to build more than one building at a time, from the start. By having two builders at the beginning it will also let us show the user the new feature.

Builders can be stacked!! Example: If I upgrade my Marble Quarry to level 5, it will take 24 hours to complete with just one builder. I can take a second builder and add him to the project thus diminishing the project by a quarter of the time (from 24 hours to 18 hours). I could then add a 3rd or 4th builder as well.

Resources: The two main resources for now will be Marble and Iron.

Troops: We have a special plan for troops. Troops sent into battle, whether you win, lose, or retreat, will not be lost if they haven’t died. Players will not have to save up and spend resources to upgrade troops. Troops will be upgraded by the experience they gain from battles. They will gain more experience from winning than from losing. Troops can also be upgraded from another vital aspect – the Academy. By placing troops in the Academy, the user is giving them up for “X” amount of time. If a troop is in the Academy they will gain experience 5X faster than a troop who fights in battle. The different units will also change in appearance as they level up.

The troops will of course be Roman style: Legionary – Infantry, Praetorians- Heavy Infantry, Archers, Auxiliary Archers (Archers on horses), Catapults, Rams, Trebuchets, Pikeman etc. Each one will be worth a certain number of troops. Defences/Traps: Archer towers, Trebuchets on walls, Boiling pots of Oil on walls, Massive wooden-spiked bear traps hidden underground, Ballista, Attack Dogs, Walls (Up-gradable from wood poles to Stone Walls) etc.

Player vs. Player: In other mobile strategy games, you can only attack a person when they are offline. In this game, not only will players be able to attack/revenge a person while they are online but the player being attacked can use up to ¼ of his army to defend himself. A player can also place ¼ of his army to defend him while he is offline too.

Card integration: When you attack a village and win you get a random card that can be either defensive or offensive. When attacking, a player can use an offensive card to give him a slight advantage.  A Defender can also use a card when attacked and store a card to be used while offline.

Morale Meter: In Rome, when the army returned from war, the city was excited and the troop and citizen’s morale was boosted. We want to integrate this into the game. We would like to have a “Morale Meter” located somewhere on the screen. When the Meter is at 0% the Iron and Marble mines are at normal mining rate. When it is at 100% the rate of mining is doubled. Also, when the meter is kept at between 95-100% for a certain period of time, Caesar will send a special gift to the player –Denarii. The way to make the Meter go up is by winning attacks. When you win, it goes up and when you lose to many times in a row, it comes down a little. Also, doing nothing causes the Meter to go down.

Gems: We are calling them Denarii based off of what the Romans called their coins. We do not want to make the mistake of other developers and build the game around the “gem concept”. This is where a lot of game apps have failed/frustrated their users. Instead, game-play will be the main focus. Rewarding users for playing the game, rather than forcing them to use "Gems" because they feel like they're not getting anywhere.

Conclusion

We are truly looking forward to bringing this game to the community and we are looking for support from everyone who is a fan of games that foster strategic planning and help exercise the mind.

The only way this is possible is by your support!  As soon as we get the funding our development team in Texas will immediately start the development stage.

story:
Hi,

my name is Igor Galic. I come from Zagreb, Croatia, and by proffesion I'm a music teacher. :)

Main goal of this project is to achieve my goal, to make this board game alive and so can all enjoy it one day.

Mostly, I need money just to pay all the designers/crafters to make all the parts for the game. Then I could maybe intrigue some people who would like to distribute it.

As you can see in pictures, that's all I could make atm, but it is playable game and it is super fun!

About the game: 

I made a strategic/economy/train based game that I call atm "Trains". The game is for 2-4 players and the main goal is to finish your main objective.

Game it self lasts about 1:30 - 2:30 mins. There is shorter version,  for about an hour, if you set the goal to complete the mini objective or maybe treasure hunt objective.

My brothers/friends and me already played it over dozen times and its really great! There is needed some fine detailing in balance goods/costs.

Each player starts from his corner ( each corner produces different basic goods, such as lumber/wool/milk/cow or so), get random mini objective and some $.
Before you take at random hero (mechanic, economist, smugler....) you gotta buy your first train, either to go with fast/but less wagons or slow/more wagons train.

The journey starts and from there it's unpredictable! 

There are weather effects vs roll, engine breaks vs roll, lottery tickets and traps.

It's ment for pve playing style, but also you can buy in auction house, mine or oil deposits (which costs ofc, and its bid based, so you can end giving alot of money if other players all the time outbids) and then you get half the income for every delivery in that mine/oil deposits! Pvp part would also be traps.

Some other heroes/stuff will be implemented if the goal is achieved and then the journey can start! :)

About the game: 
I made a strategic/economy/train based game that I call atm "Trains". The game is for 2-4 players and the main goal is to finish your main objective.
Game it self lasts about 1:30 - 2:30 mins. There is shorter version,  for about an hour, if you set the goal to complete the mini objective or maybe treasure hunt objective.
My brothers/friends and me already played it over dozen times and its really great! There is needed some fine detailing in balance goods/costs.
Each player starts from his corner ( each corner produces different basic goods, such as lumber/wool/milk/cow or so), get random mini objective and some $.Before you take at random hero (mechanic, economist, smugler....) you gotta buy your first train, either to go with fast/but less wagons or slow/more wagons train.
The journey starts and from there it's unpredictable! 
There are weather effects vs roll, engine breaks vs roll, lottery tickets and traps.

Pvp part would also be traps.
Some other heroes/stuff will be implemented if the goal is achieved and then the journey can start! :)

story:
VUE VR Treadmill is a new omni-directional treadmill input device that captures real world movement and maps it into virtual reality.

VUE VR Treadmill is a new omni-directional treadmill for virtual reality. It has been designed to be as unrestrictive as possible giving the user 360 degrees of continuous movement within a small space. It is compatible with Oculus Rift , HTC Vive and other VR headsets.

With its built-in and wearable sensors, you can walk ,run ,jump ,crouch and sit in the virtual world.

 

VUE VR Treadmill is especially suited for FPS and other applications in where you need to move around. You can control the in-game character with your own body, helping to increase presence and decreases simulator sickness.

The innovative independent support structure and open construction sets your arms and legs free.

It separates the space of body movement with the support structure. Without a ring or column surrounding you, it allows you to do the movements freely.

You can move freely and securely without constraint or worrying about hitting anything. You can swing your arms naturally or rest your hands by your sides, getting closer to a natural walking posture.

VUE VR Treadmill has not just simply removed the column and ring. To achieve a good and safe experience, our unique design can limit your horizontal movement range and stop the vertical movement function while walking and running providing stable support.

The harness is adjustable to accommodate different body shapes.

Meanwhile it can help users move back to center to adjust the position offset while walking, which can increase the sense of balance and safety.

When we walk in the real life, friction helps us forward. Without friction we cannot walk normally. Frictionless walking is awkward (like walking on ice) and you must pay attention to stay balanced.

To make walking in VR feel more natural, VUE VR Treadmill uses special high-friction material and the constant force of rolling friction by using special shoes to simulate real walking forces and human motion. This makes you feel like you are walking on real ground instead of sliding walk. With normal friction, it is easier to keep balance and it will decrease the time it takes anyone to learn to use VUE VR Treadmill.

VUE VR Treadmill uses a cambered base to transfer gravitational potential energy to kinetic energy to achieve the natural feeling of walking.

Our software can transfer body motion to a keyboard or gamepad. This means all the games with keyboard or gamepad support will be playable.

APPLICATIONS

VUE VR Treadmill can be widely used in many areas ,not only in games .It could be used in any application that requires you to move around in Virtual Reality.

VUE VR TREADMILL DEVELOPMENT

We are an ambitious team which specialises in hardware and software for VUE VR TREADMILL .Our mission is to design and build the most advanced and innovative VR equipments for game players. We are continuously creating new products to bring the Virtual Reality world to the everyday consumer.

The First Prototype

The Second Prototype

 

Final Prototype

 

 

FAQ

Is VR headset included ?

A: No, Oculus Rift ,HTC Vive or other VR headset is not included.

When will we ship to our backers ?

A:Our shipping date will be on March 2017.

Do I have to pay any taxes ?

A:Most countries charge taxes like Tariff, import tax or some customs charges. You have to pay your regional tax before the devices will be delivered.

How much will international shipping cost ?

A: International shipping is complicated, and can be costly depending on where you live. We will pay for ocean freight to your continent. You need to verify and add your country’s import duties and VAT, if applicable.

Because International shipping costs is complicated and it changes everyday .

So International shipping costs will be confirmed and billed to you when we are ready for shipping the product out to you .We will contact you . No need to add shipping fees to your pledge amount. Below are current estimates of shipping costs for various countries (excludes import duties and VAT).

North America:

Canada: $100-$150

Mexico: $250-$350

Europe:

England, Germany: $100-$150

Western Europe: $150-$200 (Belgium, Netherlands, Ireland, Scotland, France, e.a.)

Southern Europe: $175-$225 (Spain, Portugal, Italy, Greece)

Scandinavia: $200-$250 (Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark)

Austria: $200-$250

Switzerland: $250-$300

Eastern Europe: $250-$300 (Poland, Slovenia, Czech Republic, Slovakia)

Baltic States: $250-$300 (Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia)

Balkan / ex-Soviet: $300-$350 (Croatia, Bosnia, Ukraine, e.a.)

Turkey: $300-$350

Asia:

South East Asia: $75-$125 (Singapore, Malaysia)

Japan: $150-$250

S. Korea: $200-$300

Other:

Australia: $100-$200

New Zealand: $150-$250

South Africa: $500-$600

Egypt: $600-$700

Middle East: $450-$600

In case your country is not listed above, please contact us, so that we can work together to determine the optimal shipping strategy and cost.

What will be the price of VUE VR Treadmill after our Indiegogo campaign ?

A:The price of VUE VR Treadmill after our Indiegogo campaign will be $699. Our Indiegogo backers receive a discount.

What games can VUE VR Treadmill be played with ?

A:Since our software generates keystrokes, VUE VR Treadmill is ready to play with any game that uses keyboard input.

What is the height and weight of VUE VR Treadmill ?

A: The height of VUE VR Treadmill is 220cm and the weight is 160kg.

How about disassembly, folding and storage ?

A: VUE VR Treadmill is designed for simple disassembly. You can follow the instruction to assemble and disassemble with ease.

Will VUE VR Treadmill be compatible with consoles or only with PC ?

A: At the moment, VUE VR Treadmill is only compatible with PC.

What kind of motion capture is used to control the movement of the game ?

A: We use sensors to capture the action. Our software can transfer the body motion signal to keyboard or gamepad.

Does VUE VR Treadmill support the input of hand movements in real time ?

A: VUE VR Treadmill doesn`t include motion capture for hands, but will be compatible with most third party devices, like oculus touch.

Will we need specific shoes ? Which sizes are supported ?

A: Yes, currently you should wear specific shoes to get a good experience. We will ask you for your shoe size after our Indiegogo campaign ends.We offer shoe sizes from size 4 to size 15.

Will we get tired walking and running on VUE VR Treadmill ?

A: Yes, it is the same as real world walking and running.

What are the height and weight limitations ?

A: player height ranging is from 130cm - 200cm. The harness is adjustable to accommodate different body shapes, and allows players to sit and supports weight up to 140kg.

Will the column and harness restrict the actions of the player ?

A: There is no limitations for any actions, with the exception of the prone position.

How loud is VUE VR Treadmill ?

A: The noise level of VUE VR Treadmill is comparable to that of a regular treadmill. We will work to improve noise reduction before shipping.
