story:
Hello everyone! We are Ruben Been and Marcel Opperman, two very dedicated esports fanatics with a dream. Since the moment we both learned about esports, we've had the dream to work in this amazing branche full-time. Now we're trying to make this dream come true and create a place, or better yet, a paradise for all esports enthusiasts, a place called EsportsDome!


In this section we will:

  • Briefly describe our campaign
  • Explain why we need you to help us achieve our dream
  • Introduce ourselves further
  • Tell you about our finances
  • Show you our stretch goals and perks
  • Sum up the risks and challenges


Esports is getting bigger and bigger. In countries like Sweden, Germany, the USA and of course South Korea, esports has a firm position in the life of its peoples. Unfortunately, this is not the case in the Benelux, but we would like to change that! How? By creating a place where esports enthusiasts and athletes of all skill levels, casual, professional or somewhere in between, can come together and celebrate the passion that is esports. A place to use top notch gaming PC's and consoles, participate in tournaments, watch streams and events live on our big TV-screens and attend gaming events and parties organized by us. But above all, a place where you can meet friends or make new ones. You already have one thing in common: everyone at EsportsDome loves esports!

So why do we need you then? Well, unfortunately our dream costs quite a bit of money.. We can only do so much ourselves. We have excellent connections and possibilities with multiple sponsors. However, sponsors want to know the reach of a project before they decide to invest. This is where you come in! With your help we can show them and everyone else that needs to see it that esports has a place in the Benelux far bigger than it is now, and that EsportsDome can be a huge part of the esports community.


The proposed location of EsportsDome is in the heart of Breda (the Netherlands), at just 10 minutes walking distance from the central trainstation. Below we will show you what we have in mind when it comes to the EsportsDome venue. None of this is permanent and the arrangement might be subject to change, The green part in the middle is a patio (f.e. to take a smoke).

Entrance / shop:
The entrance will function as both storefront and shop. Here, diverse EsportsDome merchandise will be for sale, as well as products from our sponsors.

Console area:
With at least 16 consoles, the console gamers amongst us will have plenty to do in EsportsDome. Play games such as FIFA, one of the popular fighting games or join one of our tournaments and other activities.

Stream lounge:
Of course you can watch DreamHack, ESL and LCS from the comfort of your home, but isn’t it better to watch with other enthusiasts on big screens? In the Stream Lounge in EsportsDome all major national and international tournaments will be broadcast. Have a drink with you friends, and cheer for your teams and players!

PC area:
There will be between 40 and 50 high-end gaming PCs in EsportsDome. Visitors can rent these PC's, but of course we will also use them for tournaments, workshops, LAN-parties and many other awesome activities. The PCs will have most popular games pre-installed and are ready to go!
Also the bar is located in the PC area to make sure you won't get dehydrated or starved.

To be decided area:
Last but not least, there is one area with no determined function. We’ve placed couches and consoles on the sketch, but what would you like to see here? After the crowdfunding campaign, we will join the community in a brainstorm session what the best use of the space will be. The community will decide on the best idea, and we will make sure this is implemented!


It's our pleasure to introduce ourselves to you and tell you about who we are and what we have done in esports and management.

Ruben: Hey guys, my name is Ruben Been and I am one of the two founders of EsportsDome. I have graduated as Leisure Manager 2 years ago, but I can say that I have quite some experience when it comes to esports. I have been involved in esports for over 11 years now and have had the honor to be part of a lot of esports adventures.

I am the CEO of mCon esports, one of the biggest esportsclubs of the Benelux. Besides that I have an event desk which is specialized in esports events. Last year I was hired by Easyfairs to help organize Dutch Comic Con, and in 2011 and 2012 I have organized the Dutch Gaming Championships and Dutch Gaming Festival for the Dutch Esports Association. Besides that, I have also attended the World Championships in South Korea, Romania and Azerbaijan, the World Cyber Games in South Korea and multiple DreamHacks in Sweden.

Favorite esports: Counter-strike: GO, Hearthstone, League of Legends.

Marcel: Nice to meet you! My name is Marcel Opperman, a 27-year old guy with roots in Wageningen, Leiden and Breda. After finishing my sportsmanagement studies in 2013, I quickly joined the esports branche in which I've been working for about 2 years now. I've participated in many offline tournaments (The Reality, The Party, Firstlook Festival, etc.) with my Heroes of the Storm team. Additionally, I have also adminned in about 100 on- and offline events for different games; the Hearthstone tournament series called Breda Masters is one of the events I organized. I always enjoy being around esports community members because of the friendly and passionate attitude that most esports enthousiasts have, and it would be an honor for me to have the chance to provide something truly amazing for the esports community.

Favorite esports: DOTA 2, Hearthstone, Overwatch.

We hope to have informed you enough about ourselves, if not don't hesitate to e-mail us on info@esportsdome.nl or leave a comment on this page. 


First things first: We are not paying ourselves wages until EsportsDome opens in summer 2017. We pay our own costs with savings we have gathered over the last years, while planning ahead for this campaign. Now, it is time to fulfill our dream.

Oh we do, mr. Troll!

Our costs comprise of three parts:

Monthly expenses: Just like every other business, EsportsDome will have monthly expenses. These include things like rent, electricity, water and of course a superb internet connection. These expenses will be covered by sponsors, subsidies and generated income.

Events expenses: For all the awesome events we are going to host at EsportsDome we need funds too. Think about costs like tournament prizes, hiring pro esports athletes to give masterclasses, or extra staff if we expect a lot of people to turn up at a big event. These expenses will be covered by sponsors and generated income.

One-time investment: When you start something as big as EsportsDome, it will require a large one-time investment to set everything up so you can actually start doing the things you want to do. Examples of these are the PC's and consoles, comfy chairs for everyone to sit on, and even bar supplies like a coffee machine or plates and cutlery. Most of these items can be sponsored, but not all. The items that can't be covered by sponsor deals, estimated to be around €25.000,-, we want to cover by the funds gathered by this crowdfunding campaign.

Now, if this campaign turns out to be very successful and we exceed the goal amount by a large number, we will flow that money right back to you through our stretch goals. How? By lowering our entry fees, which is explained below.

Entry fee tiers:

If we reach €25.000,- we will be able to open our doors for at least TWO years, with our normal entry fees:
- One day entry without renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €3,-
- Daily pass for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €15,-
- First hour for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €5,-
- Every hour after the first hour, €3,- (maximum of €15,-)

If we reach €50.000,- we will be able to open our doors for at least TWO years, with lower entry fees:
- One day entry without renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €2,-
- Daily pass for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €12,50,-
- First hour for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €4,-
- Every hour after the first hour, €2,- (maximum of €12,50)

If we reach €75.000,- we will be able to open our doors for at least TWO years, with our lowest entry fees:
- One day entry without renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €2,-
- Daily pass for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €10,-
- First hour for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €3,-
- Every hour after the first hour, €2,- (maximum of €10,-)

If we reach €100.000,- we will be able to open our doors for at least FIVE years, with our lowest entry fees:
- One day entry without renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €2,-
- Daily pass for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €10,-
- First hour for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €3,-
- Every hour after the first hour, €2,- (maximum of €10,-)


If you are thinking about backing us, you should definitely take a look at all our perks. We think they're amazing! Also, everybody who contributes at least €25.- will be featured on our wall of champions on our website!

Merchandising:
First of all, we have some really good looking merchandise to give away. You can make a selection out of the following:

  • EsportsDome desktop wallpaper €5,-
  • EsportsDome keychain €10,-
  • EsportsDome mug €15,-
  • EsportsDome hoodie €50,-
  • EsportsDome jersey (with your own name if you like!) €60,
Pictures of the merchandise will be added shortly.
Exclusive VIP grand opening:
Secondly, when EsportsDome opens it's doors we will launch an exclusive VIP grand opening, and you can be there! Want to be the first to test our top notch gaming PC's or consoles and enjoy an evening full of fun and games? Then this is your perk. You will receive a ticket by funding €100,-.

Backers LAN party:
Once EsportsDome opens, we will organize a backers LAN party. Here, you can play all the games you want without having to think about food, drinks or a bed, because we will provide all that for you. The only things you have to bring are your teddybear and a toothbrush. You will receive an exclusive Backers LAN party ticket by funding €150,-.

Personal coaching sessions by a pro:
We also have a great perk for all of you who want to be the very best in the game you play. We can offer you 4 hours of personal training with a pro player for a game of your choice! Special attention, just for you, to improve your play. When you select this perk, we will contact you to plan your coaching session. As a bonus, you will also receive an EsportsDome wallpaper and keychain. This perk is unlocked by funding €200,-.

Membership:
If you are as hyped as we are about EsportsDome, you could consider becoming an EsportsDome member. With a membership card you will get unlimited access to all PC's and consoles, for free. If you plan to visit EsportsDome regularly, this will definitely be beneficial for you. Naturally, for our funders we have great discounts in store.
  • A 3 months membership costs €150,-. This is a €30,- discount on the normal price.
  • A 6 months membership costs €240,-. This is a €60,- discount on the normal price.
  • A 12 months membership costs €360,-. This is a €120,- discount on the normal price.
Memberships will start at the first day EsportsDome opens and will include the remainder of that month for free (f.e. if we open on the 14th, day 15, 16 etc. until the end of that month will be free).

Custom made EsportsDome gaming chair:
Wanna sit comfortably in a brand new EsportsDome gaming chair? Our design is custom made by a professional gaming chairs designer in the colors of our logo. Only 50 of these will be made, so your chair will be really exclusive. You can buy a chair by funding €375,-.

Rent EsportsDome for a day:
We are also offering clans, groups or companies a chance to rent EsportsDome for a day. You will have exclusive access to all the PC's, TV's and consoles from 10:00 in the morning to 22:00, only your friends and/or colleagues will be in the venue. We will also provide dinner and 2 drinks for everyone. Renting EsportsDome requires a €1500,- funding, with space for up to 40 people.

Mr. EsportsDome:
Have you always liked being in the spotlights? Do you like attention and exclusivity? And most of all, do you really love esports? Then you can be our Mr. EsportsDome!


What it means to be Mr. Esportsdome:
  • Unlimited access to EsportsDome for the rest of your life.
  • Free invitations for all VIP events hosted by EsportsDome.
  • One item of all current and future EsportsDome merchanise.
  • A picture of you, as Mr. EsportsDome, hanging on the wall in EsportsDome.
You can be Mr. EsportsDome for €10.000,-!

We are very excited about this project, and hopefully you are too. If you are, then please help us with backing, sharing this campaign and our Facebook, or even better: both! You can share the campaign by clicking the buttons on the top right of this page. If you have any questions about the campaign and/or EsportsDome, do not hesitate to contact us. You can do this by clicking the button 'ask a question', or e-mail us on info@esportsdome.nl. We will answer you as soon as we possibly can.  

Of course, being almost a year away from our proposed starting date, things can go wrong. We do not intend to, but they can. We have done our share of market research, have spoken to a lot of sponsors and investors, have made countless updates on our estimates and we're certain that we are close to what the actual numbers are going to be. But, as you all know, life doesn't always go the way you want it to go. If we do not make the campaign goal, we cannot start EsportsDome. In that case, you won't have paid anything to us since we use a fixed goal, but unfortunately that also means we cannot provide the perks you have backed us for. If we do make the campaign goal but for some reason still cannot open our doors, as long as you didn't receive your perk yet, you are entitled to ask for a refund, which we will grant.

Explain why we need you to help us achieve our dream

Introduce ourselves further
Tell you about our finances
Show you our stretch goals and perks
Sum up the risks and challenges




Esports is getting bigger and bigger. In countries like Sweden, Germany, the USA and of course South Korea, esports has a firm position in the life of its peoples. Unfortunately, this is not the case in the Benelux, but we would like to change that! How? By creating a place where esports enthusiasts and athletes of all skill levels, casual, professional or somewhere in between, can come together and celebrate the passion that is esports. A place to use top notch gaming PC's and consoles, participate in tournaments, watch streams and events live on our big TV-screens and attend gaming events and parties organized by us. But above all, a place where you can meet friends or make new ones. You already have one thing in common: everyone at EsportsDome loves esports!
So why do we need you then? Well, unfortunately our dream costs quite a bit of money.. We can only do so much ourselves. We have excellent connections and possibilities with multiple sponsors. However, sponsors want to know the reach of a project before they decide to invest. This is where you come in! With your help we can show them and everyone else that needs to see it that esports has a place in the Benelux far bigger than it is now, and that EsportsDome can be a huge part of the esports community.



The proposed location of EsportsDome is in the heart of Breda (the Netherlands), at just 10 minutes walking distance from the central trainstation. Below we will show you what we have in mind when it comes to the EsportsDome venue. None of this is permanent and the arrangement might be subject to change, The green part in the middle is a patio (f.e. to take a smoke).
Entrance / shop:The entrance will function as both storefront and shop. Here, diverse EsportsDome merchandise will be for sale, as well as products from our sponsors.
Console area:With at least 16 consoles, the console gamers amongst us will have plenty to do in EsportsDome. Play games such as FIFA, one of the popular fighting games or join one of our tournaments and other activities.
Stream lounge:Of course you can watch DreamHack, ESL and LCS from the comfort of your home, but isn’t it better to watch with other enthusiasts on big screens? In the Stream Lounge in EsportsDome all major national and international tournaments will be broadcast. Have a drink with you friends, and cheer for your teams and players!

PC area:There will be between 40 and 50 high-end gaming PCs in EsportsDome. Visitors can rent these PC's, but of course we will also use them for tournaments, workshops, LAN-parties and many other awesome activities. The PCs will have most popular games pre-installed and are ready to go!Also the bar is located in the PC area to make sure you won't get dehydrated or starved.
To be decided area:Last but not least, there is one area with no determined function. We’ve placed couches and consoles on the sketch, but what would you like to see here? After the crowdfunding campaign, we will join the community in a brainstorm session what the best use of the space will be. The community will decide on the best idea, and we will make sure this is implemented!


It's our pleasure to introduce ourselves to you and tell you about who we are and what we have done in esports and management.
Ruben: Hey guys, my name is Ruben Been and I am one of the two founders of EsportsDome. I have graduated as Leisure Manager 2 years ago, but I can say that I have quite some experience when it comes to esports. I have been involved in esports for over 11 years now and have had the honor to be part of a lot of esports adventures.
I am the CEO of mCon esports, one of the biggest esportsclubs of the Benelux. Besides that I have an event desk which is specialized in esports events. Last year I was hired by Easyfairs to help organize Dutch Comic Con, and in 2011 and 2012 I have organized the Dutch Gaming Championships and Dutch Gaming Festival for the Dutch Esports Association. Besides that, I have also attended the World Championships in South Korea, Romania and Azerbaijan, the World Cyber Games in South Korea and multiple DreamHacks in Sweden.
Favorite esports: Counter-strike: GO, Hearthstone, League of Legends.



Marcel: Nice to meet you! My name is Marcel Opperman, a 27-year old guy with roots in Wageningen, Leiden and Breda. After finishing my sportsmanagement studies in 2013, I quickly joined the esports branche in which I've been working for about 2 years now. I've participated in many offline tournaments (The Reality, The Party, Firstlook Festival, etc.) with my Heroes of the Storm team. Additionally, I have also adminned in about 100 on- and offline events for different games; the Hearthstone tournament series called Breda Masters is one of the events I organized. I always enjoy being around esports community members because of the friendly and passionate attitude that most esports enthousiasts have, and it would be an honor for me to have the chance to provide something truly amazing for the esports community.
Favorite esports: DOTA 2, Hearthstone, Overwatch.
We hope to have informed you enough about ourselves, if not don't hesitate to e-mail us on info@esportsdome.nl or leave a comment on this page. 



First things first: We are not paying ourselves wages until EsportsDome opens in summer 2017. We pay our own costs with savings we have gathered over the last years, while planning ahead for this campaign. Now, it is time to fulfill our dream.


Oh we do, mr. Troll!
Our costs comprise of three parts:
Monthly expenses: Just like every other business, EsportsDome will have monthly expenses. These include things like rent, electricity, water and of course a superb internet connection. These expenses will be covered by sponsors, subsidies and generated income.
Events expenses: For all the awesome events we are going to host at EsportsDome we need funds too. Think about costs like tournament prizes, hiring pro esports athletes to give masterclasses, or extra staff if we expect a lot of people to turn up at a big event. These expenses will be covered by sponsors and generated income.
One-time investment: When you start something as big as EsportsDome, it will require a large one-time investment to set everything up so you can actually start doing the things you want to do. Examples of these are the PC's and consoles, comfy chairs for everyone to sit on, and even bar supplies like a coffee machine or plates and cutlery. Most of these items can be sponsored, but not all. The items that can't be covered by sponsor deals, estimated to be around €25.000,-, we want to cover by the funds gathered by this crowdfunding campaign.


Now, if this campaign turns out to be very successful and we exceed the goal amount by a large number, we will flow that money right back to you through our stretch goals. How? By lowering our entry fees, which is explained below.
Entry fee tiers:
If we reach €25.000,- we will be able to open our doors for at least TWO years, with our normal entry fees:- One day entry without renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €3,-- Daily pass for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €15,-- First hour for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €5,-- Every hour after the first hour, €3,- (maximum of €15,-)
If we reach €50.000,- we will be able to open our doors for at least TWO years, with lower entry fees:- One day entry without renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €2,-- Daily pass for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €12,50,-- First hour for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €4,-- Every hour after the first hour, €2,- (maximum of €12,50)
If we reach €75.000,- we will be able to open our doors for at least TWO years, with our lowest entry fees:- One day entry without renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €2,-- Daily pass for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €10,-- First hour for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €3,-- Every hour after the first hour, €2,- (maximum of €10,-)
If we reach €100.000,- we will be able to open our doors for at least FIVE years, with our lowest entry fees:- One day entry without renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €2,-- Daily pass for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €10,-- First hour for renting a PC/console + 1 free drink, €3,-- Every hour after the first hour, €2,- (maximum of €10,-)



If you are thinking about backing us, you should definitely take a look at all our perks. We think they're amazing! Also, everybody who contributes at least €25.- will be featured on our wall of champions on our website!
Merchandising:First of all, we have some really good looking merchandise to give away. You can make a selection out of the following:



EsportsDome desktop wallpaper €5,-

EsportsDome keychain €10,-
EsportsDome mug €15,-
EsportsDome hoodie €50,-
EsportsDome jersey (with your own name if you like!) €60,

Pictures of the merchandise will be added shortly.

Exclusive VIP grand opening:Secondly, when EsportsDome opens it's doors we will launch an exclusive VIP grand opening, and you can be there! Want to be the first to test our top notch gaming PC's or consoles and enjoy an evening full of fun and games? Then this is your perk. You will receive a ticket by funding €100,-.


Backers LAN party:Once EsportsDome opens, we will organize a backers LAN party. Here, you can play all the games you want without having to think about food, drinks or a bed, because we will provide all that for you. The only things you have to bring are your teddybear and a toothbrush. You will receive an exclusive Backers LAN party ticket by funding €150,-.


Personal coaching sessions by a pro:We also have a great perk for all of you who want to be the very best in the game you play. We can offer you 4 hours of personal training with a pro player for a game of your choice! Special attention, just for you, to improve your play. When you select this perk, we will contact you to plan your coaching session. As a bonus, you will also receive an EsportsDome wallpaper and keychain. This perk is unlocked by funding €200,-.


Membership:If you are as hyped as we are about EsportsDome, you could consider becoming an EsportsDome member. With a membership card you will get unlimited access to all PC's and consoles, for free. If you plan to visit EsportsDome regularly, this will definitely be beneficial for you. Naturally, for our funders we have great discounts in store.



A 3 months membership costs €150,-. This is a €30,- discount on the normal price.


A 6 months membership costs €240,-. This is a €60,- discount on the normal price.


A 12 months membership costs €360,-. This is a €120,- discount on the normal price.



Memberships will start at the first day EsportsDome opens and will include the remainder of that month for free (f.e. if we open on the 14th, day 15, 16 etc. until the end of that month will be free).

Custom made EsportsDome gaming chair:Wanna sit comfortably in a brand new EsportsDome gaming chair? Our design is custom made by a professional gaming chairs designer in the colors of our logo. Only 50 of these will be made, so your chair will be really exclusive. You can buy a chair by funding €375,-.


Rent EsportsDome for a day:We are also offering clans, groups or companies a chance to rent EsportsDome for a day. You will have exclusive access to all the PC's, TV's and consoles from 10:00 in the morning to 22:00, only your friends and/or colleagues will be in the venue. We will also provide dinner and 2 drinks for everyone. Renting EsportsDome requires a €1500,- funding, with space for up to 40 people.



Mr. EsportsDome:Have you always liked being in the spotlights? Do you like attention and exclusivity? And most of all, do you really love esports? Then you can be our Mr. EsportsDome!





What it means to be Mr. Esportsdome:

Unlimited access to EsportsDome for the rest of your life.
Free invitations for all VIP events hosted by EsportsDome.
One item of all current and future EsportsDome merchanise.
A picture of you, as Mr. EsportsDome, hanging on the wall in EsportsDome.

You can be Mr. EsportsDome for €10.000,-!






We are very excited about this project, and hopefully you are too. If you are, then please help us with backing, sharing this campaign and our Facebook, or even better: both! You can share the campaign by clicking the buttons on the top right of this page. If you have any questions about the campaign and/or EsportsDome, do not hesitate to contact us. You can do this by clicking the button 'ask a question', or e-mail us on info@esportsdome.nl. We will answer you as soon as we possibly can.  




Of course, being almost a year away from our proposed starting date, things can go wrong. We do not intend to, but they can. We have done our share of market research, have spoken to a lot of sponsors and investors, have made countless updates on our estimates and we're certain that we are close to what the actual numbers are going to be. But, as you all know, life doesn't always go the way you want it to go. If we do not make the campaign goal, we cannot start EsportsDome. In that case, you won't have paid anything to us since we use a fixed goal, but unfortunately that also means we cannot provide the perks you have backed us for. If we do make the campaign goal but for some reason still cannot open our doors, as long as you didn't receive your perk yet, you are entitled to ask for a refund, which we will grant.

story:
Hello! We are Serhii Pukhov and Dima Karpenko - software developers with a passion to creating mobile games.

We published several games and apps to Google Play and App Store. And now we want to make something big, important and beautiful.

About Software Riot

Software Riot is a 2D-platformer game with a heartbreaking story line.

The main hero is a Software Developer named Jim who was tired at work and decided to have a nap in the storeroom. When he woke up he couldn’t believe his eyes: all his friends and colleagues disappeared from the office. Almost all electronic devices were hacked and controlled by a computer virus. The only clue was a message received from his teammate Jane, which says that machines were attacking people, so they needed to escape the offices and barricade in the basement warehouses.

So the only option left for Jim is to leverage all his programming talents to crack the infected devices, defeat the virus and save his colleagues. But it won’t be easy.

In the end we are going to create a dynamic and interesting platformer game with a great plot and a love story.

At this moment we have a working demo-version of Software Riot game. You can see its gameplay on our video above.

The game will be absolutely free. At this moment we plan to support Android and iOS versions.

 

Our Team

Our team consists of 3 people - 2 developers and 1 designer.

We work together for more than a year and created such games as Math Heroes and Sausage Run.

 

What we need

The main goal of this campaign for us is to find some support. We want to build the community that can help us making this game BIG and valuable.

Anyway, we also have a simple list of expenses, that prevent us from painless and quick game release:

  • development costs
  • design costs
  • assets costs

 

Our challanges

The most important thing for us is creating the exciting gaming experience. This is why we are focused on every little detail on each scene. And this is why getting your feedback is vital.

We plan to release the game on March 1, 2018.

 

Other ways to help Software Riot

If you can’t contribute, we still appreciate your attention to our project. And we want to let you know that you still can help Software Riot to be born. You can share this page into social media, or you can follow us on Facebook and Twitter. And if you have something to say don’t hesitate - your feedback is golden for us!

story:
Short Summary

I'm new to Vr development and dont currently have the money to buy the assets I need from the unreal engine marketplace to make my game come to life, this is where you come in, by backing this project you will allow me to buy the assets I need for development as things can get rather pricey quite fast.

Being an Avid VR enthusiast I have long wanted to design my own VR title to bring a bit of replayable and satisfying fun to the VR scene.

 

What We Need & What You Get

For this campaign to succeed I need enough money to buy the assets from the unreal engine marketplace, I already have the hardware I need, but will also need money for development

perks: I'll offer the game, a name in the credits and some cosmetic items as well as characters or swords named after you. 

Any money made from this campaign will be used to develop the game, the more money the game makes, the more I can put into it.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest hurdle is the expenses a lone developer has, the bottom line is money, the more money I have, the more I can put into the game and am willing to hire other devs to help in making my dream a reality if we raise enough.

Other Ways You Can Help

I'm new to VR development in Unreal engine 4, so If you want to purchase assets for me to use or help me out when I get stuck, even to create some animations and materials you will be given credit of course.

story:
Play as a hacker and understand the strategies and methods of hackers & cyber attackers.
While working on attack scenarios for cyber simulations and helping organizations and individuals understand the cyber attacker's mindset, we thought it would be great fun to design a hacking game that everyone can play. 
So we did.
 



Create, deploy, control, improve, collect, repeat.

You first create a trojan by distributing a fixed amount of points between different characteristics such as; infection rate, payload, etc ... Then you select your target - country and sector; government, defense, business and so on. After you infect your first target, the trojan will continue and infect more targets. Whenever your trojan pawns a target, you will receive money, technology or data, to achieve your goals. You will be able to run multiple campaigns at the same time, but remember, just in real life the more trojans running - the better chance of your campaign to be discovered and your trojans neutralized. Startegy matters!

 

   Single Player
   Turn Based Strategy
   Achievements
   Factions
   Campaign mode
   Research trees
   Dark Net marketplace

We are game developers that turned into hackers, now we thought about making hacking a game….
We have been designing and building games and companies for the last 20 years. Our last company was an online game studio (FTX - https://ftxgames.com - acquired by PlayTech) creating social games for Hollywood movies. We decided to go back to designing a smaller game about something that’s interesting to us (and hopefully to you).


We already have a working gameplay prototype in Unity3D.
We just need the money to finish programming the client and extra music and art we can’t create ourselves, along with some distribution platform fees (Apple, Steam…).

Distribution of what we raise: 

60% - Unity3D programming and some backend (leaderboards...)

20% - more content - Sound effects, Music, Art

20% - QA, software licenses, platform fees and some ongoing expenses (web…)

• The basic perk, APT1, is the final release version of the game for the computer platform of your choice (Windows, Mac, Linux).
• The advanced version, SQL injection, is access to the beta version (full features, with some bugs) before everybody else (limited to 512 people). 
• If you're feeling adventurous and impatient, join our Alpha access program, Fancy Bear,  (limited to 256 people) and share our pain at the bugs and gameplay balancing. Includes registering your unique handle/nick for our future leader boards.
• Get your name in the credits ! and vote on the features for the game (and Alpha access and handle/nick reservation) Only 32 spots.
• The last 2 perk levels are intended for companies, to buy multiple copies of the game and to get a personalized introduction into the dark side. PM us for more info.


 

Show, don't tell !
We spend a lot of out time explaining to other people what are trojans, campaigns, vulnerabilities, crimekits, exploits and other terms and things. Now, they can play the game and maybe get some idea of what their up against.

We are building the game in Unity3D, which simplifies the cross-platform development, and we already have a working gameplay prototype. Also we create most of the content and art ourselves (maybe some of the music also).





 



 

• Prototype to Alpha in 3 months - short but doable. We will keep the alpha features sparse (no campaigns, no leaderboards, less content...) to help us focus on finishing the gameplay.

• Gameplay balance - there are no shortcuts to making the game challenging and fun to play at the same time. We need to play and play (Alpha testers will help with that) until we strike the balance. It could take us longer then anticipated to finalize this stage with your help.

• Campaign mode - we have 2-3 short campaigns planned out - they take much longer to make (hardcoded) so they will make it in only in the beta.

• Mobile clients - we would love to make a tablet version (Android/iOS), but it takes more development time and a lot of QA, so we included it as a stretch goal. The game UX was designed with tablets in mind, so it shouldn't require too much effort.

• Features vs Completion - we have lots of features in mind and will probably get more ideas from our beta testers, BUT, more features lead to delays. It will be up to us to limit our ideas and deliver the game on time.



 





 



Are you real hackers?
eh, maybe ...

 

Is it really hacking?
No. It's just a basic simulation of what happens in the real world,but not accurate.

Should I hack?
NO ! . Before you even think about it read about Ethical Hacking !

Can you learn how to hack by playing the game?
No, sorry. The game will introduce terms and methods, but you will have to learn how to do stuff elsewhere.

story:
Native user interfaces like Win32 and Cocoa are limited and dated. Web-based technologies like Electron look nice, but the final product runs slow and feels sluggish. These problems caused me to rethink user interface design and come up with a new paradigm to deliver the best possible experience for desktop applications on the PC.

The Story

A few years ago I launched a crowdfunding campaign to bring Leadwerks Game Engine to the Linux operating system. The software went on to become a big success, with over $1 million in sales and more than 30,000 customers, including NASA, Northrop Grumman, and Lockheed Martin. I learned a lot from that experience and as I begin a new software application, I wanted to revisit the user interface and see if there was any way I could improve it.

A New Approach

Ultra App Kit provides a fast and customizable user interface for building game development tools and other desktop programs.

Supported Widgets

  • Label
  • Button (Push, checkbox, radio, and toggle styles)
  • ProgressBar
  • TextField
  • TextArea
  • ComboBox
  • ListBox
  • Slider (scrollbar, trackbar, and stepper styles)
  • Draggable multi-select TreeView
  • Create your own!

 

API Design

  • C++ shared pointers everywhere
  • Extensible widgets system
  • Extensive documentation with examples for each command
  • Can be made to interface with C# and Lua

 

UI Features

  • Resolution independent for any DPI (16K+)
  • Load SVG vector images
  • Filter and sort widget items by name
  • Set widget and item image
  • Change mouse cursor
  • Custom color schemes stored in JSON files

 

Other Features

  • File I/O
  • File system watcher
  • Memory allocation and management
  • Image loading, saving, processing
  • Package system for loading files from compressed / encrypted archives
  • Plugin system
  • Thread management
  • String manipulation (split, match, conversion, etc.)
  • Message boxes and file / folder requester

 

System Requirements

  • Windows 7 or 10
  • Visual Studio for C++
  • Steam account

 

Stretch Goals

  • $20,000: C# and Lua programming support
  • $50,000: Linux and Mac support
  • $80.000: Visual UI Designer

 

Risks & Challenges

All software development projects carry some risk, but the difficult parts of this project have already been worked out.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

Thank you for your support!
story_txt:
Native user interfaces like Win32 and Cocoa are limited and dated. Web-based technologies like Electron look nice, but the final product runs slow and feels sluggish. These problems caused me to rethink user interface design and come up with a new paradigm to deliver the best possible experience for desktop applications on the PC.
The Story
A few years ago I launched a crowdfunding campaign to bring Leadwerks Game Engine to the Linux operating system. The software went on to become a big success, with over $1 million in sales and more than 30,000 customers, including NASA, Northrop Grumman, and Lockheed Martin. I learned a lot from that experience and as I begin a new software application, I wanted to revisit the user interface and see if there was any way I could improve it.
A New Approach
Ultra App Kit provides a fast and customizable user interface for building game development tools and other desktop programs.

Supported Widgets

Label
Button (Push, checkbox, radio, and toggle styles)
ProgressBar
TextField
TextArea
ComboBox
ListBox
Slider (scrollbar, trackbar, and stepper styles)
Draggable multi-select TreeView
Create your own!

 
API Design

C++ shared pointers everywhere
Extensible widgets system
Extensive documentation with examples for each command
Can be made to interface with C# and Lua

 
UI Features

Resolution independent for any DPI (16K+)
Load SVG vector images
Filter and sort widget items by name
Set widget and item image
Change mouse cursor
Custom color schemes stored in JSON files

 
Other Features

File I/O
File system watcher
Memory allocation and management
Image loading, saving, processing
Package system for loading files from compressed / encrypted archives
Plugin system
Thread management
String manipulation (split, match, conversion, etc.)
Message boxes and file / folder requester

 
System Requirements

Windows 7 or 10
Visual Studio for C++
Steam account

 
Stretch Goals

$20,000: C# and Lua programming support
$50,000: Linux and Mac support
$80.000: Visual UI Designer


 
Risks & Challenges
All software development projects carry some risk, but the difficult parts of this project have already been worked out.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

 
Thank you for your support!

story:
About Growth Hacker

As part of Global Startup Battle 2015, we're making a board game about startups! Growth Hacker is a cheeky game about getting your startup off the ground and growing it to the Uber of whatever industry you're in. It's a turn based board, dice, and card game combining elements of turn based and strategic role playing games. 

In Growth Hacker, you employ staff, acquire users, and collect revenue to build your startup over 7 years. But you’ll get hit by market crashes, disruption cards, sneaky competitors, and the dreaded IPO!

Sneaky Preview!

The rules are already fully drafted, and this weekend we are developing a prototype! Here are some quick examples of the rules and cards. There's more examples being added to the Updates section regularly.

  • CAPITAL RAISING RULE 

    In a capital raise, you sell a portion of your company in exchange for money. To start a capital raise, declare that you are performing a capital raise, the percentage of your company that you’re selling, and your valuation.

    For example, you might sell 10% of your company, for 50 bitcoins. Or you might sell 60% of the company for 300 bitcoins. Both of these value the company at 500 bitcoins. You can use any valuation you like, and don’t need to justify it to other players (it doesn’t need to be related to the valuation method used to choose a winner, if you don’t want it to be).

    You need to get at least half of the other players to agree to the valuation for it to go ahead. So for example, if there are 4 people playing, then 2 other players need to agree to your valuation. If your valuation is accepted, then your capital raise goes ahead. On your turn in the next phase, take the amount of money agreed on before doing anything else. You also immediately update your percentage ownership.

  • STANDING DESK CARD
    Hustlers bring in an extra user per phase for each standing desk you own. (Keep - costs 15 bitcoin).


KPIs (lol)!

So turns out unless you're printing thousands of them, boardgames aren't all that cheap to make!

  • We've contacted suppliers and have worked out we'll need around $40 AUD to make each game to a solid standard (so considerably better than our usual Officeworks printing).
  • Our main perk is a copy of the game for $50 AUD - but there are stacks of others to the right so check them out!
  • This is a fixed funding campaign, so if we don't make the goal *screams* then everyone gets their dollarydoos back and we'll have to pivot slightly.


Why the world needs this

Board games are broken. Kidding! But actually, there should be an awesome one about startups - and what better place to see it happen than at a Startup Weekend. There is an increasing market for tabletop games, and there are over 400K people who have attended a startup weekend before - so we're hoping people will be pretty keen!

We've made a few games before, like a lifesized Settlers of Catan for our hexagonal IKEA rug, and a libertarian rip off of CAH titled Cards Against Communism. So we're very excited about taking on an original project of our own! (See the video for what these looked like. They were pretty sick.)


Help us Growth Hack!

If you'd just like to support us but don't want to buy a copy of the game, we have a $5 perk which will put your name and twitter handle on the back of the box for our first run! We hope you can still help us hack the internet and get everyone excited!

So feel free to share your thoughts @growthhackgame!

And to all of you guys at Startup Weekends around the world atm, happy hacking! :)

story:
Magik Play is already on sale at Amazon 

 

Visit us on our website to get information about our new & exciting products

www.magikbee.com

 

For the first time kids can play with real wooden toys on the iPad™

 

 

 

 

 

When kids play, they create their own world. In there, there are no limits to what is real, what hides behind the screen or what can be brought to life. We too dream with that world ! 

 

With a little Magik, we brought together the physical and digital play.

 

 

 

As Featured in:

 

 

They are all talking about Magik Play as an innovative set of educational games that merge the power of the digital interaction with the simplicity and fun of traditional toys.

 
Magik Play challenges kid to get through each challenge by assembling the magik blocks and the games respond to the physical constructions ! 

 

 

So far we have three Magik Play games designed to promote motor skills, spatial reasoning, creativity and collaboration.

These games are adapted to different age needs and interests:

 

 

To kids from 3 to 5 years: simple games that reinforce the importance of identifying basic shapes on the screen, using the physical wooden blocks.

 

 

 

 

To kids from 4 to 6 years:  amazing challenges that requires children to build objects with real wooden blocks to complete challenges on each level. 

 

 

 

To kids above 5 years old: even more challenging levels that require collaboration to complete the assignments and help the characters to escape.

 

 

Magik Play kit will include:

  • access to the 3 apps above (Hidden shape, Dino blocks and Runaway)
  • a kit of wooden Magik blocks
  • an Universal iPad™ stand 

     

     

     

     

     

    After Indiegogo campaign finishes, we estimate Magik Play will sell on retail for $49.90

     

     

    Reasons why you should have Magik Play

                                                   

    Easy to setup and always ready to play, no batteries, wires or internet connection, all you need is in the package... 

     

     

     

     

    ... well all, except the iPad™ :) 

    In the end all stores back into the same box, easy and quick ! 

     

     

     

     

                                                   

    This simple interaction is possible, because we developed a great solution that does not need batteries, wires or internet connection. It simply communicates with the iPad™, we call it “our little magik secret”.

     

     

     

     

     

    The coolness behind Magik Play is that it's very intuitive and simple to play.

     

     

     

                                                   

     

     

    We strong believe that the combination of physical toys with the advantages of the digital technology, brings major benefits to the kids development.

    Exploratory work has suggested that this sort of tangible interfaces might be particularly suitable for engaging children in playful learning and that the link between physical action and digital effects might lead to increased engagement and reflection.

     

     

     

     

     

    "Pediatricians Rethink Screen Time Policy for Children 
    Screen time can be enhanced by making it interactive [...]. Talk to your child about what they’re watching, expand on it by putting a physical object that they are viewing into their hands."

    http://www.wsj.com/articles/pediatricians-rethink-screen-time-policy-for-children-1444671636
     

     

     

     
    "[...] Children who were better at copying block structures were found to be better at early math, according to the study by University of Delaware and Temple researchers."

    http://www.udel.edu/udaily/2014/sep/playing-with-blocks-092613.html

     

    Our Mission is to give kids the necessary tools to play and learn in a more diverse and balanced way.

     

     

    Specifications

    Compatible with iPad™ generations:  2, 3, 4, Air, Air2, Mini, Mini 2, Mini 3, Mini 4.

     

                         

    For Android and others see FAQs bellow.
     
     

    All our products are made with nontoxic ink and organic materials.

     

     
     

    Our Story

    We see kids these days addicted to tablets and they do not seem to enjoy playing with good old toys. Tablets are great tools to improve kids learning, but the value of  traditional toys for motor skills development is particular important. Numerous scientific articles reinforce these concerns, it becomes necessary to balance screen time with physical activities. 

    We embraced the challenge to make the screen time at least a little more physical, fun and challenging at the same time.

     

    We came up with Magik Play to combine the simplicity of traditional wooden blocks with the iPad™. 

    Unlikely combination ? maybe... but one that works extremely well !  

     

     

    We are a team of parents and university researchers, involved in several award winning projects and with a strong experience on interactive technology for education.

     

     
    Our product experts are the reason why we are doing this project. They are our inspiration, but also our greatest critics. Our games are only ready to go If they pass their extensive tests.

     

     
     
    Magikbee is a Portuguese startup, member of the Startup Braga Innovation Hub (Microsoft Ventures partner). We have the ambition to become an important player in the interactive toys/games market.
     

     

                                                                   

     

         

     

     

    How the funds will be used

     

     

     
     

    Timeline

     

     

     

     

    Risks and challenges

     
    As with any physical product, there are a huge number of tasks that need to be completed. However, we have the necessary experience to take it to the finish line.

     

    Our commitment to our backers is to be transparent all the way to the final delivery. We know that regular communication is key, in goods or bads moments.

    The technologies used are fully developed at this point, and it works.

    The final iPad stand may have some design variations to allow the necessary compatibility with most of the iPad designs and to adjust the production to a higher scale. 

    Please be aware when we start shipping Magik Play there's always a risk of the product getting delayed in customs. 

    We are going to do everything in our power the fullfill your expectations. 

    We have a mission to complete, and therefore we are going to put blood, sweat and tears to make it happen !

    We will provide regular updates, and you can always follow our progress on facebook or twitter. 

     

     

    Research and Development

    It took us quite a bit to find the perfect technology for the final product

     

     

     

     

    and lots of experimentation with all sort combinations:

     

    We started designing the iPad stand with the objective to create a very functional piece, that is crucial to the game flow. 

     

     

    At this time we also got the idea to create something more than just a stand. It should also keep the magik blocks tidy after use. 

    And we came to the final Idea. It's a kind of iPad stand drawer that keeps all things tidy  inside.

    It took awhile to get to the final solution but we think that we accomplished to create a pretty cool product!

    and here it is:

     

     

    The iPad™ fits perfectly in the stand, and it has the perfect angle to assemble the blocks.

     

     
     

    Here we are cutting the wood to produce the iPad stand

     

    And now it's time to assemble. It looks cool! :)

     

     

     

    Obviously it is most likely there will be design changes ... the final appearence might differ from those in the photos.
     

    FAQs

     

    Why is Magik Play not compatible with other tablets (Android and Surface)?

    Our technology is dependent on the tablet screen and hardware sensors. We know the technology works on other tablets, we tested it, but it requires effort from our side, supporting a range of devices and adapting the software to different hardware specifications. So we started on iPads and will get to your device soon !

    The Magik Blocks will work on future games?

    With your help we will keep developing games that uses these set of blocks. In future we also expect that we add other blocks for other themes and games.

    Can the wooden blocks scratch the screen?

    The wooden blocks are smooth and safe to use on your iPad screen. If you are still not convinced, you can use your normal screen protector and it will work fine.

    Does it work with my iPad mini?

     

    Yes. The wooden blocks may look big for the smaller screen but they work because we are going to adapt the levels to that screen size.

    Are the materials safe for kids?

    We have strong concerns about kids safety and we are making sure only safe materials and non-toxic paints are used. We are also following all the current legislation to this kind of toys/games and part of the funds from this crowdfunding campaign is to support all necessary tests and compliances regarding toy safety.  

    Can a 2 year old toddler play the games?

    In spite of the age recommendation, will make sure the Magik blocks are perfectly safe for younger kids. Kids below 3 can play the game, but they maybe will need an adult help to guide them in each level.

    If I loose a Magik Block is possible to get a replacement ?

    In the future we will have on our website the option to buy spare parts, so that you don´t have to buy an entire kit if you loose only a couple of pieces.

    I have another question how can I contact you ?

    email us at info .at. magikbee.com

     

     

    Congratulations you made all the way to the end !

    Now do not forget to scroll back up, turn your attention to the right side and let us know your commitment level. 

    Thank You! 

    :)

story:
Hello Friends.
I'll be honest.
We have no money for a good video on indiegogo.
We have no money for a good design on an indiegogo.
But we have the knowledge of how to create a good product.
And we need your help.


In the modern world hard to save money on purchases.
Everyone wants to save money on purchases and receive extra points on the cards.
And we know how we can improve the lives of people.
And we have created an amazing app. It will improve everyone's life.
Everyone will be able to improve their financial condition.
Everyone will be able to practice your favorite shopping.

 

On Android. Download Google in the play.

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=c...

In the application, you can:
1. Keep your cards.
2. Take any card from the cloud
3. Save using the cards.

And the most important thing !!!

4. You can share cards with friends. Share on viber, whatsapp, e-mail, facebook and many other ways

 

We've created app only on Android.     But it will disappear after the new year !!!

We create backend of our app on parse.com

But parse.com closed in this year. And we need resources for new backend.  We need to create it in the new database.   It is necessary to create an app on IOS, too.

Do not let disappear application! Help us to do better!

Using this application, each person will be able to save on purchases.

Remember.

Users of this app can:

- Scan and store cards.
- Find the card in the cloud.
- To send, receive and share with friends.

We really need your help please, or the application will disappear!

 

Funds are needed for:
- Changes in the application on Android.
- Creation for IOS applications.
- Changes in the site.
- Hiring a designer, advertiser and PR manager

 

You can write all your question on e-mail: support@wherearemycards.com

Help us to do better!Using this application, each person will be able to save on purchases.Remember.Users of this app can:- Scan and store cards.- Find the card in the cloud.- To send, receive and share with friends.We really need your help please, or the application will disappear! Funds are needed for:- Changes in the application on Android.- Creation for IOS applications.- Changes in the site.- Hiring a designer, advertiser and PR manager You can write all your question on e-mail: support@wherearemycards.com

story:
While playing D&D and other tabletop RPG games we started to miss accessories that would make our gaming experience more enjoyable and convenient. In our opinion, the best way to fill the void is to create what you lack. We sat down and got to work. We would like to introduce you to our version of tabletop RPG accessories by Soaphog.

We have created easily adaptable cards, coins and tokens for minor and major RPG tabletop games such as Dungeons & Dragons, Pathfinder to name a few. Artwork for each accessory is unique and designed to fit any RPG game. 


Our story

We are Soaphog Game Studio from Latvia, passionate to create amazing gaming experiences. We develop video games and at the same time are keen D&D players, we create and play games, including tabletop RPGs. Our belief is that there are more gamers who miss affordable, quality and beautifully designed artwork accessories for tabletop RPG games. Therefore we are here to provide you with a great product. Since receiving our prototypes they haven't left our D&D table.


To create amazing artwork for tokens, cards and coins our inspiration is coming from historical objects covered with stories and events. In order to create fitting objects, our D&D tables have helped us in a major way. When creating coins we set our mind on classical fantasy coins with historical motives, so they would fit any tabletop. 
To get you inspired, glimpse in our design and creation process is here:



To get to affordable bulk production price we need your support to raise the fixed amount we are pledging for. It will give us the ability to produce tokens, cards and coins and deliver them to your game tables.

Indiegogo provides us with an opportunity to streamline accessories and get directly to tabletop RPG gamers. This campaign is also a feasibility check to find others like us, who miss affordable and quality tabletop RPG accessories. 

Risks and challenges

There are always risks and challenges and we have gone over and over them. We have locked the production partner for tokens, cards and coins that have provided us with great quality prototypes, pricing and reasonable production time.

Designs are ready for all tokens, cards and coins that are included as rewards for backers and production tests are done. We are sure of the quality. We love it! 

One of the challenges we foresee might be shipping as we hope we will have many backers supporting us! We have arranged with Latvian Post to keep things on track and to be precise and fast. 

There always is a chance for unforeseen events, in case they occur, we will be transparent with you about every issue and solution via campaign updates. We love talking to the like-minded crowd, so you will also receive updates how we are doing and what goes through our mind! 

Fulfilment of orders

Once we reach our funding goal and receiving funds from Indiegogo, we will start production and deliver your rewards as soon as we can. We estimate it will take us around 30 days to be ready for shipping. We are going to ship by regular post (Latvian Post), so depending on your location, it might take up to 30 days delivery time. 

This is EU friendly project as we will be shipping from EU. According to Latvian Post, our shipping costs differ for EU backers and other countries. EU starts from 3 EUR and goes up to 10 EUR for Master and Dragon set. For other countries shipping starts at 5 EUR and goes up to 20 EUR for Master and Dragon set. 

When we unlock Stretch goal 4, each of backers with the coin set will receive an email from us with an invitation to choose the type of coin design. You will need to be up to speed and quite fast on deciding, so we could keep the delivery promise. 

Please ask us, if you have any question about shipping. Bulk orders are welcome, contact us for special enquiries! 


If you like our idea or have a friend who might love it please share via Facebook, Twitter, Blog or any other means you have! 

Follow us on Facebook, Twitter or our Blog! 

We also accept cosmic energy and good thoughts!

story:
All vehicles are potentially usable. We want vehicles to really have a meaning. They won't be hard to come by, but you might have a problem getting any of them to run. We have planned and implemented an extensive parts list for anything on wheels. Vehicles can also be used as mobile camps carrying all of your goods in their trunks or truck beds. Leaving your fully-stocked car in the wild, unlocked, would be a terrible idea. Removing a part or two should keep it pretty safe. So you found a nice pile of old barn wood? That'd be great to use when boarding up all those doors and windows back home. You can't stick ten planks into a backpack, right? But you can fit plenty into the bed of a truck or the trunk of a car. Vehicles will be worth their weight in gold in our world so make sure that you take care of yours.

(1) All vehicles can be repaired or modified  

(2) All vehicles are fuel based and require fuel to function

(3) Vehicles also require numerous parts to function



One of the key notes of every successful game is the music and we work tirelessly to bring you the best heart pumping experience. Each and every sound and every melody was selected carefully to match the game's scenes and occurrences, while having a unique touch of our own. Whether you are wandering among the damned or just exploring the vast wilderness of the islands. In addition we have a treat for you, the shattering guitar sounds of our awesome band "The Genders" will be played while you are working your way to the cure, fighting formidable foes and making yourselves a symbol as the legends that you are.



Rush Island is full of wonder , diverse environments, animals and plants. This gives a sense that this small island is in fact a world inside of a world, a microcosms of our blue planet for us to travel and explore and with each and every mission the appetite to know more, to see what else is out there will gradually grow inside you until there will be no escape. Here's is a taste of what is to come


As you probably already know making this kind of an ambitious game requires a substantial amount of capital. Games like this often have hundreds of thousands of dollars invested. That goes to: developers, animators, sound engineers, software engineers, etc. However, we have achieved much with little to none. Our team is all invested in it with great passion and belief as a fuel and we have a plan to make it all work but we need your help.

This chart below provides the answer for the question first posed in the title and as you can see, already thirty percent of the relatively small budget already goes to taxes, but even so we calculated allocated the funds exactly where it needs to go.

The Reich’s has a Eugenics Program to cleanse a certain ethnic group from Earth. Russia wants to experiment on the ideas of Genetic Supremacism and starts a similar secret program. Through the spying they know both are working on a virus that they want to be Genpool specific, so they can wipe each other out easily and without using force and wasting time and resources. They steal each other’s Scientific Research and Virus sample and both create a combined Version. The RUSH Virus. Germany can’t handle it and virus breaks free in laboratory, one infected scientists makes it out alive and goes to Russia Laboratory’s. He tells them to stop because at his laboratory all people were killed. They say they don’t believe them and they can’t die because it’s Gen specific. The Russians don’t believe the German scientist and as the guards go to him to take him captive, the German scientist starts coughing and sneezing sending virus particles in the air before his untimely death. The Russian laboratory gets infected and within 48 hours the virus wiped them out completely. On a broader scale both the Russians and the Germans are forced to do something about that. Because it is clear that it doesn’t target not only the Germans or only the Russians but all people. That forces them to cooperate to keep this secret from the other countries of the coalition because Russia can’t afford to look weak and so cant Germany at this point in the war. So they make a pact to remove everything related to the project and ship all infected to an Island chain far in the Ocean where hopefully no one would notice. They plan to work on a vaccine but so far all they have found is a substance that slows the process down. So in the end everyone who is infected dies. 

The Americans find out about the Virus and tells both the Russians and Germans that they know. Out of this situation it becomes clear that this Virus could be a threat to the United States and the whole world if not controlled. So after discussing it with Germany and Russia they decide to help with the shipping because they have the biggest Navy on planet Earth. The deal is that Russia and Germany take care of resources used to build facilities and infrastructure on the Island and America ships the infected and keeps the island chained and under protection so that no one can escape or enter. First, it was an organized system but after shipping the last infected to the islands, no one wanted to waste further resources so they agreed to abandon it and leave the people as they are. From time to time they would fly in supplies for the survivors and even some virus inhibitors and they were leaving all there stashes behind because they wanted to get out of there as fast as possible so that no evidence would give them up.

In exchange for big sums of money from Russia and Germany, the US is keeping this issue under wraps and even sending supplies every so often that the people may survive in the harsh condition but all of the islands are surrounded and abandoned. To this day the island chains are surrounded and supplies and virus inhibitors are dropped from the air to support survivors. No one gets in or out but the chance to heal yourself and having a normal life without dying rapidly and horribly exists. So that is what people are trying to learn while walking the path of the damned on Rush Island. 

Christopher Miller – Hero of the Island – Abandoned by America, had to stay back (Plot) – Miller has friends on outside who send supplies, but they can’t go back for him or let him out. He was infected from some traitors - He has become the leader and symbol of freedom and healthiness - People got together and pulled statues down – Miller is the symbol of the island and both side praise the “M” Symbol for Miller.

PLOT IDEA On the Islands are oil extraction machines that pump oil to the surface. Implement the greediness of Americans for oil, even as early as WWII, in the story. They gathered surveillance everywhere, that’s why they know of the plan from Germany and Russia. They are also researching places for oil refineries and they had the islands under surveillance. That’s one piece of how they discovered the plot and why they want big sums of money (see main story). The Americans only interest with the islands is the oil. Miller has a conflict with a greedy asshole that doesn’t give a shit about people. He is against the oil and the use of sick labors. The bad guy is responsible to frame him in bad light, but Miller proves over time, after he is trapped and contacts outside, that he is not. That’s why he has still friends outside even though some are paid off and learned to hate Miller for the money. In exchange for supply drops, Miller opens the oil lines that where build and lead into the ocean. They open the floodgates as trade off. But they demand items in addition to food and basic necessities. They work on their own condition even though they are trapped, they now have made this deal for a better future and life for all. (Game loot and Item variety) Also it makes sense as reason why both tribes have a period of peace and live in harmony on the island. In this harmony period they even strike down statues to honor this change of their lives. After Miller dies both tribes remember Millers story but they start fighting over supply drops and when there was the first incident about the supply drops they started splitting up and fighting over resources so they can have the loot basically said. Both Islands fight to honor Miller that’s why both use the M, maybe slightly different versions but practically the exact same. So they have a time period after the split where there is much death and fighting over stuff, island architecture including all items becomes makeshift style, overgrown, used, worn down, apocalyptic, WWII + Nature + Makeshift and only from time to time airdrops with modern stuff and clean stuff. Clothing also worn down over time, maybe they invented method to make cloth and harvest foods and stuff like that, would be cool or even different hierarchy systems in both tribes, something creative. Both have their own developed gadgets because every side has something the other wants, and they steal from each other and play mind games to get the resources the other tribe.

MILLERS WIFE She is a Scientist and is eventually working with oil minerals and fungus (see Main story). That’s why she can help synthesize an anti-virus inhibitor drug.

MILLERS WIFE

She is a Scientist and is eventually working with Oil and Minerals and Fungus (see Main story). That’s why she can help synthesize a anti-virus inhibitor drug.

M-SYMBOL

At the “M”, the lines that goes up from the middle could be hands and in the middle we add a block or redesigned so the lines represents hands and a standing person, the block between them represent the airdrop. He is standing, looking up at the airdrop, camera behind him a few feet and sun is casting the shadow in M form and combined with his gesture he makes the Logo and the airdrop in the air in front of him with a parachute. This is a early version for preview.

The islands are filled with dangers, lurking in every corner, waiting to put an end to a life of service and dedication. In order to protect yourselves and continue the fight there are a wide range of weapons to choose from. From guns and knives to mean howling war machine vehicles and machine guns. The weapons vary with the residents of the island: Russian, American, and German made. There is an option to have custom made weapon. Find the parts you need and build your very own killer tools of war.
