story:
Introduction

Welcome, Commander.  You must have heard the news.  The rumors are true: his majesty, King Revland, has died.  His passing has caused a fair amount of turmoil in the bordering realms. The Undead are stirring, coming out of the Forsaken Tundra and raiding outlying villages, the Goblins of Cutthroat Cliffs, who only concern themselves with gold and jewels, seek now for higher ambitions, smelling opportunity further inland, and reports of other races say they are moving forces across forbidden borders, breaking treaties, and amassing armies.

Some of these jokers believe that since the late king has no heir, the throne to the kingdom is up for grabs.  They think that if they can take it by force, the kingdom will kneel to them, and a new dynasty will begin under their law.  I’m telling you that we simply cannot let this happen. Imagine Necrodore, the Undead Lord, sitting upon the throne. It’d be the death of us all!

Forget it!  Defeat is not an option!  The Humans are going to make a stand.  Already, other commanders, like you, have taken up our banner in defense of this great land and claim the throne for us, it’s rightful heirs.  We will bring peace to this land and give it a king worthy to succeed King Revland in honor and justice.

The other races, no doubt, have a similar plan.  To help you repel these forces, you will be given command over our most powerful warriors.  We will supply you with the cost of hiring these troops and give you the tools to obliterate your enemies.  Peace is not cheap. Choose from mighty swordsmen, cunning trappers, vigilant knights, and magic-launching mages.  Assemble your team and join the fight for the throne!

 

Join our Discord server!  https://discord.gg/5v3zSPc

 

 

 

A Breaking of the 4th Wall

It is our deliberate intention to keep players inside the world of Birthright by telling a compelling story, constructing an in-depth world to explore and understand, and providing compelling music, voices and sounds, gameplay, and graphics quality, to make certain that what you do in your individual battles has an effect on the world as a whole.  Alas, there will be times where we must pull you from this incredible place and 'break the 4th wall.'  We do this to give you an understanding of the game we play, a game of balance, details, quality, and beauty.

PYE Games is built solidly on the shoulders of a keen designer, a resolute developer, a driven voice and sound designer, a visionary composer, a loyal artist, and a gifted whip-cracker.  We take pride in announcing the world of Birthright, a card-based, battle simulation that draws its characters from a world fused with fantasy and magic and pits them against the forces that would have them eradicated from the world.

 

 

 

What We Need

As an indie development company, our resources are small, but our dreams are massive!  Each of us shows ample aptitude in our respective roles, and together, our passion drives this project forward.  There are so many ways we can make this game better, and it's important to us that we deliver a game that is completed, refined, easy to understand and play, and most of all fun.  We need it to be ready at launch so that we can immediately start plans for Season 2, one of many expansions that will widen your scope of the world, further the storylines of these incredible characters, and give you more options for cards in your deck-building collection.

By contributing to this campaign, you support us in delivering this project to the world in its intended form.  Some examples of ways this money will be used include:

1.  3D rendered characters that jump from the cards and into the battle ready to fight.  At the moment, the cards played onto the field stay cards when they are in combat.  3D artists and animators can bring these characters to life in a way a flat drawing of a card never could.

2.  A fully orchestrated soundtrack and high quality sound.  It's sad to say it, but these things take money to get them done right.  Your contributions will help in the creating of these beautiful works.   

3.  Telling the story.  We know the power of a captivating story.  Birthright is different than other card games for many reasons, but this one feels the most important.  The characters and races in the land will change over time and you will witness the fall of the mighty, the rise of the weak and weary, and the transformations of the corrupted and insane.  (Do you want to know the best part?  These changes will be because of how the players interact with these characters.  Does the Goblin CEO, Greygrip Satchelsnatcher sit the king's throne at the end of Season 1?  Or is it given over to the Lord of the Undead, Necrodore?  Can the Humans retain this mighty honor?  Or do the power of Dwarven inventions secure the throne for themselves?  It all depends on you.)

4.  Cinematics.  To show the outcomes of the Seasons, to give power to the weak, or to change the DNA of a Human scientist to a rabid Goblin supporter, we need the ability to produce compelling cinematics.  This includes a comic-style overlay, animations, voice-over acting, and vibrant art.  We want a reason to nerf or buff your darling Necromancer Jane that you understand instead of doing it just because we feel like it.  As we said before, we want you to feel like this world is changing and evolving without you having to see the gears and steam vents under the hood.

5.  UX design and integration, polish, and bug testing.  No one is pulled from the world of Birthright faster than a witness of a glitch or a difficult to use interface.  If the card says 'Summon a 3/3/1 Rabid Dog,' and it pulls out a 0\3\0 Random Egg instead, we have a problem.  Bug testing is crucial to removing distractions and giving a fair game to players, and this takes time.

 

 

 

What You Get

If we have the ability and the resources listed above, you will get an incredibly unique game that rewards strategy, decision-making skills, and study of your opponent.  Our goal is to reach $75,000, but our sights are set on producing something much better than what that money can do for the game.  Some of our stretch goals are listed above, but here are a few more that we can attain as we reach higher funding:

1. More races.  Adding more races to the mix will deepen the world as a whole and change the way the game is played.

2.  Customizable bases.  The area behind your army should reflect you and your achievements.  We want to craft a system where you can shine by simply queuing into a game and displaying your commander status to your opponent.

3.  The Standard Bearer.  This fellow will stand beside your army and wave your flag to give inspiration to your troops and emotes to your opponent.

In addition to the overall gameplay and as a contributor to this Indiegogo campaign, you will receive specific account rewards, given to you after launch.  Here are some unique perks that can be unlocked for your account.

1.  More Packs,  More packs equals more cards.  More cards equals more deck-building choices to build your army just the way you want.

2. In-game currency.  Experience will be a way to purchase more packs, upgrade existing cards, or purchase cosmetics.  By donating here, you receive an equal amount of in-game currency that you would have gotten for every dollar you spend.

3.  Bigger rewards for bigger donations.  We value your dedication to us and will reward you with special perks for funding us.  These include:  Founder Status, an opportunity to design your own hero for a future race, and having your name in the credits!

 

 

 

Let's Get Specific About Birthright

 

What makes Birthright different than other card games?

1. The Battlefield.  Birthright is played on a 6x6 grid where you can summon soldiers to the fight from your side of the board.  When playing a card, you can choose from the six spots in the first row, this area is your starting area.  Depending on the battlefield status, you may choose to place the card on spot #1 away from forces massing on the other side, or you could choose to put him directly in harm's way to soak up damage.

For those of you familiar with card games, the battlefield is one of the biggest differences that gives Birthright a unique playstyle from other card games.  Location is everything.  Doesn’t it make sense that if an archer is behind a warrior, then he is more protected from the enemy?  Of course it does!  That’s what gives Birthright an added layer of strategy and opens the door for your opponent to make mistakes.

Lastly, having a game where movement can be restricting sets a pace for the game that can be taken advantage of.  Stick together with a tank up front, a spell caster or healer in the middle, and a sniper in the back, and never let a skeleton get close!  You are so clever and such a great strategist!

2.  Living cards.  We mean this in two senses of the word.  Cards are divided into different rarities, Bronze being the lowest, Silver, Gold, and Platinum, however there is a twist.  Each card is designed with the four different rarities, giving bonuses to abilities and stats as they level up.  Just playing a card like a Bronze Shield Reaver into the battlefield will give it a bit of Experience once the game is completed.  Give it enough Experience, and that bronze card will grow to be a Silver.  Play it more and more, and eventually, that lowly Bronze Shield Reaver becomes a Platinum Shield Reaver that smashes his way onto the battlefield and plows through opponents like tissue paper.  Feel like you need better cards?  Just play the game, and you'll get there without spending a dime.  Give it the effort and gain the reward!

The other living card element is that the cards that you own are intertwined into the story of Birthright.  As major tournaments happen and seasons come and go, you'll see changes to the cards in your collection.  We will have seasonal risk tied to certain cards, and how the players play will decide their outcome at the end of the season.  Here's an example:  Toliver, the Mighty Earth Knight, is a shining example of strength and devotion, but at the beginning of Season 1, his sister, Elena, is abducted by the Undead lord, Necrodore.  Here is the risk:  if more battles are won by Humans during Season 1, Toliver will have successfully regained his sister from Necrodore's clutches, and she will be returned to the Humans as a playable card.  If the Undead win more battles, she will not have been rescued, and she will become a new Undead card called The Bride of Necrodore.  This is serious stuff were talking about.

 

 

 

Endgame

 

Ok, as fun as it is endlessly beating the opposing army, what’s the overall point?  What’s the goal?  Well, beyond your enemies is their base, accessible from anywhere in their starting area, that has 20 hit points. Getting those points down to zero will win you the game.  Alternatively, just behind your starting area is your base.  This you must defend because if the enemy knocks its 20 hit points down to zero, it’s game over for you.

 

 

 

Is Birthright Pay to Play?  Is it Pay to Win?

Birthright will be launched as a free game, and we will never charge just to play the game.  After a short tutorial, you can begin queuing into matches against other players at your skill level.  You will be given the option to pick a preconstructed deck that has been crafted to be competitive and receive all the cards in that deck into your collection.  From there, daily missions will give you an incentive to try new things and reward you with more packs and Experience.

Experience is a resource you can use to increase the power level of your collection, but the problem that most will see immediately is a more powerful card is better than its original version.  Does that mean the player who shells out the most dollars for in-game Experience is going to have the advantage and beat me every time?  The answer is no.  There are a few checks and balances in place that make the game fair.  Firstly, the rarer a card is, the less you are allowed to put it into your deck.  Bronze is limited to 4, Silver to 3, Gold to 2, and Platinum to 1.  This restricts the number of times you will see it played against you.  Secondly, as the power level of cards increases, so does their cost.  This limits the turns the higher cost cards are able to be played.  With this model, the game is not Pay to Win.

 

 

 

Closing Remarks

Birthright is designed to be a community-driven game, where we, the developers, are open and inviting fan content, lore posts, and constructive feedback on the overall state of the game.  We want to hear from you, implement fan-built content into the game, run art contests, design cards on stream so everyone can have a say.  We want to keep things open and make appropriate changes to the game to help it become the best it can!
story_txt:
Introduction
Welcome, Commander.  You must have heard the news.  The rumors are true: his majesty, King Revland, has died.  His passing has caused a fair amount of turmoil in the bordering realms. The Undead are stirring, coming out of the Forsaken Tundra and raiding outlying villages, the Goblins of Cutthroat Cliffs, who only concern themselves with gold and jewels, seek now for higher ambitions, smelling opportunity further inland, and reports of other races say they are moving forces across forbidden borders, breaking treaties, and amassing armies.
Some of these jokers believe that since the late king has no heir, the throne to the kingdom is up for grabs.  They think that if they can take it by force, the kingdom will kneel to them, and a new dynasty will begin under their law.  I’m telling you that we simply cannot let this happen. Imagine Necrodore, the Undead Lord, sitting upon the throne. It’d be the death of us all!
Forget it!  Defeat is not an option!  The Humans are going to make a stand.  Already, other commanders, like you, have taken up our banner in defense of this great land and claim the throne for us, it’s rightful heirs.  We will bring peace to this land and give it a king worthy to succeed King Revland in honor and justice.
The other races, no doubt, have a similar plan.  To help you repel these forces, you will be given command over our most powerful warriors.  We will supply you with the cost of hiring these troops and give you the tools to obliterate your enemies.  Peace is not cheap. Choose from mighty swordsmen, cunning trappers, vigilant knights, and magic-launching mages.  Assemble your team and join the fight for the throne!
 
Join our Discord server!  https://discord.gg/5v3zSPc
 
 
 

A Breaking of the 4th Wall
It is our deliberate intention to keep players inside the world of Birthright by telling a compelling story, constructing an in-depth world to explore and understand, and providing compelling music, voices and sounds, gameplay, and graphics quality, to make certain that what you do in your individual battles has an effect on the world as a whole.  Alas, there will be times where we must pull you from this incredible place and 'break the 4th wall.'  We do this to give you an understanding of the game we play, a game of balance, details, quality, and beauty.
PYE Games is built solidly on the shoulders of a keen designer, a resolute developer, a driven voice and sound designer, a visionary composer, a loyal artist, and a gifted whip-cracker.  We take pride in announcing the world of Birthright, a card-based, battle simulation that draws its characters from a world fused with fantasy and magic and pits them against the forces that would have them eradicated from the world.
 
 
 

What We Need
As an indie development company, our resources are small, but our dreams are massive!  Each of us shows ample aptitude in our respective roles, and together, our passion drives this project forward.  There are so many ways we can make this game better, and it's important to us that we deliver a game that is completed, refined, easy to understand and play, and most of all fun.  We need it to be ready at launch so that we can immediately start plans for Season 2, one of many expansions that will widen your scope of the world, further the storylines of these incredible characters, and give you more options for cards in your deck-building collection.
By contributing to this campaign, you support us in delivering this project to the world in its intended form.  Some examples of ways this money will be used include:
1.  3D rendered characters that jump from the cards and into the battle ready to fight.  At the moment, the cards played onto the field stay cards when they are in combat.  3D artists and animators can bring these characters to life in a way a flat drawing of a card never could.
2.  A fully orchestrated soundtrack and high quality sound.  It's sad to say it, but these things take money to get them done right.  Your contributions will help in the creating of these beautiful works.   
3.  Telling the story.  We know the power of a captivating story.  Birthright is different than other card games for many reasons, but this one feels the most important.  The characters and races in the land will change over time and you will witness the fall of the mighty, the rise of the weak and weary, and the transformations of the corrupted and insane.  (Do you want to know the best part?  These changes will be because of how the players interact with these characters.  Does the Goblin CEO, Greygrip Satchelsnatcher sit the king's throne at the end of Season 1?  Or is it given over to the Lord of the Undead, Necrodore?  Can the Humans retain this mighty honor?  Or do the power of Dwarven inventions secure the throne for themselves?  It all depends on you.)
4.  Cinematics.  To show the outcomes of the Seasons, to give power to the weak, or to change the DNA of a Human scientist to a rabid Goblin supporter, we need the ability to produce compelling cinematics.  This includes a comic-style overlay, animations, voice-over acting, and vibrant art.  We want a reason to nerf or buff your darling Necromancer Jane that you understand instead of doing it just because we feel like it.  As we said before, we want you to feel like this world is changing and evolving without you having to see the gears and steam vents under the hood.

3.  The Standard Bearer.  This fellow will stand beside your army and wave your flag to give inspiration to your troops and emotes to your opponent.

story:
Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to our new online multiplayer street shooter - The Scumbags!

 

Here comes Hamsa, the gang leader of "Southwest".

His past is covered with mysteries; however, it’s not so easy to find out anything about his present.

Training new gangsters, monitoring drug trafficking, as well as collecting money at the controlled areas of London are his main responsibilities. There are about 200 members in his gang.

 

The goal of the game

 

To survive in the harsh conditions of street fights, to earn money and become recognized in the society. Won’t you lose self-esteem after getting influence and becoming respected in the criminal world?

Once in the game, you join the gang. Here you face a choice: to follow the herd instinct and become a real scumbag or adhere to the main values of life and use your power and influence in more noble purposes.

 

The Scumbags Team

 

 

The Scumbags is a conceptually realistic game without flying dragons or weapons from the future. The gameplay is laid out for making the player familiar with the real conditions of street fights. You don’t get three, but one life, and its safety totally depends on your tactics and skills.

 

The instruments

 

The Scumbags provides its players with a full arsenal of a scumbag. Here you’ll find bottles with incendiary mixtures, baseball bats, handmade explosive devices and various kinds of firearms.

 

The features

 

Like in real life, you’ll face deception, betrayal and corruption of the authorities in The Scumbags. At the same time, you’ll get a chance to demonstrate the best human qualities: mutual assistance and self-sacrifice, while being a part of a team and helping your subordinates to win.

 

Workflow

 
 
Creation of such a large-scale game project is divided into many stages. First, we develop the map of London and place our characters there, however after the final testing our players will be able to choose among different cities and travel along unbelievably realistic streets of New York, Tokyo, Moscow or Paris.
 
 

The expenses regarding the first version of

The Scumbags

 

 

The collected money will be used for attracting experienced game developers to the project. Together we will achieve the set goal and complete the first version of The Scumbags.

 

The stated sum 5,383$ will be enough to release the first version of

The Scumbags.

* In case we collect more than it’s stated, we will gradually switch to work on the map selection function, we will be able to diversify the game objects and the means of combat (weapon), will develop "Team Deathmatch" game mode and add a "store", where you’ll buy clothes and other items for the characters using the money earned in the game.

 

For six months our team has been developing the unique gameplay, we’ve spent a lot of money and time on creating the prototypes of the characters and working out the concept of their relationships.

And today we need your support to move on!

story:
introduction

SakuraGame has been helping Japanese independent game developers translate their works into English, so that more players who like Japanese Fanfic Games can experience these different independent games.

Game Story

This is a flight shooting game with RPG growth factor and adult contents.
The role that you control is the white dragon’s daughter who will resist the evil dragon and protect the Dragon Kingdom’s national treasure “Dragon Tears” according to the dragon’s witch’s instructions. At the beginning, the small white dragon’s power is not strong. But with constant fighting and collecting a lot of Dragon’s Souls, her bullets, attacking methods and special skills will be improved.
Please use your power to expel the evil dragon lurking around the Dragon Kingdom and maintain the peace and tranquility of the Dragon Kingdom.

What We Need

If you can help us to raise $2000 here, we will use this fee to make the English version of Dragonia

Rewards

$5=Receive a Steam key for Dragonia, and a product key for the fully uncensored 18+ patch!

  • Dragonia Steam Key
  • Dragonia 18+ Patch

Risks & Challenges

If the English version of the game is not completed, we will refund the money to everyone through PAYPAL.

Greenlight

If you like this game, help us plz (,,• ₃ •,,)

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetai...

story:
• This campaign has been canceled and all the orders have been refunded — thank you again for supporting this project. The development of this game has not stopped. Follow our development journey on inflictedvr.com 

 

iNFLiCTED is a fantasy-adventure VR game, set in the realm of Purgatory.

The entire world looks like a never-ending graveyard spanning as far as the eyes can see. There is an entire enchanted world to discover with ancient creatures guarding secrets older than time itself. You play the role of a lost soul, trying to change your fate. What you don’t realise is that with every moment you spend fighting the natural order of things, you get lost deeper and deeper into Limbo.

But you are not alone. From the moment you wake up, Her — another lost soul whose identity won’t be revealed until later —, is there to help you escape the GraveDigger, cross the Forest of Death and make your way to the Miller’s House.

There are a lot more characters to meet in the realm of iNFLiCTED and many places to explore: from sneaking into the Temple of Fate to steal the Ledger of Souls, to fighting the demons at the Gates of Hell, exploring the City of the Damned, and even challenging the Ripper herself. It’s an original story, like nothing you’ve experienced before, with beautiful environments and mesmerising dynamically animated elements — loosely inspired from Dante’s Inferno, Greek mythology, Supernatural, Limbo and Journey.

 

 

Works on Smartphone VR too

The entire game was specifically developed for VR — this is not a game that you could play with a mouse simply ported to VR. However, VR-ready equipment is expensive and we wanted to make it accessible for everyone. So having the game work on smartphones, without the need of a controller, was a priority.

— all the in-game footage was recorded on  iPhone 6s and Samsung S7 —

Multiple Game-Mechanics

But it wouldn’t be a game if it’s not engaging and fun — to do this, we decided to change the game mechanics with every level.

You start playing an arcade-like Space Invaders collecting light souls, followed by a side-scrolling inspired boss fight, then you switch to a first person exploration map, transitioning to an obstacles avoiding racer and many other game styles including puzzle solving, button matching and memory based challenges. Every level has something slightly different, while still retaining the same core concept: collect yellow, avoid reds, and use power-ups for attack and defence actions.

If you are to group the levels into categories there are 5 types of game-mechanics:

  • Arcade-like missions where you look around to control your soul
  • Open world exploration where you tilt your head to turn left and right
  • Fast predefined racing levels where you rely on memory and reflexes to avoid obstacles
  • Time based puzzle solving missions where you need to match specific combinations
  • Side-scrolling levels where a character is following your soul and you need to convince him to do "something"

 

In-game Cutscene Screenshots

— all the above are in-game cut-scenes from the game—

 

 

We have pretty much all the game mechanics coded, the entire story has been written, the bulk of the maps have been drafted, tested and validated with users.

But after working on this for almost a year, there is still a lot to be done in order to maintain the quality you saw in the trailer, for a 3 hours VR experience — with high quality voice acting, amazing character animation, top visual effects, all optimised and tested cross-platform to work on all VR ready smartphones.

This is what  we will be able to accomplish with your help:

The money will be used for:

  • Character Animation and Mo-Cap
  • Remaining 3D Assets development
  • Voice Acting
  • Audio implementation
  • Programming
  • Cross platform QA

About 40% of the funds will be used for fulfilling the rewards and Indiegogo fees.

 

VR DEMO GAME LAUNCHING SOON

We worked very hard to get a playable demo ready that we will launch before the end of this campaign. It features the first 15 minutes of gameplay, so subscribe to our Updates to receive an email when it’s available on the AppStore and Google Play.

Or follow us on Social Media:

  • @altergaze on Twitter
  • @altergaze on Instagram
  • facebook.com/altergaze 

The more people believe in this project, the better the final game will be.

 

HELP US FUND THIS!

If you like indie games, if you love VR, if you want to be immersed in this sinister yet mesmerising world we created for iNFLiCTED, please help us bring this to life and be part of our journey by pledging early and helping share this campaign with your friends.

Our goal is simple: make one of the best games made for VR!

 

iNFLiCTED Demo Available for Download

 

We are excited to announce that the iNFLiCTED Demo is now available to download for FREE on the iOS App Store! 

Download the iNFLiCTED Demo for iOS here: 

https://itunes.apple.com/gb/app/inflicted-vr-adventure-game/id1368190525?mt=8

We will publish it on Google Play soon too, so make sure you follow our campaign for more news and updates! In the meantime, you can download the .apk directly from here:

http://inflictedvr.com/betaAccess/inflicted_andoirdBuild_b01A003/inflicted-demo.apk

We would love to hear your thoughts on the demo and any feedback would be greatly appreciated!
story_txt:
This campaign has been canceled and all the orders have been refunded — thank you again for supporting this project. The development of this game has not stopped. Follow our development journey on inflictedvr.com  iNFLiCTED is a fantasy-adventure VR game, set in the realm of Purgatory.The entire world looks like a never-ending graveyard spanning as far as the eyes can see. There is an entire enchanted world to discover with ancient creatures guarding secrets older than time itself. You play the role of a lost soul, trying to change your fate. What you don’t realise is that with every moment you spend fighting the natural order of things, you get lost deeper and deeper into Limbo.But you are not alone. From the moment you wake up, Her — another lost soul whose identity won’t be revealed until later —, is there to help you escape the GraveDigger, cross the Forest of Death and make your way to the Miller’s House.There are a lot more characters to meet in the realm of iNFLiCTED and many places to explore: from sneaking into the Temple of Fate to steal the Ledger of Souls, to fighting the demons at the Gates of Hell, exploring the City of the Damned, and even challenging the Ripper herself. It’s an original story, like nothing you’ve experienced before, with beautiful environments and mesmerising dynamically animated elements — loosely inspired from Dante’s Inferno, Greek mythology, Supernatural, Limbo and Journey.  Works on Smartphone VR tooThe entire game was specifically developed for VR — this is not a game that you could play with a mouse simply ported to VR. However, VR-ready equipment is expensive and we wanted to make it accessible for everyone. So having the game work on smartphones, without the need of a controller, was a priority.— all the in-game footage was recorded on  iPhone 6s and Samsung S7 —Multiple Game-MechanicsBut it wouldn’t be a game if it’s not engaging and fun — to do this, we decided to change the game mechanics with every level.You start playing an arcade-like Space Invaders collecting light souls, followed by a side-scrolling inspired boss fight, then you switch to a first person exploration map, transitioning to an obstacles avoiding racer and many other game styles including puzzle solving, button matching and memory based challenges. Every level has something slightly different, while still retaining the same core concept: collect yellow, avoid reds, and use power-ups for attack and defence actions.If you are to group the levels into categories there are 5 types of game-mechanics:
Arcade-like missions where you look around to control your soul
Open world exploration where you tilt your head to turn left and right
Fast predefined racing levels where you rely on memory and reflexes to avoid obstacles
Time based puzzle solving missions where you need to match specific combinations
Side-scrolling levels where a character is following your soul and you need to convince him to do "something"
 In-game Cutscene Screenshots— all the above are in-game cut-scenes from the game—  We have pretty much all the game mechanics coded, the entire story has been written, the bulk of the maps have been drafted, tested and validated with users.But after working on this for almost a year, there is still a lot to be done in order to maintain the quality you saw in the trailer, for a 3 hours VR experience — with high quality voice acting, amazing character animation, top visual effects, all optimised and tested cross-platform to work on all VR ready smartphones.This is what  we will be able to accomplish with your help:The money will be used for:
Character Animation and Mo-Cap
Remaining 3D Assets development
Voice Acting
Audio implementation
Programming
Cross platform QA
About 40% of the funds will be used for fulfilling the rewards and Indiegogo fees. VR DEMO GAME LAUNCHING SOONWe worked very hard to get a playable demo ready that we will launch before the end of this campaign. It features the first 15 minutes of gameplay, so subscribe to our Updates to receive an email when it’s available on the AppStore and Google Play.Or follow us on Social Media:
@altergaze on Twitter
@altergaze on Instagram

facebook.com/altergaze 
The more people believe in this project, the better the final game will be. HELP US FUND THIS!If you like indie games, if you love VR, if you want to be immersed in this sinister yet mesmerising world we created for iNFLiCTED, please help us bring this to life and be part of our journey by pledging early and helping share this campaign with your friends.Our goal is simple: make one of the best games made for VR! iNFLiCTED Demo Available for Download We are excited to announce that the iNFLiCTED Demo is now available to download for FREE on the iOS App Store! Download the iNFLiCTED Demo for iOS here: https://itunes.apple.com/gb/app/inflicted-vr-adventure-game/id1368190525?mt=8We will publish it on Google Play soon too, so make sure you follow our campaign for more news and updates! In the meantime, you can download the .apk directly from here:http://inflictedvr.com/betaAccess/inflicted_andoirdBuild_b01A003/inflicted-demo.apkWe would love to hear your thoughts on the demo and any feedback would be greatly appreciated!

story:
David Jones:

Hello everyone, I'm David Jones - programmer, artist and project lead for ‘Ye Fenny 2 – Whiplin’s Retribution’ at ‘Dpad For The Win’. I’ve been making games now for 20+ years on Windows PCs. In 2017, with the help of my family and friends, I published my first commercial game, ‘Ye Fenny – Revenge of the Evil Good Shepherd’ on Steam and various other online video game markets. The game received critical acclaim from many gamers around the World, citing its fun feel and retro style, mixed with the random storylines and strange live-action cutscenes.
Checkout Dave's Youtube channel below: 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVQoLiy8-kdPYOGlGIFjYxg

Nik Lloyd:

Hi my name is Nik Lloyd, I create some of the music for DPAD-FTW and also write some of the storylines, help with filming, acting and also help where I can with some of the planning for the company. I use Logic Pro and Reason to create my music. I take inspiration from our favourite video game soundtracks from over the years, but also try to incorporate new ideas where I can into anything I create for the games.
Checkout Nik's music Youtube Channel below:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC27SU2YEiiiVtnFI5dt8nFA

Glyn Humphreys:

 Hi, I’m Glyn Humphreys – Actor, Voice Actor and Co-Sound Designer for Ye Fenny 2. I played the role of The Young Outlander in Ye Fenny – Revenge of The Evil Good Shepard.

In Ye Fenny 2 I reprise my role as The Outlander (this time also voicing him), and I have taken on a few more acting roles as well. I have also taken on some of the Sound Design responsibilities on this project, contributing more to the heavier side of the music.

I would say we are all quite invested in Ye Fenny 2 (even more so than the first). Not only because we are passionate about the project, but because most of us have other commitments, such as full time jobs. We’ve invested a considerable amount into the project so far too. In my case I’ve purchased software and equipment to try and achieve a better quality of sound for my music production.
Checkout Glyn's Youtube Channel below:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCTFpZHIdAbl_jFCLeqbRlow
                                                                                                                                  
Mike Jones:

Hello, my name is Mike Jones. I’m one of the actors and voice actors for Ye Fenny 2, I also provide creative input into the storyline and help out in other areas of the game. I also write the back stories for the bosses and other creatures and NPC’s in Ye Fenny 2.
Checkout Mike's Twitter account below:
https://twitter.com/big_mike_85


The reason why we've decided to campaign our second video game in the first quarter of its development is, we would like to be able to purchase more costumes for characters than we can already afford.

We have lots of ideas for characters and the storylines for our game. As you can see from the screen shot below, we had to work with a limitation of not having enough costumes. The characters in the shorts, white jumpers and hats are the Gnome Incers. They are a Resistance Army on planet Gnome-8. As they belong to an Army, they all wear the same uniform, so this limitation worked out for us.

But as we go on in our development of Ye Fenny 2, we want to get as many unique characters in the cutscenes and even NPC's (non-player characters in game assets) as possible.



If you help us reach our goal in funding costumes for our video game, you will be contributing to our biggest game to date. If we have more costumes for the characters, we can have more live action, full-motion video in our game, because the characters will be more relevant to the plot and have more personality.  We are currently looking to implement a full feature-length movie into our upcoming project via FMV splits, which will be 30 seconds to 6 minutes long. We currently have 16 minutes of FMV footage and the story has only just begun!

We are asking for $2400.00 to complete the filming portion of our game. 

First, I will break down the fees needed: IndieGoGo has a 5.00% charge for hosting on their platform so we are left with $2280 for our $2400 asking pledge.

Also we have to think about UK Government Tax which is an additional 20.00%, so after this we are left with $1824, which will be plenty for costumes, makeup and props which I estimate will be around 60.00% ($1024.40). 

With projects likes these, there is always overhead contingencies and miscellaneous items we need to produce these full motion videos such as, fuel for travel, food while filming, electricity, donations for our filming location, and if the costume budget runs out and we need certain props or additional tools, we can use part of this percentage which is $729.60 15.00%.



Please feel free to checkout our exciting perks to the right. Pick which one is right for you, we have many to choose from.

Don’t worry if we don't reach our full goal, I still plan on finishing the entire game, I've put way too much time and effort into creating the game's engine and getting it to the polished state that it's currently at.

If we don't reach the entire goal, the filming process and characters may have to be condensed a little, but I currently have £375.00 of my own money to put into the costume design as well, which roughly equates to $480.51.

We believe at Dpad For The Win, story telling is a major part of a game. This drives a lot of players to see the game through. We released our first game (Ye Fenny) last year (December 2017) to great acclaim because of the innovation of mixing live action cutscenes together with authentic style gameplay, unique characters and use of music.

We want to go even bigger in Ye Fenny 2 and we know we can, we want to tell the story of our main protagonist, The Outlander since his last adventure in Ye Fenny 1. 

It is now thirty years later and The Outlander is back with a Vengeance! Join him in the battles that he must undertake in order to restore peace and stability throughout the universe.

If you would like to see our previous video game, Ye Fenny – Revenge of the Evil Good Shepherd on Steam, published with its glowing reviews, please follow this link: https://store.steampowered.com/app/769020/Ye_Fenny__Revenge_of_the_Evil_Good_Shepherd/

I would like to show you an example below of the current quality of the cutscenes in Ye Fenny 2 and what you will be funding. As you can see, we try to emulate a similar style to the classic FMV's of games such as: Command and Conquer, Toonstruck and Resident Evil. We currently have 10 FMVS (Full Motion Videos).


The quality will dramatically get higher once the polishing stage of the game begins. We'll be adding more special effects, better lighting, more objects and sound effects.

We have made a 1 level demo of our game which includes 1 of the FMV cutscenes. You can now download and play-test our creation for yourself! If you are interested, please make a Youtube video of your reaction and feedback.

DOWNLOAD THE FREE 'YE FENNY 2' DEMO HERE:
(We are currently in the testing phase and this game is not yet rated, please only download if you're 18+)

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1dGC1OKphWZ7VQGqxoHngQPRc5X2WFggf

Alternatively if you wish to watch the demo being played, you can do so via the video below. 
(We are currently in the testing phase and this game is not yet rated, please, only watch if you're 18+)

I’m 100% dedicated to this project and my friends and family are too, but there are always risks and obstacles along the development road which, if taken with clear thought and planning ahead, can always be overcome.

My friends and family who are taking part acting in the filming process may not be able to film on certain days and may not be available for weeks, if this is the case for minor characters, I can always ask for help from other people. I always plan ahead of time with my team, booking them in advance.

Sometimes we are not able to film on certain days due to our filming location being booked out, usually this problem can be avoided as we always try to book well in advance. The filming location that we use does not ask us for any payment, but we donate money out off curtesy anyway. We do have alternative filming locations available if required, but these do charge a booking fee. Please see overhead contingencies and miscellaneous in the ‘What we need section’ of this page.

What happens if the Crowd Funding is a great success and goes over $2400.00?

That's a good thing, we will have even more freedom to work on this project. We'll be able to afford more things for the game such as better quality costumes and makeup, I'll also be able to pay the actors some money for the 'FREE' time that they are putting into this project.

We understand that some people cannot fund projects, or are interested in the project but don’t want to support via funding money. That’s no problem at all. Please remember to share our IndieGoGo page via all social media outlets such as, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Youtube, and any other social media platform you use.

IndieGoGo has Social sharing tools also, remember to make use of these too, to give our project the best chance of succeeding!

Thank you for looking at our project, it really means a lot to us here at Dpad For The Win.
Dave Jones,
DPADFTW.

Please note that all game assets are in their alpha stage and are subject to change.

story:
(Scroll down to learn more about the perks)

About the Game

The game starts with two characters fighting each other. As a player, you have to bring your character into the right mood so that it accepts a peace offer or even offers peace. You both win the game if you achieve peace. You both lose it when one of the character gets killed by the other. Every peace you co-create credits you with points and earns you a better rank. Killing does the opposite.

So, how do you control your character mood? On the screen, you can see your character's current mood with bars for health, fear, and anger. In addition, you have a set of tools that you can use to influence your character’s mood. Every tool that influences the mood is also influenced by the mood itself. This means for example that if you give your character ice cream order to calm him or her down, they can throw it on their opponent if they are too angry. In addition, every hit a character gets from the opponent makes him or her more angry or fearful and less healthy. This too is dependent on the character’s mood.

 

What Is Needed

This, project (which is in a very early stage of development, just putting together the idea and set of rules) requires costly elements and stages like first characterization, development, visual design and animation, sounds, and storage.

The minimum amount for a nice project is about $25,000, but at first I'm hoping to source at least $4,000 so that we can get started with professional characterization.

In case we don't reach the first goal ($4,000), all funding are kept for this project until the right sum is made, by other funding channels. 

 

The Impact

The final product is an attractive free (mobile) video game that puts peace at the forefront!

Then, I guess, the way to a world peace is short :)

 

The Perks

 I am offering three art prints painted by my late father, and a premium t-shirt with the PeaceMaker logo. 

--

Choose your three prints here. Printed size: 10cm X 10cm.
For more information, check out my Father's art FB page: https://www.facebook.com/ArieHodArt/

 

More details about the Premium T-Shirt in these links: Women, Men

story:
Gameplay

 

 

 

         

 

 

         

 

 

 

         

 

CHARACTER

                                                    

The character will be modified.

Diorama

concept art dioramas

______________________________________________________________________________________

 

 

PROJECT SUPPORT

With the support of the project from $ 100 you get a box. You can choose a branded CD with a game or a branded USB flash drive. Also you get posters, music, magnets

 

 

With the support of the project from $ 250 gets all of the above in an increased amount, as well as a T-shirt, mug, key chains.

 

 

With the support of the project from $ 500 get all of the above in an increased amount and a character's figure

 

limited edition collection box

 

With the support of the project from $ 1000 gets all of the above in an increased amount and diorama scenes from the game

 

With the support of the project from $ 5000 gets all of the above in an increased amount. You become a sponsor of the project and take part in creating a corporate identity for souvenirs and design new levels of the game. And as you will receive free of charge all subsequent projects for free.

 

The game will be released in Steam in the spring of 2019, regardless of the results of the campaign. Indiegogo will simply allow us to step out of the shadows and collect a certain amount of money, which will be spent on adding new content, better localization and product customization.
story_txt:
Gameplay

 
                                   CHARACTER                                                    The character will be modified.Dioramaconcept art dioramas______________________________________________________________________________________  PROJECT SUPPORTWith the support of the project from $ 100 you get a box. You can choose a branded CD with a game or a branded USB flash drive. Also you get posters, music, magnets  With the support of the project from $ 250 gets all of the above in an increased amount, as well as a T-shirt, mug, key chains.  With the support of the project from $ 500 get all of the above in an increased amount and a character's figure limited edition collection box With the support of the project from $ 1000 gets all of the above in an increased amount and diorama scenes from the game With the support of the project from $ 5000 gets all of the above in an increased amount. You become a sponsor of the project and take part in creating a corporate identity for souvenirs and design new levels of the game. And as you will receive free of charge all subsequent projects for free. The game will be released in Steam in the spring of 2019, regardless of the results of the campaign. Indiegogo will simply allow us to step out of the shadows and collect a certain amount of money, which will be spent on adding new content, better localization and product customization.

story:
Greetings to our dear supporters and viewers!

Thank you for dropping by our Indiegogo Campaign.

A quick update! We are using Fixed Funding model.
In other words, your valued contribution will be returned back to you should we not reach at least USD$48,000 by the end of the campaign.

More Details about the game can be found under the Updates Tab! 


More game demos can be found at our playlist on Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLv1cpKsv...

Here is a quick introduction to our team:

Ivan and Ah Keong – Lead programmers 

Xian Wen and Yan Yan – Animator and Artists

Flex – Music / Composer

Lences – Game Designer

We were brought together by our common belief and passion to entertain our audience primarily with our games. Why mobile games? We realized that from teenagers to adults, from grand-children to grand-parents, everyone is fascinated and captivated by the contents from their mobile phones almost everywhere we go.

Our latest game idea revolves around man’s best companions, pets. We are seeking your help to fund our mobile game project, Petmon, a mobile game where one’s pet can accompany one wherever one goes.

Of course! Our team, made up of computer engineering graduates who are gaming fanatics ourselves, came together in early 2014 to come up with games for gamers. We have launched, with success, our iOS version of the game The Cloudwalker Kumo Sha in early 2015, and the Android version of the same game in late 2015, which is now available on both the Apple App Store, and the Google Play Store. 


Apart from getting the funds required for our development, the team would like to use the campaign to find out the acceptance level of our game idea by the community. This is a very important step in our game design, and this will allow us to improve and enhance on our existing plans.

As such, we have selected to go on a Fixed Funding Model, where it's all or nothing.

The funds will provide the team with the additional resources required to bring the game to its next level - the launch on both iOS and Android.

How the funds will be used:

a. Design Enhancements

Your funds, coupled with your feedback gathered during the campaign, will greatly aid us in going back to the drawing board and storyboard to make improvements to the game details. With the your feedback and support, we will be able to come back with a game that has a theme which appeals more to the players.

b. Development
We will provide the full-version of the game to our players as soon as possible. With the funds raised, we can increase the manpower of our development team, and also on-board freelancers to speed up the entire development process.

Cooperation with freelancers is the preferred development method for us, as we need to exercise prudence in keeping the operations and running costs low for our team until we start generating revenue from the games.

c. Graphics and Animation
We understand that graphics and attractive animations go a long way in keeping our players happy. It provides them with the entertainment they can enjoy from the game. With the funding in this area, we strive not only to bring about new characters, but also to enhance on existing actions and expressions of our game characters to provide players with pleasant surprises from time to time.

d. Admin and Operations
This portion basically accounts for the platform fees (at 5% of Campaign Target) and payment charges for Paypal (3 to 5%). 

e. Soundtrack and Effects
We are very fortunate to have in our midst a talented music composer. He has composed a soothing and welcoming ensemble for our game. Composed with the different game scenes in mind, the soundtracks and background music seek to immerse our players into the game.

With additional funds, our composer can concentrate on the soundtracks, while seeking suitable sound effects for our pets, shops, purchases, and in-game navigation. 

f. Infrastructure
In order to support a multiplayer environment, we have decided to utilise Photon for our game. The funds will be used to support the cloud licensing for Photon.

In addition to the above, in order to ensure that our players are able to connect to the games, and experience the game without any lagging or delay. Funds will also be used to enhance our existing game servers.

g. Marketing
What good is a great game without exposure to the public? Low download rates, low participation rates, and then *gasp*, silent disappearance of the game.

To ensure that the game reaches out to the targeted audience, the team has drafted a simple marketing plan using Facebook as the primary advertisement media. Facebook advertising allows marketers to select the targeted region, age-ranges, profiles of users with which the game will be showcased to.

Additionally, apart from presenting the games to the targeted audiences via Facebook and gaming blogs, the team plans to take part in at least one marketing event supported by Games Solution Centre Singapore (GSC). GSC helps indie game studios market their games and capabilities to game publishers all around the globe, thus presenting enterprising and structured indie game studios with the chance to promote their games outside of their home country. However, the indie studios will have to shoulder part of the air fares, accommodation expenses to ensure that GSC helps serious indie studios. 

Thus, the marketing funds here will be utilised to the max to ensure the success of the Game Studio and the games.

We sincerely seek your generous support, to help us in achieving our goal, and finally, to bring PetMon to the charts on both Apple App Store and Google Play Store!

story:
There once was a fabulous city, that the Gods have build over the mortals' heads. They have created a special place, designed for the worthiest of heroes, for the bravest and the brightest of them all. A place named Dicehalla. To get there one does not have to storm the impenetrable fortresses, or defeat any mythical titans, or behead ancient dragons. You simply need to be a Tabletop Legend! Have you beaten all your opponents in UNO without breaking a sweat? Or maybe you have collected all the legendary cards in MTG? Or the bards dedicate their songs to your DnD character? Congratulations are in order then, buddy, you have been granted a place in Dicehalla! You are one of the luckiest fellas, off to have the time of their lives in the magnificent halls of the Nerd Heaven. It all goes pretty smoothly and the things run their course, until one day, some unknown force rocks Dicehalla to the core, and the world, as you remember it, collapses. Everyone you know are a part of a tabletop game now, and you are but a Meeple, with a long path ahead you to take. What happened? Who is there to blame? And what has the Odin's ever-watchful eye been so distracted by? The answers to these questions await you in our epic adventure - Road to Dicehalla!

 

 

 

 

 

 

We have chosen the beloved and well-known Norse mythology as a foundation of our setting and mixed it with the tabletop culture and specificities. Our goal is to summarize the great diversity of our favorite games and to pass on all that combined experience to you in our Legendary Adventure. But also - to create a magical world you can explore with your friends at times when it's impossible to gather together in real life. We have found our inspiration in various tabletop titles, such as Talisman, Eldritch Horror, Descent, Runebound, Andor, Pathfinder, D&D, Darkest Night, Mansions of Madness, The Others and of course - Munchkin, UNO and Monopoly (yeah, we know, don't judge).
Dicehalla is a world full of pop culture references, famous characters and myths coming to life, all wrapped up in a sparkly humorous adventure.

 

 

 

 

The core mechanics of our game is a piece of cake - just throw the dice!


 

You set your foot on an endless road, filled with exciting meetings and many dangers, and the only way to go is forward, up until you hit a city or a camp. From there you can travel to any safe zone you've visited before or walk any known path again - every time you follow the same route it's completely unique, for the events are generated up as you go.

 

 

The Road to Dicehalla is paved with classic squares of various type.

 

 

 

Create your perfect protagonist using the huge pull of appearance modificators.

 

 

While you are on the road you have an access to the main chat, though with some limitations: you can communicate only with stickers. But that's not the case in cities. Once you are in a safe zone you are free to join the text channel for socialization or group searching and to quickly find new friends for the group quests or dungeons.

 

 


 

To put it simply - the city is a saving spot where you can find a company,

rest and gear up for your adventures. 

 

 

 

 

 

Upon entering a hot zone you roll the dices to gain energy, as does your opponent. Spend your energy to attack, defend yourself or apply any conditional effects to your foes. You cannot refuse the fight! Go big or go home, bud.




The spells and special abilities in The Meeple Story are presented by different cards, each with its own features, type and cost. You can carry a deck of 20 cards total and you're given 5 random cards from your deck at the beginning of the battle. As a card in your active hand is used it goes into the discard pile and you draw a new card from your deck. When the deck is empty, you take all your discarded cards, shuffle them and gain a set of 5 random cards again.
Build your own unique deck for every occasion!

 


 

 



Every ability card presents its own playing style: you can be a healer, a damage dealer, or a tank. Your class is formed by the cards in your deck. For example, if the healing spells prevail in your deck, then the game will define you as a priest. If your deck consists of damaging and healing abilities equally, you will be seen as a paladin. Don't be afraid to experiment - sometimes the most daring combinations tend to lead to most curious results.



 

 


 



 

Each of these parameters will help you maximize your performance in the battle: the bigger the stats, the stronger your spells and abilities are. Your parameters grow by every level but you can also boost them with special items and a bit of magic.

 


 

 

 

You will find 2 types of equipment in The Meeple Story - weapons and necklaces. They affect your stats and your passive abilities, some of these items can even change your character's appearance. You have one slot for your weapon and one slot for the necklace. Use them wisely!

 

 

 

Strength lies in unity. And there are some trials that will pose a challenge for a lone wolf. However, we have some good news! Our game is MMO for a reason. Yes, you got it right: you can fight for Dicehalla's freedom with your friends, adversaries or just some random passers-by who won't be that easy to get rid off. 

 

 


 

The dungeon is a restricted area, section of the Great Road, filled with mighty opponents, dangerous bosses, a story and some problems you and your teammates have to solve.
To enter a dungeon you must talk to a Dungeon Master in a city, wait up until your party of 4 companions is full and then proceed forward to glory and epic loot! Every dungeon has its own Master but as you complete an instance you will be allowed to sign up there again with the help of any Master from any city.

 

 


 

When the party is gathered the system will automatically choose the leader and unleash your group into the road of pain and suffering (but of loot and fun as well). The leader is responsible for the party's progress and gets a hold of the movement dice. As you step on a Hunting Square you activate a fight. Each player is given 30 seconds to decide their next action. If you run out of time or you have an AFC player in your group - do not fear! The system will make a choice for you. You gain an increased experience and reward for every won battle, and defeating a boss may grant you some rare equipment, spell, cosmetic item or a pet.
Dungeons are usually full of traps and random events that will put your party's resilience and intellect to the test. And don't forget about the choices! Everybody loves choices, right?
In the end of each dungeon you will have to decide how your run ends. The players will choose the most preferable path and roll the dice. The winner's option will be final for the group.

 

 




You don't have to become allies with the first person that comes along of course. Who said that you're here to make fast friends? Screw 'em all. Especially that guy. Once you step on a square where someone else is standing already, feel free to challenge them to a AI fight and force them back from your spot. That's right: no one gets in your way! But beware: when your fresh-made enemies are back in game they will know who is to blame for their loss of progress and dishonor. Next time they see you on the map they will recognize you by a special nemesis mark and will have an advantage against you in the following battle. And so the endless circle of meeple bloodshed begins... You could have just passed by, you know?

 

 


 


Combat bonuses and muscle mass are not the only stats that you can upgrade for your Hero. They've got emotions, their own exceptional temperament, and it is in your power to influence their personal growth. You will get a certain reputation based on your choices and decisions, and the locals will judge you by it. If you are a known scoundrel and are famous for kicking old ladies and throwing litter on the streets then the humble and lawful NPCs will treat you with distrust and will avoid talking to you. On the other hand, of you're noble and kind to people the same NPCs will be overjoyed to see you and will be happy to give you quests. Maybe they will even shower you in gifts just because you are that cool.

 

 

The Meeple Story contains two types of quests: main quests and side-quests. The former can't be skipped, though missing the latter is pretty easy, so if you have the spirit of a true Achiever and want to collect all possible rewards for every quest out there, you will have to visit the same location more than once. It's going to require some dedication and the most thorough exploration but it will certainly pay off.
There are multiple quests in the various explorable areas that will adapt to your meeple's personality, so the chances that you will find a truly unique scenario are high.

 

 

We're planning on adding three big story arcs to the game, each of them full of exciting adventures, funny plot-twists, alternative universes and epic explosions. On your journey you will have to resolve various conflicts, and each successful outcome will bring you closer to your ultimate quest - saving the world!



As you travel throughout the world you will see some familiar faces and meet the heroes who will help you (or mess with you) while you are on your very important mission. 

 

 

Loki - a long-time friend and an adviser to Odin. The god of mischief and lies as well. Don't ever play cards with him. 
Odin - the Great and Mighty. Our king and god, also just a great guy in general. There word is, he's starting to lose his grip lately, buuuuut we still love him.
Mamon - the local dealer. You can buy anything from him. For a price.
Hel is... Well, no one knows where she came from and what she wants, but there's talk of her magnificent cookies... made of blood of her enemies.
Thor - the son of Odin, gone missing during the events in Dicehalla. Whereabouts are unknown.
Sif - Thor's wife. She's cleaning up the mess left by her husband's sudden disappearance. Wild wolves ain't gonna hunt themselves down!
Torrel - the gentlest of souls in a body of a muscular hunter. Has a soft spot for butterflies.
Mimir - the famous stand-up comic. A little big-headed for his size, though.
Bob. Just Bob.

And many others too!

 

 

 

 

 

In addition to valuable stuff you can also find some cool but mostly useless trinkets - just to show off to your friends and enemies. It won't be easy to acquire them but it's totally worth it. Who else gets to boast of a singing sword made of Earth's core?

 

 

Who needs those old-fashioned town bards? You can buff yourself on the road, using field alchemy. CAUTION: possibility of explosions, vomiting, death.

 

 

The road can get lonely when you walk alone. It may be a good idea to find a companion or two to keep your company. 

 

 

Collect items and herbs for crafting on your way to Dicehalla, but be careful! Danger lurks around every corner!

 

 

So, yeah, sure, Scandinavia is awesome! But what about... pirate dinosaurs from outer space?! The Meeple Story offers you plenty unique locations and settings to explore - literally for anyone's taste. Have you ever wanted to see a viking in a western? Yeah, we neither. But we've got them, buddy! 

 

 


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


 


 

 


We are a really small team, and this project is really big and time-consuming. That is the reason why we are starting our journey here on Indiegogo - to expand and create something truly worthwhile.

We have an experience of developing smaller projects, not as ambitious in comparison, but here, with Meeple Story we are taking it to a whole new level. We are ready to fight for this game, no matter how successful is this campaign - it's only a matter of time, not quality.

We all are pretty realistic people and we do realize that creating of Meeple Story will take A LOT of our time and effort and we are ready for it. We grew to love this story with all our hearts and we sincerely hope that you guys will love it as well.

 


 

Alex Yudakov - background artist, UX/UI designer

Alex is responsible for the backgrounds and the interface design of our game. Working as an art director in an advertising company, has more than 10 years of designing experience, advertising, web and apps design. Took a liking to games developing about three years ago, has been working on projects for iOS and Android. Our rational head.

Ivan Stepanov - game designer, character artist

Ivan is our lead artist, designer and the sweetest human being just in general. It was him who drew all those precious little meeples and he is the person who is responsible for all our characters' design. Has an experience in designing games for advertising companies and creating games and interfaces for mobile apps. Been drawing since he was in nappies. Maybe even before. Fancies tabletop games, collects and even creates some new ones for his friends and family.

Svetlana Kalashnikova - Narrative Designer, Community Manager
Svetlana is responsible for the story and narrative parts of our game. A graduated graphic designer, she works on video game advertising, and also has an experience in narrative design for mobile games. Adores cats and DnD. Loves games.


Ivan Sisoev - composer and sound-disigner

Ivan has written that awesome soundtrack of our beautiful trailer. Not just the music itself, but every sound, as well. Ivan calls himself a composer, believing that every sound is an element of a bigger system and always belongs to a composition. Above all he appreciates the mood that the sound sets, and not just its sounding. For example - the tune in the end of our trailer is depicting a brave, but a little bit clumsy hero, crossing the river, leaping from rock to rock. No one's actually leaping there, in the trailer itself - but the sound can tell us a little story nonetheless.

Things Ivan is proud of the most (besides various games and videos) are his work with Mercedes-Benz, collaboration with one of the biggest russian TV-networks and creation of ambient sound for public city places.


Ricko - animator

Rick is our animator. He breaths life into our little meeple creations, makes fire move naturally, clouds float and spells sparkle with thousands of stars. Rick is a great professional, an amazing clipmaker and he has done dozens of fantastic videos in his life. Worked with Paramount Comedy at some point. His works can be found here.

Rustam Kuchumov - programmer

Rustam is our amazing programmer. Has a significant experience in developing, including augmented reality projects, MMO and simple mobile arcade games. A big fan of RPGs, complex stories and numbers.


Special thanks to:


Darkk Mane for his awesome voice acting skills and generally being such a nice dude.
Valeria and Anastasia for helping us translating this page so we won't screw anything up, 
and also our moms and dads and also grandmas, we love you, guys!

The winner's option will be final for the group.  You don't have to become allies with the first person that comes along of course. Who said that you're here to make fast friends? Screw 'em all. Especially that guy. Once you step on a square where someone else is standing already, feel free to challenge them to a AI fight and force them back from your spot. That's right: no one gets in your way! But beware: when your fresh-made enemies are back in game they will know who is to blame for their loss of progress and dishonor. Next time they see you on the map they will recognize you by a special nemesis mark and will have an advantage against you in the following battle. And so the endless circle of meeple bloodshed begins... You could have just passed by, you know?  

 Combat bonuses and muscle mass are not the only stats that you can upgrade for your Hero. They've got emotions, their own exceptional temperament, and it is in your power to influence their personal growth. You will get a certain reputation based on your choices and decisions, and the locals will judge you by it. If you are a known scoundrel and are famous for kicking old ladies and throwing litter on the streets then the humble and lawful NPCs will treat you with distrust and will avoid talking to you. On the other hand, of you're noble and kind to people the same NPCs will be overjoyed to see you and will be happy to give you quests. Maybe they will even shower you in gifts just because you are that cool.  The Meeple Story contains two types of quests: main quests and side-quests. The former can't be skipped, though missing the latter is pretty easy, so if you have the spirit of a true Achiever and want to collect all possible rewards for every quest out there, you will have to visit the same location more than once. It's going to require some dedication and the most thorough exploration but it will certainly pay off.There are multiple quests in the various explorable areas that will adapt to your meeple's personality, so the chances that you will find a truly unique scenario are high.  We're planning on adding three big story arcs to the game, each of them full of exciting adventures, funny plot-twists, alternative universes and epic explosions. On your journey you will have to resolve various conflicts, and each successful outcome will bring you closer to your ultimate quest - saving the world!As you travel throughout the world you will see some familiar faces and meet the heroes who will help you (or mess with you) while you are on your very important mission.   Loki - a long-time friend and an adviser to Odin. The god of mischief and lies as well. Don't ever play cards with him. Odin - the Great and Mighty. Our king and god, also just a great guy in general. There word is, he's starting to lose his grip lately, buuuuut we still love him.Mamon - the local dealer. You can buy anything from him. For a price.Hel is... Well, no one knows where she came from and what she wants, but there's talk of her magnificent cookies... made of blood of her enemies.Thor - the son of Odin, gone missing during the events in Dicehalla. Whereabouts are unknown.Sif - Thor's wife. She's cleaning up the mess left by her husband's sudden disappearance. Wild wolves ain't gonna hunt themselves down!Torrel - the gentlest of souls in a body of a muscular hunter. Has a soft spot for butterflies.Mimir - the famous stand-up comic. A little big-headed for his size, though.Bob. Just Bob.And many others too!     In addition to valuable stuff you can also find some cool but mostly useless trinkets - just to show off to your friends and enemies. It won't be easy to acquire them but it's totally worth it. Who else gets to boast of a singing sword made of Earth's core?  Who needs those old-fashioned town bards? You can buff yourself on the road, using field alchemy. CAUTION: possibility of explosions, vomiting, death.  The road can get lonely when you walk alone. It may be a good idea to find a companion or two to keep your company.   Collect items and herbs for crafting on your way to Dicehalla, but be careful! Danger lurks around every corner!  So, yeah, sure, Scandinavia is awesome! But what about... pirate dinosaurs from outer space?! The Meeple Story offers you plenty unique locations and settings to explore - literally for anyone's taste. Have you ever wanted to see a viking in a western? Yeah, we neither. But we've got them, buddy!              We are a really small team, and this project is really big and time-consuming. That is the reason why we are starting our journey here on Indiegogo - to expand and create something truly worthwhile.We have an experience of developing smaller projects, not as ambitious in comparison, but here, with Meeple Story we are taking it to a whole new level. We are ready to fight for this game, no matter how successful is this campaign - it's only a matter of time, not quality.We all are pretty realistic people and we do realize that creating of Meeple Story will take A LOT of our time and effort and we are ready for it. We grew to love this story with all our hearts and we sincerely hope that you guys will love it as well.  Alex Yudakov - background artist, UX/UI designerAlex is responsible for the backgrounds and the interface design of our game. Working as an art director in an advertising company, has more than 10 years of designing experience, advertising, web and apps design. Took a liking to games developing about three years ago, has been working on projects for iOS and Android. Our rational head.Ivan Stepanov - game designer, character artistIvan is our lead artist, designer and the sweetest human being just in general. It was him who drew all those precious little meeples and he is the person who is responsible for all our characters' design. Has an experience in designing games for advertising companies and creating games and interfaces for mobile apps. Been drawing since he was in nappies. Maybe even before. Fancies tabletop games, collects and even creates some new ones for his friends and family.Svetlana Kalashnikova - Narrative Designer, Community ManagerSvetlana is responsible for the story and narrative parts of our game. A graduated graphic designer, she works on video game advertising, and also has an experience in narrative design for mobile games. Adores cats and DnD. Loves games.Ivan Sisoev - composer and sound-disignerIvan has written that awesome soundtrack of our beautiful trailer. Not just the music itself, but every sound, as well. Ivan calls himself a composer, believing that every sound is an element of a bigger system and always belongs to a composition. Above all he appreciates the mood that the sound sets, and not just its sounding. For example - the tune in the end of our trailer is depicting a brave, but a little bit clumsy hero, crossing the river, leaping from rock to rock. No one's actually leaping there, in the trailer itself - but the sound can tell us a little story nonetheless.Things Ivan is proud of the most (besides various games and videos) are his work with Mercedes-Benz, collaboration with one of the biggest russian TV-networks and creation of ambient sound for public city places.Ricko - animatorRick is our animator. He breaths life into our little meeple creations, makes fire move naturally, clouds float and spells sparkle with thousands of stars. Rick is a great professional, an amazing clipmaker and he has done dozens of fantastic videos in his life. Worked with Paramount Comedy at some point. His works can be found here.Rustam Kuchumov - programmerRustam is our amazing programmer. Has a significant experience in developing, including augmented reality projects, MMO and simple mobile arcade games. A big fan of RPGs, complex stories and numbers.Special thanks to:Darkk Mane for his awesome voice acting skills and generally being such a nice dude.Valeria and Anastasia for helping us translating this page so we won't screw anything up, and also our moms and dads and also grandmas, we love you, guys!

story:
Hi guys! For those that are wondering why we didn't create this campaign through Kickstarter, it was due to some geographical issues with our creators; our studio is based in Japan, and Kickstarter requires transactions to be conducted in the US or EU.

However, we want to publicly thank MiKandiJapan for supporting us with setting up an additional campaign!

They've done an excellent job promoting Libra of the Vampire Princess, and they will continue to help us out! Stay tuned for more information!
